Reviews.Title: “Best Location In San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Drew T
Reviews.Content: We are so happy that we found this hotel. It is a great spot if you are looking to enjoy the beach and what San Diego has to offer. The hotel has amazing gardens and a private beach. We took our children age 3 and 6 with us and this hotel make it stress free. They suite we had was bran spanking new and I think we were the first one to ever use the kitchen in it. The kitchen area had a full size fridge and that was amazing to find in a hotel today. Everything was new from the bed to the TV. It looks like they are almost finished with all the rooms being renovated. Our suite had a huge balcony that over looked the bay. We would end our day with a glass of wine relaxing and watching an amazing sunset. They have a cocktail boat that is free for the guest and if you bring kids you have to go early because at some point they restrict it to just 21 and up. Another great thing about this resort is that you can drive up to your room so hauling all the beach toys and luggage was easy. We love that the parking is free, especially since we are at the beach. The also do not charge for the internet and that was great. While we were their we asked about the summer rates and they were a bit higher but when we called their reservations line they told us about their face book page and if you become a fan on it you can save 15% using their link off the page. We booked our summer and saved a bunch. We are already looking forward to our July trip. Thanks Bahia for a GREAT stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Wanda M
Reviews.Content: I had a good stay at this facility in Feb. 2012, however, it is in need of renovations. If you're ok with a dated facility and look past its aging status, the location is ideal with rooms facing the bay quite enjoyable. Its only a couple of blocks from the ocean beach and was ideal for some great power walking. There's also a complimentary paddle wheeler ride through the bay to their sister hotel on Friday/Saturday nights which was quite enjoyable. Not a five star but an enjoyable get away from the Canadian cold in February.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Resort in San Diego is GREAT.”
Reviews.Author: kingj24
Reviews.Content: The Bahia is great, I researched all of San Diego for a place to stay, we were so pleased. It is quiet being an inlet but you can go around the corner and you are in the center of things to do. You can catch the bus in front of the resort and go all over the city. When we go back it will be to the Bahia Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Location for Adults or Family”
Reviews.Author: skittlebean
Reviews.Content: I'm a local but wanted a night out down by the beach. This large property located near both the action of the beach and the quieter bay side was perfect for the night.Our room was large and decorated nicely. The bathroom was a bit tight and I was surprised there was no hair dryer. The TV was an old tube TV but we weren't there to watch TV. The bed was comfortable with lots of pillows and we didn't hear any noise from the hall even though we were next to the guest laundry. The staff was very friendly and helpful. I look forward to staying here again and bringing the family to enjoy all of the ammenities.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia - Great if you like noise...”
Reviews.Author: 4birds
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Bahia March 22, 2012 - March 25, 2012. The hotel location is great as is close to Sea World however both Friday night and Saturday night the Bahia becomes a large party zone. The noise lasted til 12:30am Friday night and Saturday we actully decided to just leave around 11:30pm since there was no sleeping. There were two weddings at the hotel. Our room was on the 3rd floor and the wedding receptions were on the 5th floor. Our room became a boom box - thus there was no sleeping. This would be a great hotel if you wanted to stay awake and party but not great for families and if you want to sleep after a busy day...

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: lyon6666
Reviews.Content: I seriously can't believe people gave this place good reviews...wonderful? Clean? This is the most disgusting place I've ever stayed at. We wanted to move hotels as soon as we got there, but everything was sold out! It looks beautiful in the pictures, but entering the parking lot, we were beyond shocked. We got the "Garden Studio", which was in the back. The room was damp, mildewy, moldy, and everything was dirty and worn. The comforters on the beds were so worn and dingy looking. I don't think the floor had ever been cleaned. We have 2 toddlers and it disgusted me that they were walking around the room barefoot. As soon as we got back home, I disinfected everything that came in contact with that place. And at $270/night? I seriously could not believe they charged that much for what was basically a flea-bag motel. Also the food is beyond disgusting. We ate at the "restaurant" the first night and the food was inedible. I will say, the grounds are absolutely beautiful, full of lush tropical plants. The beach area is very nice. They are sitting on a gold mine if they would do a complete renovation. It is no "resort". I am reading the reviews again of this place that people left and STILL can't believe the good reviews it got!

Reviews.Title: “Noise unacceptable but otherwise a nice resort”
Reviews.Author: Gail N
Reviews.Content: The Bahia Resort is nice. The staff is courteous and the rooms are clean. The pool and the hot tub are clean. Just do not expect to sleep. Our "Garden Room" was on the fourth floor overlooking the parking lot. The fifth floor is the banquet room. Both Friday and Saturday night messages were left to notify us of 'events' that evening. Needless to say things were quite noisy into the morning hours and parking spaces were hard to find. Each morning, starting at about 5:30 AM things started to get moved around upstairs and in the parking lot, which made sleep impossible. If you stay here absolutely insist on a room away from the hotel building by the entrance to the resort, do NOT let them talk you into an 'upgraded' room in the building by the parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Resort wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Jennifer S
Reviews.Content: We were very impressed with everything at this resort, Large clean rooms/wonderful beach/lush green spaces/staff are so friendly and helpful! Highly recommend this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Great get away experience”
Reviews.Author: Penny C
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this resort was outstanding. Restaurant menu and meals were marvelous. Front desk and room service staff were friendly and accomidating. The rooms in our suite were spacious along with balcony views of the bay that were amazing. New furniture and bedding were comfortable. Location was a perfect walking distance for shopping, dinning on the board walk, and casual strolls on the beach. I definitely plan for a return visit soon. Highly recommended Bahia Resort Hotel to my family and friends. Undeniably a great price for such a nice hotel within a great location found nestled away on Mission Bay in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business meeting!”
Reviews.Author: michellekb
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 3 day stay at this resort for a business meeting. The customer service, meeting rooms, bar, and food were very good! View of the Bay and within walking distance to the Beach. 25 employees from our company stayed there. Yes, the rooms are a variety from bungalows to suites with fireplaces in a tower building. Looks like it may have been originally built in the 60's but most rooms (per my collegues and my own experience) were nicely remodeled. I stayed in a private bungalow with private patio and parking spot and it was decorated like any 3 star Hilton/Marriott hotel that I usually stay in. Overall, the resort is a little nostalgic, but that's what makes it unique. All 25 of us loved this resort. But if you want fancy, maybe this is not for you. The view from the meeting room in the Tower building was gorgeous overlooking the bay! We walked to the beach (maybe 1/2 mile) to sight see and go to the Wave House beach restaurant! Great evening! Beds were good too, and that's important to me. Enjoy!

Reviews.Title: “Great, As Long As You Know...”
Reviews.Author: JamieElise
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a fancy hotel. It is not even mid-range. It is kitschy and dated. You wouldn't be surprised to see the guy from Caddyshack walk out in his anchor blazer, hat and boat shoes. I think it has a jazzy 70's soundtrack on loop. If you want Hyatt or Hilton or Omni, you should go there. I have stayed at them all, and I still like Bahia better. This place is like the beach cabin your parents rented when you were a kid (if you were a kid in the 70s or early 80s). Why I love it: I got a huge studio with an econo-kitchen for a great price. My kids had their own bed (family of 4) that wasn't a pull-out sofa. Our room was right on the edge of the resort, which is surrounded by sandy, quiet beaches. You can almost always find a side that isn't windy. The staff was irreverant and great. I lived in San Diego for long enough to know that you don't go to San Diego without renting a car. The hotel is close to everything, when you are talking about Southern California close. There's a freeway everywhere you drive and very few things are walkable. Also, cabs are super expensive. Rent a car. I almost hate to write this review because I don't really want Bahia to change and I love the quiet pool, the workers puttering around the property, and the obvious San Diego natives who were hanging out by the play area drinking a beer between whatever keeps them busy every day.

Reviews.Title: “An older resort but very clean and well located”
Reviews.Author: BeachbabyCalgary
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort through a vacation package. It was an older resort but very clean and some nice extra features like getting a free pass on the Bahia Belle. The front desk and restaurant staff were very friendly and efficient. The room, especially the bathroom could use some repairs but over all was nice and the bed was comfy. One of the features that attracted us to this resort was the bays on both sides. We could hear noise in our room from the ballroom upstairs hosting a wedding but I think it was coming from the ballroom's open windows because I didn't hear much in the hallway. The front desk called us the following day to tell us there would be another wedding upstairs but we didn't hear much noise with that wedding. But overall it was a great hotel and a nice getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Retro Restort--Close to Everything”
Reviews.Author: Pete4633
Reviews.Content: Loved the retro feeling of this restort; Stayed for a long weekend in October; Loved the beach and the seals; The restaurant had an excellent breakfast buffet; The room was large with a kitchen and king size bed; They were remodeling some of the rooms. About 2 blocks from the Ocean and very close to Sea World. Would definitely stay here again and would recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great place!”
Reviews.Author: Ron B
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, nice rooms, close to the beach, what else can you want? We were just there for a convention and it all went smoothly. They pulled off a meeting of over 200 without a hitch. The hotel covers a peninsula into Mission Bay so you have your own uncrowded sandy beach. The hot tub is huge. It was comfortable with 20+ in it. The rooms are a touch outdated but it's only a minor deal. It feels like you are miles away from civilization. Cool.

Reviews.Title: “Nice location!!”
Reviews.Author: Ruhk
Reviews.Content: This hotel needs a remodel. I have had several meetings there. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Great location right on the bay and walking distants to the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Walking distance to the beach”
Reviews.Author: Junebug15
Reviews.Content: Nice location... walking distance to the beach. One bedroom with a large den, couch and flat screen tv. Kitchen with oven, microwave, small 2 cup coffee pot, small fridge, stove. Water in the shower never got hot.... luke warm showers.... finally was told to turn on the sinks with cold water and let it run while taking a shower and that would solve the problem. It made for a warmer shower... but still not hot. We did get a small discount when we left because of the problem. A sewer smell came out of the sinks and water once in awhile... You could hear the water loudly next door or upstairs coming down the pipes in the wall. Just make sure you have an upgrade like we did... otherwise you might not be in a nice room.... Yes, the rooms are older.. but they were fine and served the purpose ...

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: gpstevens
Reviews.Content: We should have read other Trip Advisor comments more carefully. We chose the four nights for three special, on the waterfront, in a one story attached unit. The property is more than a walking distance to any services such as a restaurant or coffee shop. We arrived by taxi after 6 pm on a flight from Victoria BC via Seattle on Valentine's Day. No one in the reservation or concierge areas told us that the restaurtant and bar were closed for renovations and that we should reserve a seat at the temporary dining area set up on the top floor of the high rise. We were not admitted until the manager of events saw what was happening and quickly arranged a table for us. Good for her! The weather had turned wintery and the heating system in the unit had to be set full blast to stay above shivering all night. We got what we paid for I suppose but I would recommend this resort only for someone with a vehicle and with little expectations. The view is amazing and the potential is enormous but this place is a hotel searching for someone with vision and bucks. We will never go there again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Sarah B
Reviews.Content: We asked for a room with a sea view and were given one with a patio that lead right out on to the beach! It was very relaxing. The hotel could do with a spruce up but it had a lot of charm. Also, we were given free tickets to a cute little bay cruise that went from right outside our room. Liked: the price, location, free parking, private beach and two rescued seals that we watched being fed. And the harbour cruise. Didn't like: the hotel itself is a bit old and dingy, but for me the location made up for that. Also, all staff were very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Overall, it's a nice a place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Foster4413
Reviews.Content: The landscaping is very nice. You can kind of tell that it is an older hotel that has been re-done. The rooms are pretty good, but there are some parts that you can tell are aged. For the most part the service was good. However, we ordered early check in and didn't get it. They also said they would call when it was ready, but didn't. Other than that I was pretty happy with the hotel. I would stay away from the hotel cafe. Terrible service and way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Staff was the best!”
Reviews.Author: paula j
Reviews.Content: Mike at front desk was the nicest guy ever! The room is a little outdated, but the price is just right! and the location is phenomenal! Really liked it and recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Just okay?”
Reviews.Author: Bummer1145
Reviews.Content: The hotel was average at best. We had to change rooms when we arrived there because our room was musty smelling. The view was great right on the bay but everything was closed because we went off season. The hot tub was cold and they didn't clean the rooms very good. I would not stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for business meetings!”
Reviews.Author: CrickandWatson
Reviews.Content: Dated, but I appreciated the full kitchen. Beach on the bay was outside my door. Way cool for business meetings. Walkable albeit on a busy street to other restaurants and the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: Beth K
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia in February of 2011. It was a family vacation (2 adults, 2 kids 9 and 12) The grounds are really pretty, lush and tropical, and it's a wonderful central location as long as you have a car. It's close to the beach and the boardwalk amusement park which my kids loved. The weather was cool while we were there, but we used the enormous hot tub everyday. The kids loved walking along the lagoon, and watching the rescued seals on the property (or were they sea lions? I can't remember) The staff was very friendly and helpful. The rooms and bathrooms were just OK. A bit rundown, but clean and it was nice to have a fridge, coffee maker, microwave and toaster. It was also nice not to be nickeled and dimed to death with extra parking and resort charges. We even got a few chits for free breakfast. The rooms were no frills, but we'd stay again

Reviews.Title: “The hotel that time (and cleaning products) forgot”
Reviews.Author: magsinpoland
Reviews.Content: Not used to writing poor reviews but this was a really bad experience. So we arrived during less-than-average weather conditions, but still that didn't excuse the instant feeling of "do we really have to sleep here?" Ok, so the 3 rooms we saw all seemed to have contained the original (badly) repainted furniture from the 1960's which could have been great in a shabby chic kind of way, had it not been for the smell, stains, and even holes in the soft furnishings. It was cold and damp and the room heating didn't work, we were freezing in a horribly smelling room, but having been shown our alternatives, this was the best of the lot. We stayed one night, but couldn't face a second, so checked out. Perhaps there are better renovated rooms, so if considering this hotel I would say be careful about what standard of room you are booking - ours was a standard twin room.

Reviews.Title: “Location makes it”
Reviews.Author: mcksh
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the "tower" 3rd floor facing the bay. Generously sized, recently renovated, and with a kitchenette - the room was fine, the view was splendid. Small glitches like a coffee pot that didn't fit the coffee maker (keeping the filter cone from draining unless you push the pot upwards and held it there). Service was warm and friendly. Beautiful landscaped grounds and the location on the bay make it a place I'll remember and come back to.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!”
Reviews.Author: Maggie J
Reviews.Content: We are from the midwest and stayed at the Bahia Resort January 20-23, 2012 and were extremely impressed with this hotel resort. Our room was a Bay View Suite. It was lovely...very nicely decorated The beds were comfy. Every morning I would get up and watch the rowing teams practice on the bay from our balcony. It was very peaceful and relaxing. The Bahia is a very clean property. We ate in the restaurant twice and I would rate it as average for a hotel restaurant. The property is very near the pacific ocean and Mission Beach. We would definitely stay here again and will recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Old Property, but good response to requests for repairs and all else”
Reviews.Author: sharoth2
Reviews.Content: Beautiful area, very accommodating staff. Restaurant- food excellent and reasonably priced.

Reviews.Title: “Been coming here for sixteen years!”
Reviews.Author: gailnick
Reviews.Content: The location of this hotel is beautiful, the rooms are comfortable and the staff is very friendly. Over the years I have come to a variety of meetings at the Bahia, and always am happy to get to come back.

Reviews.Title: “AWSOME !!!!”
Reviews.Author: happyonvacation44
Reviews.Content: I was so impressed with this resort.I had read some not so positive reviews that worried me, but was soon at ease this was a nice place great service and friendly staff I would stay here again in a minute. It was also in a great location easy to get to many places we rented a car and found it so handy to come and go from this location.

Reviews.Title: “Good location and little more”
Reviews.Author: GalaxyHitchhicker
Reviews.Content: Location is very nice and we got a complimentary 30$ breakfast voucher, but there is nothing more to add. The room was nothing special, we were on honeymoon but we did not receive any upgrade whatsoever. We stayed there for 5 nights and on the weekend lots of young guys came as several weddings were held on the premises the following day. Our room was surrounded by rooms of very loud guys who were there together and who stayed up all night. Sooo bad! Moreover, on one night there was a huge blackout in the whole city. People from the hotel organized a barbecue as it would have been almost impossible to get food from somewhere else. Well, nice, would you say. Not really, it just was overpriced, overcrowded, horrible food. Breakfast were quite nice, though.

Reviews.Title: “MINE AND MY FAMILIES FAVORITE PLACE TO STAY IN SAN DIEGO”
Reviews.Author: shawn m
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bahia Resort Hotel on several occassions, both on family trips and for romantic getaways and have been extremely pleased with every visit. Though the Bahia is not considered a 5-star hotel, the experiences I have had there have always been quite pleasing. On more than one occassion I have been given an upgrade by the front counter for no apparent reason. Just checking in and the offer was granted. The Bahia is also conveniently located to all major beaches and attractions in San Diego which makes family trips there very conveniant and enjoyable for all ages. I have and would definately recommend the Bahia to friends and family members looking to spend some time away in San Diego. This has been my go to get away place for many years and will continue to go there for many years to come.

Reviews.Title: “Great value - great location!”
Reviews.Author: Erin S
Reviews.Content: Great weekend get-away! Every staff person we encountered was VERY friendly and helpful. Room was a bit dated but very clean and bigger than we expected, with two beds, a hide-a-bed, and well-stocked (and clean) kitchen area with fridge, toaster, microwave, stove and dishes! Old TV but free Wi-Fi. Great view of the bay made up for the sound of traffic on beach access road. Instead of walking to a local restaurant we decided to eat in the bar after the boat ride in the harbor; the food was delicious, and kids ate free w/ paid adult meal. We got to feed the seals in the morning, which made it all that much more enjoyable. Overall a great deal for the location and big, spacious clean room.

Reviews.Title: “Just OK”
Reviews.Author: heltom1
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at this Hotel over Christmas and although the grounds are quite stunning the room we stayed in (600 Bldg beside Lobby) was very dated with almost no soundproofing from outside noise which for light sleepers like myself will definitely be a problem. The layout of the room was odd also as the TV (very old model) could not be seen from one side of the bed and the toilet paper holder in the bathroom was located under the sink which meant bumping your head on the sink if you had to go in middle of night. We just opened another roll and placed it on the shelf to avoid having to deal with it. We were very happy with the close location to the Mission Beach area which was just a short walk from the hotel and you could walk for miles on the seaside walk. As for the onsite amenities, the pool, hot tub and fitness room were very nice, We did not use the onsite restaurant or bar so I can't really comment on them other than the menu prices seemed a little high. There are so many other places to eat close by that meals are not a problem anyways. Would I stay there again? Not if I were to have stay in the 600 Bldg but perhaps if it was in one of the other units. So I guess it's a maybe.

Reviews.Title: “OUR CALIFORNIA TRIP :)”
Reviews.Author: Debbie H
Reviews.Content: We love this place, the rooms, views, staff, bar, restaurants and the onsite activities and beach.. Feeding the onsite sealions Billie and Gracie.. ":) Been coming here for 20 years and it keeps getting better, our next generation of family has started their own traditions here too. Thak You and Happy Holidays The Hicks Family

Reviews.Title: “Nice, comfortable but very very average”
Reviews.Author: brandychocolate
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Bahia hotel resort in December for one night so could not really use any of the seaside facilities. It is a large, comfortable, clean and tidy hotel but with no specific character or standing out service, decor, etc. Nonetheless the staff were very friendly. A good safe cheap accomodation if you want a nice room and all mods cons but nothing to rave about or plan a holiday for!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely semi-private beach & kitchen!”
Reviews.Author: EmeraldBird
Reviews.Content: If the harbor seals are happy it must be a nice place to live. Our bayview studio was incomparable.. perfect room! A small apartment on a private beach, beautiful view of mission bay & the many boats docked at the Bahia. Kitchen has a microwave, bigger than mini fridge, electric stovetop & oven. Plates, bowls, utensils, cooking pots & pans (small shallow pan for oven) and sponge are available. No napkins, no cooking spices (think ahead if you will be cooking) but the ice trays were full & everything in spotless order. The room has loads of floor space, walls that are not paper thin (did I even have neighbors?) small pull out sofa & plenty of closet & drawer space. King bed was very nice, fresh smelling linens (not the typical industrial wash smell) soft sheets & extra pillows & blanket for getting super cozy. Joseph at check-in was very kind, obviously enjoys this property and not in a rush to hand me my key, which I appreciate while checking in, as it was a romantic early holiday not a practice for San Diego's quickest check in! He gave me clear directions to my room, pointed out some areas of the resort (seal pool, pool & hot tub..) and let me know who would be available to answer any questions once his day was done. I regularly stay at hotels around San Diego, 2-3 times monthly, this was my first visit to the Bahia, it did not disapppoint, I'm already looking forward to my next overnight. If I have called any other property my "home away from home" I still mean it, but the Bahia is now my chosen staycation spot!l

Reviews.Title: “Bahia resort - Wow!!!”
Reviews.Author: lsstucson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here from 12/8 to 12/11. Upgraded our room to a bay view suite. Room was new, incredible views, excellent service, convenient parking, close to restaurants, walk to the beach. Highly recommend this place. We will definitely go back to the Bahia!

Reviews.Title: “excellent stay!”
Reviews.Author: Erin S
Reviews.Content: We stayed here in Oct and it was amazing. Great room, great service, great staff. Amazing balcony. Would highly recommend. convient location, walk to PB, boardwalk, bay.

Reviews.Title: “do not think if u like on the site it will be like that in real”
Reviews.Author: Nikolai M
Reviews.Content: dont get me wrong san diego its the best place iv been but that hotel or resort i dont know what to call it, was so so fake and bad it looks unreal when we booked it online but when we get there omg we booked deluxe rooms and guess what means deluxe room in that whole .a deluxe room means a tow storage bungalow right next to construction side of the resort things u dont see on the wed side and things they dont share when u chekin in .i dont even want to star tellin ya bout the food was so chip and bad .and if u ask for assistance at the reception there are so nice untill u put the phone down and then u forgotten like u never called them .

Reviews.Title: “YAY !!”
Reviews.Author: pinky7877
Reviews.Content: I WILL ALWAYS GO HERE !!!! sooo wonderful. Friendly staff. Very clean. Perfectly located!! We could only stay for 2 nights, BUT wow ... Best 2 nights ever. Much needed vacation. Mini oasis !! The Belle steam ship was AWESOME !!!!! went across the bay and ate at the Catamaran Hotels restaurant ... MMMMMM Sooo good !! We WILL be back for a longer trip!

Reviews.Title: “HORRIBLE SERVICE”
Reviews.Author: Rick W
Reviews.Content: I accidentally cancelled a reservation, and called them 5 minutes later to re-reserve, and they said NO. They charged me the full amount of the reservation anyways. Scott (at the San Diego Bahia) was very rude, and was very unprofessional. (He will be hearing from his General Manager soon!) Based on this service experience, I will never do business with Bahia Resorts.

Reviews.Title: “What a rip off!”
Reviews.Author: Cardomom
Reviews.Content: Lovely location but lousy rooms and horrible customer service. I paid $270 for a suite that was so not sweet. It would be a nice view but there were was the free beach parking in the way. They did not clean the room until after 4, if it all. And when we left at 3, they had the nerve to charge an additional night on my credit card! When I complained, they refunded half. They never returned my calls when I asked for the other half ($135). Finally my credit card company got the other half refunded.

Reviews.Title: “Worst room I have stayed in in 20 years”
Reviews.Author: No N
Reviews.Content: Some of the rooms at this "resort" (a very charitable description) are 3 star quality, but the room they put me in was without a doubt the worst hotel room I have been in in 20+ years. Very, very old decor, curtains that were so old that the light shone through the holes in the morning, bathroom in disrepair (including a curtain rod that seemed to be one screw thread from falling to the ground, and which we asked the front desk to fix with no success). The staff were fine, but the property is very dated, and very run down. I would never stay there again, not matter how good the rates were.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: suntravlr
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here with our children over the summer. We really liked the property, especially being so close to the water. We had a lot of fun renting various watersports, and enjoyed the free boat ride - which we took in the evening in time to see the sunset. Staff seemed friendly, although we did not have much contact with them. We were short a pillow or two and that took quite a while to come, but housekeeping kept the room clean and tidy. We had to have a rollaway in addition to our two beds and that made for tight quarters, but it was fine when it was folded up. The bathroom was nice, and there was an additional mirror and chair outside the bathroom as well, which was convenient when there are several of you. We also loved visiting the rescued seals daily - very fun to watch. We stayed in La Jolla after we left this resort, but we enjoyed the Bahia more; they were not able to accommodate us as long as we would have liked, but we were glad that we were able to spend several days there.

Reviews.Title: “location location location”
Reviews.Author: wahinisis
Reviews.Content: We are locals and this is a great hotel for friends to stay in. We have a boat in Mission Bay and the Bahia has a dock where we can pick our visiting friends up at. Nice hotel! Great specials ($119) and no charge for parking. Lots to see nearby and great area for walking about!

Reviews.Title: “San Diego by the bay”
Reviews.Author: Storeyfi
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia Resort for 4 nights. The room was large and pleasant enough, although we paid for a bay view room and got a bottom floor room overlooking the back car park which then overlooked the bay - so i wasn't that impressed. You also could not do your own laundry so we had to find a coin laundry elsewhere. We ate most nights a the bar area just having bar snacks at happy hour and the kids ate a kids meal which was pretty good. It is about 15 minutes to get into the main town area for the USS Midway - which i highly recommend and also the gaslamp area for meals. We went for a short drive to the Pacific beach area which is really nice and also has great breakfast places. next time I would consider this area to stay as it is walking distance to the beach, shops and restaurants. We also went to the zoo which was fantastic and seaword ( not so great so if you are running short on time give it a miss and do the other activities mentioned)

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant surprise”
Reviews.Author: Poochielyn
Reviews.Content: The last time I stay here this place was pretty shabby BUT now the rooms have been all redone quite nicely. Really good quality rooms and fixtures. I really like that they did not charge the 28 parking fee as charged across the bay at Paradise Point. I think I will stay here for our next San Diego Vacation. Wonderful low profile bayside location. There is some construction going on right now so it will probably only get better once it is completed.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Weekend Visit to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: c9pilot
Reviews.Content: The reservations clerk upgraded us from a Garden View to a Bay View Studio (for about the same price as Expedia's Garden View rate), and then we got an additional AAA discount upon check-in on Friday afternoon for our second-floor room. GORGEOUS view north across Mission Bay to the Mission Bay Yacht Club, where our kids were sailing in a big regatta over the weekend (they were staying with host families, not with us moms in the hotel). Very spacious room and very clean. Having a small kitchen and table was wonderful for easy breakfasts, snacks and chilling out with a glass of wine in the evening while enjoying the view. The living room area with sofa, chair, coffee table, side table and lights was wonderful for sitting and visiting with friends (instead of sitting on our beds like most hotel rooms). The only minor problem was lack of a thermostat - it wasn't until the third and last night that we had the wall HVAC unit figured out so that we weren't freezing or burning up in the middle of the night (a rainy, cold weather system hit the area just for our weekend). Easy walking distance to the boardwalk along the bay to the Yacht Club, to Pacific Beach or Belmont Park (wooden roller coaster), and many small local restaurants. By car, the hotel has very easy and well-signed access to I-5 or I-8 which will take you anywhere in San Diego from this central location 15 minutes to everything, including the airport. The hotel grounds are beautifully landscaped with tropical plants and worth walking around. Nice small wedding spot with a gazebo and natural pond fountain surrounded by ficus (the Friday night wedding while we were there was rained out). Be sure to visit the rescue Harbor Seals in their own zoo-like swimming & rock-sunning pool - that was a bit of a fun surprise.

Reviews.Title: “Oh happy day!”
Reviews.Author: Pentonys
Reviews.Content: What a beautiful lakeside resort. Spent five days at this location in June 2011. Large apartment with well-equipped kitchen. Balcony with parking for car underneath. Separate and secluded pool area for residents. Restaurant and shop on site. The hotel owns two steamers that transport you away across the lake in the evening. We went to a "wedding" on board one evening. We had the time of our lives. The tickets can be purchased beforehand and I would recommend it to any holiday-maker looking for a fun-filled evening. This resort is beautifully manicured. It houses two sea lions in their own enclosure. The nearest supermarket is some distance away though. I feel you would need a hire car.

Reviews.Title: “Family Value”
Reviews.Author: whmurray
Reviews.Content: While I was there for a small weekend board meeting, I would describe the Bahia as a family resort hotel. It is close to Sea World and other family oriented attractions. My taxi from the airport was $25 including tip. There is also a shuttle from the airport that makes multiple stops and is $12 per head. If you drive your own car, you will be able to part for free near your room. While there is no taxi queue, the hotel has an agreement with the local Yellow Cab to dispatch cabs on call. When I checked out to got to the airport, the cab was there in about three minutes. The hotel also has an agreement with Yellow Cab for a flat $20 fare to the airport. While some of the family attractions are within walking distance, the hotel will arrange shuttles or taxis to others or to shopping. My taxi dropped me under a port corcher and I entered a small neat reception area. This intimate area, along with the cafe and lounge, comprise the interior public spaces of the hotel. There was no real gathering spaces in which to meet other guests. I did find the guests open and welcoming in the cafe and lounge. Check-in was OK. I did not have to wait. I was surprised that my credit card was put in an imprinter, rather than just scanned, and that I had to fill out my name and address. While it was not yet the "check-in time" and while there were a few people waiting for their rooms, my room was ready. They offered help with my luggage but I did not use it. Directions to my room were offered and clear. Rooms open to the outside and the walk-ways were not covered. I happened to arrive on one of the 20 days a year where that matters in southern California. The design and decor are north African but not too cutesy. The furnishings were ample and sturdy but not terribly creative. I had a parlor suite with a very large living and dining space and a small bedroom. There was a fully equipped kitchenette. There was a small range with oven. a refrigerator, microwave, coffee maker, and Toaster. There was even a garbage disposal. There was a sliding door to a full-size deck with two lounges. My room overlooked a small beach, a small marina accomodating boats up to forty feet, and beyond that the harbor. Closet space was adequate for two for a few days but might have been tight for a family of four for a week. Drawer space, on the other hand, was very good. The lavatory offered two bowls and a large mirror. There was a private room for the tub and the toilet. The shower was in-tub and offered the curved shower curtain bar that some of us have come to like. Plumbing is modern, hot water is ready, and flow was good. There was a hair-dryer, ironing board, and iron. There was a telephone and a large flat-screen TV in both rooms. In addition to about 30 TV channels both offered current-in-theater movies. The one in the living room had a keyboard and joy-stick for internet access and games. The hotel offers free Wifi Internet access in rooms, conference rooms, and public spaces. The access code was on my check-in sheet and was pointed our to me on check-in. It was difficult to guess but easy to remember. Access, coverage, and speed were good I never saw a housekeeper but every time that I returned to the room everything was freshened and in its place. Food was excellent, portions, generous, and prices moderate. I ordered the Wedge and Rock Shrimp Macaroni and Cheese. They offered to box what I left and I got a great lunch the next day. For families, order family style. They serve in the Bahia Cafe with al fresco dining, and the Tangier Lounge. I ate breakfast in the Cafe (a little chilly and damp for al fresco that day) and dinner at the bar in the Tangier. Service was informal and personal. Guests were gentile, friendly, and in resort attire. Incidentally the Tangier has antique belt-driven ceiling fans; a nice touch. There are guest washers and dryers and an outside valet offering one-day service but no on-premise laundry or dry cleaning. Other amenities include spa, swimming pool, fitness center, video arcade, playground, tennis, shuffle board, gift shop, ATM, and business center. There is also a marina adjacent to be property that offers sailboats and powerboats for rental. The hotel operates a 2-deck paddle-wheel boat for dinner and harbor cruises. There is no charge but space is limited so ask for a ticket. For groups, the catering was very good. We got everything we asked for promptly and unobtrusively. In addition to our four hour meeting We had a sit-down dinner for 15 people. I had the prime rib, served with salad, potatoes, carrots, asparagus, and dessert; excellent. One last word. There was adequate staff and active management. I enjoyed the gardens and the lighting. On one stroll I noticed that a ground light had been smashed. The next time I passed that spot, the lamp had already been replaced. I call that "attention to detail." I think that vacationing families will be pleased with the value and others comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Old, gross room; service was great; overpriced!”
Reviews.Author: abstractgirl
Reviews.Content: The Bahia was a terrible disappointment. I had done a lot of online research and was hoping for something clean and simple. What we got was a dirty, old room (that I paid a premium for because it close to the water). Yuck! It looked like a place that poor college students pile 20 people into over spring break. Cigarette burns on the carpet, dying plant posing as decoration, disgusting kitchen that was never used because of its filthy appearance. I must say that the check in staff was very friendly & helpful. Something to note: We reserved the room for 2 nights, but did not want to have to stay the second night. The person at the front desk said that we had missed the cancellation deadline so we'd still be charged for the second night. We decided to leave anyway. But, as it turns out, we were never charged for the second night!

Reviews.Title: “Killer location, property old and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: F T
Reviews.Content: The good: Killer location DIRECTLY on Mission Bay. The bad: Motel-6 accommodations at Sheraton prices. This hotel is old and tired. Even though the staff works really hard at maintaining what is left, the 60's bungalow construction leaves a lot to be desired. We stayed at a Bay Front room, which, by virtue of being on the beach, costs upwards of $200/night in the LOW season. The room was large, but very old. The carpet and finishes were clean and the housekeeping staff does a bang-up job of maintaining this property. Bottom line: With the abundance of hotels in San Diego, If you want a high quality property spend a bit more and stay at a better hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: DMK63
Reviews.Content: The room had two double beds and was pretty clean. The bathroom was nice too. We had a great view in our room with a patio. the pool was just steps away from our room, and it had a huge hot tub. Our room also included a free breakfest buffet that was wonderful. You could eat outside or inside. They also had a pool that had two Sea Lions which was a nice touch. There was certain feeding times where you could watch them feed the Sea Lions. Nice bar on site too.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we wanted.”
Reviews.Author: Katrina R
Reviews.Content: We loved the area. The hotel was very outdated. Our room had cinderblock walls and a really old TV and smelled musty. The carpets looked dirty and the sofa was old and stained. We had not been on vacation in over three years, and as it is, we could only do 4 days. So we checked out. Checked into another hotel and were very happy we did. I think that the fifties charm is awesome and the hotel should really focus on that in their remodel. It looks like they are beginning a remodel as some of the tracks of bungalows looked closed for that purpose. Maybe check back in a year or two. I will say that the staff was lovely and very accommodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheCkings2005
Reviews.Content: I am a little disappointed the how 'old' the room is and feels. The furniture and decorations leave a little to be desired, especially in a $300 a night room. The location is just about perfect though (walking distance to the beach) and the staff is very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Very Impressed!”
Reviews.Author: Whistlertraveller69
Reviews.Content: We arrived at noon on a Thursday and asked if we could check in early - no problem they said, so we were able to set ourselves up before heading to the beach. Our first impression of the property was that it seemed very lush with mature tropical plants, giving us the feeling that we were visiting an exotic tropical resort. Upon entering our room, we found it to be clean, but the furniture seemed to be somewhat worn. Thankfully, my girlfriend isn't the type to act like a princess, so it didn't seem to matter. The bed was nice, and the proximity to the beach was fantastic. Our breakfasts were included in the 3 night reservation (thanks to Allegiant Vacations) and we were very happy with the service and quality of food. The prices on the a la carte menu were very reasonable, so we were not restricted to eating from the buffet. Upon checkout, we made our way to the airport and with less than an hour to go for our flight back to Bellingham, we realized that I'd forgotten to take our passports out of the hiding spot in the drawer in our room. Frantically, I phoned the front desk of the hotel and asked if they could find them for us and send it in a cab to the airport terminal, as we had no time to come and go. This is where the service gets very impressive: - the bellman Cody, offered to drive our passports himself to us so that we could make the flight and not have us worry about a cab driver potentially messing up the situation. 20 minutes later, he showed up with our passports, just in time for us to make the flight :) So all in all, I'd say with all the positives that we'd experienced during our stay, we found that the dated furniture was very insignificant and probably allows the Bahia resort to be as affordable as it is. We will definitely stay there again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: AprilAnnLV
Reviews.Content: I will admit, I read the reviews on here after I booked our trip and was very disappointed as to what I might find when I arrived at the Bahia. For the duration of our vacation I was actually looking for something to complain about the Bahia so I could justify the reviews, but it never happened. Our check-in was smooth and we got a fantastic Bay View Room. Our big balcony overlooked the bay right outside our room. The room was large and clean, and had a kitchenette with full-size fridge and sink, microwave, coffee-maker, stove, and cupboards supplied with pots, pans, cups, and silverware. The bathroom was very clean and had an outside vanity area. Our king-size bed was comfortable. The room also had a sofa sleeper (which we did not use), 2 bar stools, 3 chairs and a table. We had asked the hotel for a crib for our toddler and when we went up to our room the crib was already there waiting for us. The hotel grounds are gorgeous! Lush landscaping everywhere! There is a large pond spread throughout all the foilage and trees and it has acquired a few resident ducks. There is also a seal pond where the resort holds their rescued seals. We watched the daily feedings several times~such a nice perk to a resort. The gift shop was tidy and held a variety of souvenirs. We ate breakfast at the cafe almost every morning and the food was fantastic. I would say the pricing is average for a resort cafe ($8/meal for breakfast). I'm not sure what people expect when they are on vacation? There are a few fast food places around that have cheap food, but we were on vacation and wanted nice meals. We ordered room service and it was promptly delivered and the order accurate. My husband accidentally left his wallet on the tray after we were done eating our food. We put the tray outside our room and left it for room service to pick up. We heard a knock on our door about an hour later and an honest hotel employee returned my husband's wallet to us...with everything in it! We visited Sea World (2 mile walk) and walked Bay Side a few times to surrounding restaurants and stores. There is a store just up towards the pier that you can stock up on necessaties and food. We wanted to check out Belmont Park, but when we arrived they were closing at 5PM. Their hours posted were that they were open till 8PM but we were told their hours are subject are to change. I am glad we did not purchase tickets beforhand online and I would strongly recommend not doing that since the appear to be open and closed on their own schedule. The hotel staff were always friendly and accomadating to us. The only thing that we were disappointed about was that when we booked our vacation through Sea World Parks we were told the hotel had airport transportation. They do NOT have airport transportation, so this misinformation messed up our travel plans just a little. But this information was given through Sea World, and not the hotel itself.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay and mini vacation near MCRD”
Reviews.Author: kkhoas
Reviews.Content: I found the front desk to be very kind and helpful. In fact everyone who worked there seemed to want to please you. The property is very big. We had to circle a few times until we found our room. Had trouble with toillet and called within minutes they were there worked on it and even someone called and came to the room to check. AC worked fine and the room was cleaned all three days to our likeing. The bay and boats were beautiful looking our our sliding glass doors to a small patio overlooking the bay. we would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel with helpful & well informed staff”
Reviews.Author: awmw2008
Reviews.Content: We booked our 15 night stay, 27 August - 11 September through Travelrepublic.com who gave us the best rates of anyone; far better than any other hotel website or indeed the hotel itself. Having read all the negative reviews, as discerning and regular travellers, we were filled with great trepidation and so emailed the hotel ahead of time to ensure that the requests we had made to Travelrepublic had been noted; quiet location, bay view and non-smoking. We had a very helpful & reassuring response and even free breakfast for 2 up to the value of $35/day - probably as we were staying for 15 nights which is longer than most. We flew into LA and had a 2Â½ hour drive to the Bahia. Stunning location along the coast, set back from the main road. It had a lovely driveway with exquisitely maintained gardens throughout. Our check in was very smooth with Scott, who was both courteous & charming. We were also delighted with our free upgrade to a suite! Our room was in a 4 storey high block right at the end of the hotel grounds, overlooking the bay. Parking was easy, we always found a space to park near our block. We were absolutely delighted with our suite which was massive & had everything we could possibly need. The firm bed was so comfortable and there were numerous good quality pillows.There was ample storage, large TV, lounge area, well equiped kitchen - we only used the fridge, separate area with a dressing table with plenty of plug sockets and a good sized bathroom with plentiful towels. The balcony overlooked Mission Bay and the marina. As many birds also wanted to enjoy the view, the ground covered with the plastic grass was not as clean as it might have been and the one lounger was rather tatty; no worries we didn't use the balcony apart from to enjoy the view. The air conditioning was effective. The walk from our block to reception was about 3 minutes - perfect as it meant we were well away from the regular weddings that took place. There was a visitor information desk with staff on hand to help you plan trips and print out routes. The hotel had preprinted lists of the main tourist attractions with 'spot on' directions of how to get there - so useful. There was also free high speed high internet access for guests. The inside dining area was pleasant but far more beautiful was outside with lovely large parasols. The choice for breakfast (6.30am - 10.30am, very good timings) was excellent, either a buffet for $14.99 or Ã  la carte. We opted for the latter and could particularly recommend the American breakfast with delicious bacon and potatoes sautÃ©ed in lemon, the eggs benedict, eggs florentine and granola. Service was sometimes slow, but when you're on holiday does this really matter? We had 3 evening meals there and were less impressed ($9.99 - $15.99 for an entrÃ©e, reasonable but not great food) . One evening there was an outage which affected the whole of California! The hotel supplied us with fluorescent wands and then as we were advised not to drive because the traffic lights weren't working, they cashed in on the opportunity to provide a BBQ at a very steep $15.99 pp. This was very overpriced, the quality of the food poor and there were numerous complaints. There was a small gift shop, the Tangier bar and a lovely landscaped pool for 2 seals who had been rescued by the hotel. The hotel's pool was spotlessly clean, with comfortable beds; occasionally all were occupied but there was always the beach instead. There was a charming, friendly lady who worked at the bar. Bit of a palava though with towels, signing a paper each day to take towels, return the towels then the paper was returned to you. The gym was well kitted out, but we didn't see anyone using it! We loved the beach, a few steps from our block and it was always deserted, so there was no pressure to get there early for beds. The beach was raked daily, the beds were very comfortable and views breathtaking. The hotel was a popular venue for weddings and they took place with great regularity often on the beach, mainly at weekends. Guests would often then transfer to one of the hotel's two paddle steamers for the dinner. For the other, reception desk had free tickets for hotel guests to enjoy a short trip leaving daily from 6.30pm and thereafter an hour later to take you across for the 20 minute ride to one of the sister hotels; The Catamaran Resort Hotel. During the short passage you have time to enjoy the views, have a drink and the live music. Having seen this other hotel which was much more expensive and formal and along a very busy, noisy high road, we were so pleased to be at the Bahia. The Bahia was well situated to visit so many places. We would particularly recommend the Gas Lamp Quarter (eat in Rock Bottom) and Little Italy (eat at Zia's Bistro), less impressed with Sea Port Village. We ate 3 times at Tony Roma's, famous for its amazing ribs, 5 minutes away along Mission Boulevard. We loved the Old Town, really buzzing, the old historic houses to visit, lots of bars and restaurants playing live music. We had been told about Rocking Baja (mexican food) which was outstanding - live band playing Eagles, Beatles etc - wonderful! We visited Coronado Island and walked round the famous Coronado Hotel - beautiful. The upmarket La Jolla is also a must, 15 minute drive. La Jolla Cove with the seals basking on the beach was delightful and take a look at the historic hotel La Valencia. Del Mar, about 20 minutes drive is stunning, the town is pretty and the beach magnificent. Balboa Park, is also 20 minutes away and packed with many interesting museums and galleries to visit. Very good shopping at Fashion Valley, a 10 minute drive away. Ate in two of our favourite restaurants; California Pizza Kitchen and The Cheesescake Factory. There were two good outlets about 30-40 minutes from the hotel; Carlsbad was the better. We loved our day at the Wild Animal Safari Park, about an hour's drive; worth paying the $80 to do the Asia & Africa tours - look for coupons in the magazines, got $7 off pp. As we had done Seaworld, 5 minutes form the hotel and other places on other trips, this holiday was more relaxed and less frenetic. Our stay was made all the more perfect by the hotel ... we can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away - unless you like noise and bad service!”
Reviews.Author: jarayner
Reviews.Content: Where do I start? The front desk staff are rude, concierge was no where to be found, keys stopped working on day two. I didn't receive the room I booked, gardeners started early both mornings - including cutting down an entire tree right under my balcony. Housekeeping tried to enter my room three separate times while the do not disturb sign was posted. Beds are hard and linens are old and scratchy. Waited for 20 minutes in the bar, which was nearly empty, and saw no server - gave up and left. I could go on, but you get the point. Stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding weekend”
Reviews.Author: Cedar240
Reviews.Content: The Bahia hotel has been around as long as I can remember...Great room, confy bed, firm, beautiful grounds, on the bay...Stayed here at the end of July for a wedding...Great service from the front desk to housekeeping...Grounds are beautiful...The bride took many photos here before her wedding ...asked the front desk to deliver champagne to her room before she arrived for photos and it arrived the same time as the bride..she was so appreciative ....and she was upgraded to a better room...Thanks Bahia again for great service, great food, and your smiles and can do attitude you all rock...

Reviews.Title: “Great Location,Older but not run down. Would return again.”
Reviews.Author: Betheman
Reviews.Content: This property is older but the location is fabulous to visit SD. Near the beaches,Seaworld,close enough to highway to get easily around the city. although taking that "loop exit off the highway to get to the hotel" can be tricky to out of towners. The staff upgraded my family to a suite w a view of the bay and the fireworks from sea world. The pool is good.My only annoyance was the process of getting pool towels and the "work" involved in returning the towels because you have to "sign in and out your towels" ...or risk a 10$/towel. It's not like the towels are worth taking...these ain't Ritz Carlton towels and robes. RECOMMEND CHaNGE TOWEL PrOCEDURES The pool area had a big hot tub. It works well. The free arcade room is a room by the pool w older arcade games but they worked fine. The temperature of the arcade is freezing. Kids will like the pool area. Can get drinks and food by pool during day. The hotel is a "resort" I guess you could stay on the property and enjoy a vacation. But the location was wonderful to get everywhere we needed to visit. Parking is free and you have no problem parking by your room. The food is ok...we had dinner the first night there and breakfast the next day but we were on the go everyday. Mission bay is great to Kayak too...over by the hyatt the sea ions come right up to you! Great having a room w microwav,bigger than average small fridge. Kids had fun playing tennis. The grounds are nice to walk around. the beach area has small playground for younger kids And the views are pretty.the seals are nice to see ,wasn't around for feeding time. It's a nicer place to stay than mission valley /hotel circle not too far. Not as urban as the downtown areas. Still was quite pleased to stay here than by Seaport Village. "look beyond the surface impressions" if you have doubts. It was a nice place to stay.fairly priced. If you wanted similar in a "newer looking" property you probably would spend much more with all things being equal.

Reviews.Title: “Poor cleaning, dated decor, go elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: doctort
Reviews.Content: The best part of the hotel is outside the hotel- the beach, the water sports. The worst part is the hotel- while they are renovating parts of it- the part they are not renovating has not been deep cleaned- as is the standard for major hotel chains. So even if you stay in a renovated room- I suspect the hotel has some issues. Full body of our review is on eatpackgo.com

Reviews.Title: “Third visit and still happy!”
Reviews.Author: Chicagoboy29
Reviews.Content: This is my 3rd time staying at the Bahia. I continue to choose it because of it's great location, amenities and relaxed feel. I also consistently receive a reasonable rate for the amenities and very good service. During this visit, I was placed in a newly renovated suite on the bay side of the hotel. The renovations were really top to bottom, including the bathrooms. They are very nicely done, with contemporary tile and good lighting. The suite was very large, with a full pull out sofa sleeper as well as a full couch. The living area had a 40 or 42" HDTV and the bedroom had an additional HDTV. There is a full wet bar/mini kitchen with sink, mid-sized refrigerator and microwave. This was also well done with new tile, solid surface counters and 3 stools for sitting. The wireless internet was above average for a large property- I could always connect and it was fairly fast. Housekeeping was consistent in refreshing the room, including washing glasses and utensils. When I called for a wine opener, it was brought to the room fairly promptly. Every time I have stayed here, I've been pleased with the accommodations and service. It is an older property, but they are renovating, it is clean and the location can't be beat.

Reviews.Title: “Look elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: DisneyKinfolk
Reviews.Content: My family of 5 stayed here for a week during our vacation. Being from southern Cali we know how many wonderful things San Diego has to offer. As soon as we pulled into the hotel parking lot, my husband was ready to leave. I told him to give it a chance; I wish I hadn't. We payed for a junior ocean view suite, which consisted if an old pull out couch & a bed that has springs that you can hear crackle every time you turn. My back hurt every morning. The small kitchenette had dirty dishes & no supplies. The bathroom was old, tiny & dirty . The towel rack fell off every time you take a towel off. I actually wore shower shoes in the bathroom; yes it's that bad. When we called for more towels (since there was 5 of us) it took them an hour! They have no cartoons for kids & you have to pay to watch nickelodeon. The carpet is old and stained & I none if us walked on it barefoot. I think a Motel 8 would probably been cleaner . They charge way to much for this place! The bay view consisted of an alley view, with a public beach where people partied with loud music all night. Nice huh? Alhough the waiters are pleasant, the restaurant had flies (alot of them) hanging out at the Buffett bar. Unfortunatley other hotels were all booked & We already had bought tickets to local theme parks, or we would have packed up & left. The only thing nice about this place is the pool ( it's big & heated) . Look elsewhere for your money. This hotel was so bad & filthy none of us wanted to go back to it at the end of every day.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful”
Reviews.Author: Suzanne S
Reviews.Content: Dropping the kid off for school in SD. Menopausal moment led to a mix up in the reservation date! Heather at the front desk made it all OK! Loved the hotel...I stayed at the Hyatt a few weeks before, but the Bahia is my new fave place. The price is ok, the staff is sweet, and the food was great. If you need to be in MIssion Beach, and you can't afford the $595 per night at the Tower 23 (love it) then stay at the Bahia! Thanks, Heather!

Reviews.Title: “Great time”
Reviews.Author: jms2071
Reviews.Content: My children and I went to this hotel mid-week. It is very close to the beach. We got a room overlooking the bay and from it we culd view the fireworks at SeaWorld.The room was new and very clean. The balcony was large enough for us all to hang out on. The pool was a bit crowded in the midday but empty in the late afternoon. The staff doing kids crafts was realy nice.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, overdue a refurb”
Reviews.Author: Claire A
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for the last 4 days of our holiday and really liked the resort and location. However our room was really old and tatty and, having looked at some of the traveller pics on here, our was worse. It certainly didn't ruin out holiday but the room was a real disappointment. I'd recommend this hotel based on the location and facilities but I'd insist on a more recently refurbed room. I don't think ours had had a lick of paint since the 80's. The staff were all great.

Reviews.Title: “Great renovation”
Reviews.Author: BuckyBadger123
Reviews.Content: My partner and I had a great time at this property. We stayed in an Executive 1 bedroom suite, which had just been renovated. It was brand new and beautiful! I enjoyed everything from the balcony with two lounge chairs to the very comfortable bed with soft linens. The balcony did overlook the public beach area, but I didn't find the noise or people to be a problem. On the other side of the peninsula is a private beach with cabanas. The resort is a short 5 minute walk from the boardwalk, which fronts Mission Beach and many restaurants. The resort has gorgeous grounds. The staff was friendly and housekeeping was attentive. A staff member told me they'd be renovating more rooms this fall. The renovated room felt like a brand new hotel. Based on the location, room quality and price (just over $200 a night for a huge room), I'd definetely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Adjust your expectations”
Reviews.Author: L D
Reviews.Content: When our family has just a few days for summer vacation, we usually end up heading to a resort in San Diego, one of our favorite places. This time, my wife and I were accompanied only by our daughter. Previously, we had stayed at the Paradise Point resort, which is very nice generally, but on our last visit , the beach was a mess and we found ourselves irritated by the extra charges, like parking and internet access, tacked on our bill. Surprise! So, this year, we decided to give another resort a try. After some internet research, we settled on the Bahia. All in all, I would describe the experience as . . . okay. It wasn't as expensive as Paradise Point,and there were no surprise charges. However, our room was a typical mid-range hotel room, not a bungalow as we had at Paradise Point. Bungalows are available, we just didn't get one. The Bahia is old, built with a Moroccan theme that must have been very cool when the Rat Pack was still around. The place is frayed around the edges. One of the couch cushions was torn, and the curtains were a bit ragged. Everything was clean, though, and was kept that way. The staff is friendly, but quite young, and seemed a bit inexperienced. The amenities were not terrible, but did not live up to my expectations, which, admittedly, I had built up in my imagination. The fitness center, which I had imagined as rows of gleaming dumbbells and the latest machines, turned out to be a small room with four treadmills and a home gym. The free arcade, which I unrealistically thought would be a veritable Dave and Buster's, was a small, dark, chilly room with about ten machines of ancient vintage. My daughter liked it, though.The grounds, advertised as lush and tropical, were just that, but were only about twice the size of my front lawn. The private beach was a narrow strip, clean enough, but not ideal for swimming. We did not rent paddle boards or boats, though they were available. The lounge chairs on the beach were elderly, but comfortable. The pool was good, and though the area filled up in the afternoons, it was still possible to get in a decent swim. The tennis courts could host two games at once, but were under some kind of renovation. The cafe was a little pricey, but good for breakfast, and the service was attentive and friendly. Possibly the best thing about our room was the view, morning, afternoon, and night, beautiful. All in all, it was not a bad experience, but neither was it one that will fill me with fond memories in years to come. Whatever inadequacies the resort held were made up for by the city of San Diego, where the weather was beautiful, the food good, and entertainment easy to find, as usual. I would visit San Diego again, I will stay in a resort again, but I don't think I'll go back to the Bahia. It wasn't awful, its just wasn't good enough.

Reviews.Title: “Not So Good Experience”
Reviews.Author: V J
Reviews.Content: The room, hotel conditions, customer service and Management horrible! I will not stay at this hotel again. 4-night stay and it took until the last night for the hotel to fix our air conditioner, demanded to speak to the manager and still haven't received a call back and we have been home for 3-days. Then to top it off, our view was of construction and yellow tape, who puts people in rooms when construction is going on outside of the window. Service horrible, room horrible and management horrible! NOT worth the money.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok...”
Reviews.Author: SPEL1990
Reviews.Content: After reading reviews we were not looking forward to our stay here. We arrived early and we had to wait until 4pm to check in. We are pleased to say our room didn't smell. We had a bay view studio which had two double beds. We later found that the sofa was a bed and already made up which helped sleep our two kids. It included a kitchenette area with a fridge and cooker and a sink with a tap that didn't work. The toilet also blocked on numerous occasions. The room was dated but was clean and the beds comfy. The air con was too noisy to have on overnight. The buffet breakfast was ok but didn't have much of a range and wasn't that tasty. We have had better ones as complementary in other hotels. There's nowhere in walking distance to buy supplies to make use of the kitchen area. We found one but didn't like the flies on the inside of the bagel packets!! We had dinner in the cafe which was better. Over the weekend the bay does get very busy and noisy. It isn't really private as anyone can walk around the place. Mission Beach is like Blackpool in the UK and not really our scene. We had a drive up to La Jolla and wish we had stayed there instead. From here it was a quick and simple drive to the zoo and the city area too. The trip on the Bahia Belle was nice. We were given complementary tickets and used them on our last night. We found you only needed to show your room key so would assume you could go on as often as you would like. Overall it wasn't the private, self contained stay we thought we had booked. At least the room didn't smell!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing family property. We will be back!”
Reviews.Author: lindasusanne
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews about The Bahia, we were a bit apprehensive, but decided to make a reservation anyway due to the proximity to Sea World and Mission Bay. WE WERE MORE THAN PLEASANTLY SURPRISED. Although the property does look a bit dated on the outside, our room was newly renovated and more than comfortable. We have difficulty finding a location that can accomodate the five of us in one room. The Bahia did so with ease. The pool was warm and inviting, the kids club kept my children entertained - without an extra charge. My 10 year old daughter enjoyed the ducks and seals--in fact the staff allowed her to assist in the seal feeding. She felt as if she had more interaction with the animals at the hotel than she did at Sea World. We enjoyed the private beach. The Bahia was an incredible value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Been coming here for years as a "stayvacation"”
Reviews.Author: calady50
Reviews.Content: I was really surprised by the negative reviews as this is the first time I've read them?! Such a shame as this property has a lot to offer-like being able to walk to the fun zone and restaurants, rent a sailboat and enjoy the bay or just wait for your free ride on the bahia belle at night which can be very romantic. However all these years we've stayed in the rooms which they are now "upgrading" and like someone else wrote, they didnt' look as nice as they had been? So this time we were put in a room facing the belle and I was a bit disappointed as the bedroom is by where everyone walks and parks so was a bit noisy but then vacationing in the summer, esp in San Diego, one learns to expect crowds and high hotel prices. Hopefully things will improve again?!

Reviews.Title: “Great service, smelly room”
Reviews.Author: sam09876
Reviews.Content: We stayed only one night and were quite pleased with the great service. Another bonus was that we got a free paddle wheel boat tour of Mission Bay which was great to see the area but very cold even in June. The thing I was surprised with was the room. The first impression was that is smelled damp, musty and well used. One of the reasons we had chosen this hotel is that it is not on the online bed bug alert list and since we were there only one night we decided to stay because the beds were comfortable and clean and we were only sleeping there. The grounds were lovely, with a small pool in the centre and a nice restaurant to enjoy. It is located on a little jut out peninsula into Mission Bay so you could walk around the hotel too or up the road about 5-10 minutes to the beach which has restaurants, a small amusement park and shops. It is a really nice area.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location”
Reviews.Author: LorenzoQ
Reviews.Content: I grew up in San Diego and spent lots of time on Mission Bay. I since moved away but have looked forward to the time I could return and stay at the Bahia Resort with my own family. This trip was all we could ask for. The hotel could use some updating, but the location CANNOT be beat--private bay access on one side with all the water sports you could want, and the beach w/waves and all that fun only a block away. Close to all major San Diego attractions. Resort restaurant was delicious, pool was awesome and whole trip a "10". Would stay here again in a heartbeat.

Reviews.Title: “Nice setting”
Reviews.Author: Finch87
Reviews.Content: The hotel has a great setting on mission bay and close to mission beach. The hotel itself is a wee bit dated but is clean and tidy. It is 2 mins drive from seaworld and 5 mins walk to the beach. This is a great location and hotel for a family holiday!

Reviews.Title: “Bahia ... um, no.”
Reviews.Author: triplab1
Reviews.Content: If you have booked a room or close to booking at the Bahia â€œResortâ€� and are reading lots of reviews about this hotel, you are probably getting a little nervous. Or maybe a lot nervous LOL. Been there. Depending on how many opinions you have read, you are probably staring at the pictures on the website, and looking for the more positive reviews - especially those that tell you not to pay attention to all the bad ones and that the place is actually quite charming and wonderful and that you will have a great time. I understand. I was you. I read all the same reviews; chose to believe the ones I wanted to, looked at the pictures and convinced myself it couldnâ€™t be that bad. I booked a four night stay in a Bay Front Suite. The location of this property gets this review two stars - and this is generous, very generous. Again, if you have been reading other reviews then you are already worried about the smelly military-bunker quality of many of the rooms here - especially the ones closest to the water. Apparently some of the rooms facing parking lots have been "upgraded" but I took a look inside a few of these and was not at all impressed. Our room was old, smelly, dingy, and just gross. The bathroom was nasty with mildew we could see and smell on the shower curtain. We found clumps of dirt on the carpet and actually found a few nuggets of weed on the floor. Not entirely a bad thing, but not with a toddler finding it first. So, assuming you are going to book anyway, LOL, let me at least give you some important advice. Make sure you CALL your reservation in. DO NOT book through Bahiaâ€™s website, or Expedia, or any other method. We booked our stay using the Bahia website, and from that moment we were treated like second class citizens. Not knowing or understanding this of course, I figured that booking through the website was a good idea - it is 2011 after all. I also made a simple request on the reservation for a ground floor room. I also called the reservation desk a few times leading up to our visit with the same request. On our way down to San Diego I called the front desk directly and asked again. Now, I have worked in hotels and I know it is tough to guarantee anything until you are standing in the lobby and the desk clerk checks what is available. I get it. So when after all of this, I was actually booked in to a nice ground floor room I was excited and was prepared to overlook lots of other issues that may have cropped up. The room was not ready when we were checked in since we showed up two hours before check in time - no problem - I expected that. So, we drove around for awhile checking out the area. About a half hour later I got a call from a "manager" at the front desk telling me that there was a mistake and that I could NOT have the room we were already â€œchecked in" to and that there was no other option or suggestion. This was very disappointing, but again, I am reasonable to a point. When I questioned this further I was told point blank that my reservation was booked online and therefore I was being bumped from the room in favor of a guest with the same request who just showed up but who had CALLED in their reservation instead. Again, I booked this reservation using Bahia's own website - NOT Expedia or some other bargain hunting website. I paid the posted rate of nearly $400 per night, but alas, my money, my request, and my family were somehow not as important because I had the nerve to use their website to book. Huh? Seriously, huh? I was floored. I mean, at least make something up that is a little more reasonable than that. Hell, I talked to the Bahia reservation desk several times too â€“ I just booked through the website. I still donâ€™t get this at all. Further attempts throughout our stay to fulfill various requests were all met with a level of disdain and contempt one might expect asking a cranky night clerk at 2:00 a.m. at a roadside Super 8 for three wake-up calls, extra towels, and to come up and fix the TV. To sum, this is definitely not the place for us, and I would strongly caution anyone with expectations higher than a dirty surf shack or your kidâ€™s tree house to skip it all together. At this price range there are plenty of better choices, plenty.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome time and great resort!!!”
Reviews.Author: leiaio
Reviews.Content: I must say , I had my reservations about the hotel due to some feedback but I was truly surprised how wonderful and great this resort is. First we were upgraded to a suite (FREE), then our room was right on the water! It was spotless and updated decor with a beautiful balcony that overlooked the water. Their is so much to do within the hotel from outdoor activities to great dining! We were traveling with our 2 kids and they truly enjoyed themselves and asked if we could just stay longer!! Folks, you won't be disappointed with this resort. Great location were you can just walk to the beach, belmont park, and local restaurants. We will definitely be back again!!!

Reviews.Title: “Smelled like it has been there for 100 years!”
Reviews.Author: RCostelli
Reviews.Content: The room looked decent enough. The beds 2 doubles...(no queens available and absolutely NO KING SIZE)...weren't very comfortable. The room smelled musty. LOVED the Asbestos warning signs all over. They advertise the pool was 'heated'? Bbrrrrrrrr. It was a pain to get extra towels from the gym room. It was a HUGE multi-building hotel than needs a major facelift. The lobby was pretty. They even had live seals in a seal pool.
