Since San Diego get chilly at night, I spent my time in the very LARGE super hot tub, because the pool was as cold as the ocean. For the price I paid, I expected better quality everything!

Reviews.Title: “Nice but won't go back...”
Reviews.Author: AlphaTangoZulu
Reviews.Content: The Bahia is a decent property but not what you expect for the money you pay. The pictures look a lot better than you expect too. The rooms are basically upscale motel rooms which is fine if that's what you're looking for. Nicely updated though I must say; bathrooms are nicely updated within the original space they had to work with - great Kohler elements but the space is small as it originally was. Restaurant is nice though a bit overpriced considering the environment. The seals are cute to see but once you do, you're kinda over it. We were upgraded to the Bay View room and let me tell you, if you're doing a weekend stay, do not stay in those rooms! It seems like all of San Diego comes to the Bay side on the weekend, pitches tents by 8am, BBQs, sets fires and gets really loud in some cases all night! Not relaxing if you like to sleep - either in the morning or throughout the night. We thought the beach would be swimable at this time of year but holy cow, Southern California is NOT hot in the summer. Very few people were brave enough to get in the water so if you're expecting a beach getaway - don't bother going here. You won't get a beach experience in San Diego. Suggest you save the money or indulge in a true 4 star - stay in a hotel with great pools more inland. Wish we had done so. The pool is ok but quite small with a LOT of families and kids around. They jump and splash and scream - not something a couple without kids is looking for. Would not go back but that's just my opinion.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Rooms right on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: halocure
Reviews.Content: We are currently staying here for our family vacation, and we will definitely return. The grounds are gorgeously kept and the garden in the middle of the property is beautiful. We stayed in a Bay View room and have watched the SeaWorld fireworks every night, and our patio opens right onto the bay. Just a few steps across the road to the public beach and we have access to the water. Our room is great, it is extremely clean and everything about it is brand new and very comfortable. The pool area is gorgeous and our kids have had a blast with the summer kids' camp activities. We usually rent a car on our vacations, but the Bahia is SO conveniently close to the main Mission Bay shops (as well as Belmont amusement park) that we did not rent one this time. Instead of worrying about gas and parking , we chose to spend that money on renting bikes for the whole family and have had so much fun riding along the boardwalk! While we have been here there have been multiple weddings going on in the various highly scenic areas around the hotel grounds. We will definitely return to the Bahia and are already making plans for our next getaway here!!

Reviews.Title: “Great for a Family Reunion”
Reviews.Author: CBADFAM
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 7/10 - 7/13 for a family reunion and had a great time. We had a bayside room and found it to be quite comfortable. It was an older room but not in horrible shape and had everything we needed in it for our stay. The bathtub was older and had seen better days but everything was in working order. We had one king bed and brought a blow up for our toddler and we all slept very well. We found the king bed to be quite comfortable and were pleasantly surprised by the amount of pillows provided. We loved the bayside location as we were steps to the water and our toddler loved digging in the sand and wading in the water. We did not eat at the hotel so we can't comment on the food but we loved the location and ease with which we could walk to Belmont Park and the boardwalk. The room came with a dorm size fridge that we were able to keep stocked with milk, snacks and adult beverages to enjoy during our stay. I am a jogger and loved being able to head out in the morning and go right onto the path around the bay. We had family members that stayed in the remodeled rooms and they are quite nice, but as nice as they are, we still preferred ours for the location on the bay. I was able to hook up to the wireless with no problem at all from our bayside room. All in all we enjoyed our stay and hope to come back some day.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and will be back!!”
Reviews.Author: TexasSunshine123
Reviews.Content: We loved our room. It was just remodeled and very clean! Very nice! We stayed in a bay view suite, and had the perfect view of the bay with fireworks everynight from seaworld around 10:00pm. They cleaned our room really good, even did our dishes! The staff were all very nice to us also. My husband was in love with their buffalo wings. And their pool side grilled hot dogs. I enjoyed there chicken eggrolls, plus they have good happy hour prices after 4:00, half price on some of the appetizers. The place was very well kept,also.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, but won't be back, outdated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: osweetlow
Reviews.Content: The location is good, close to beach, airport and town. Most of the staff is helpful. When I booked this vacation through Vacation to Go, I was not advised about the pink bunkers, also there was no pictures of them on the Bahia website. These bunker I found out were builded in 1953. Little has been done to update them. The tub was staring to chip, there was a hole in the wall, the bathroom sink was outside of the bathroom, you can tell it was an add on, also there is rust in the sink. The beds and pillows were very uncomfortable. The restaurant took a long time to serve us and got the orders wrong.

Reviews.Title: “Staff is Great But Rooms are NOT”
Reviews.Author: JoanieO
Reviews.Content: First room - the rugs were filthy, the bedspread dirty, and the light switch in the kitchenette was greasy. We immediately returned to the front desk and the staff were very nice. They apologized and gave us keys to check out another room. This room was cleaner but very shabby. They offered us a brand newly Decorated room with a wonderful view. Believe me it was spanking new, but they could use a new decorator that would add a little pizzazz. This resort is in a great location, free parking, wonderful staff, great bar and restaurant, free Internet, pool was okay - it could use a little landscaping to make it more resort like. This hotel was quite pricey for the Condition of the guest rooms. There is no excuse for dirty rooms. This could be a top notch place to stay when going to the San Diego area.....but it definitely needs a major facelift!

Reviews.Title: “full of surprises!”
Reviews.Author: pledgerville
Reviews.Content: Our Bahia Resort stay was full of great surprises! The beautiful bay and a free cruise on the Bahia Belle around it, two adorable rescued seals on the property, a great swimming pool and spa with full service bar and free kid's video arcade, free parking and a great staff - couldn't have been better - can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Old room, awful bed, great location and beach/bay fun!”
Reviews.Author: vacationformeri
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights in the Bahia Resort Hotel in room 138. I loved the location of the hotel, we could walk to Mission Blvd and the ocean, very close to Seaworld and town. We were on the Bay side with a main floor suite- pull out couch bed in living area (even though our reservation said 2 queen beds...), and a room with a queen bed. The room was old, the mattress on the bed was very uncomfortable, the pull out couch bed wasn't bad though. We had an infestation of little sugar ants- no big deal, other than that the room was clean and not moldy or musty. The bedroom window has shutter windows so that the sound from the parking lot- right outside the room was very loud. Also when room 140 was shutting their door- they slam- it felt like they were in our bed with us. Our room was next to the housekeepers closet room, so not ideal for sleeping in. I'm told 131 is the concierge's favorite room, although old- it does not have noisy feet above it (like ours did) and is on the corner- so neighbor only on one side. I'm also told that the 300 level rooms are the best right on the water. Their view is obstructed though by the two large "paddle" style ships that are moored there and it is on the boardwalk that you would take to go to Mission Blvd- so lots of eyes outside your sliding door. I liked the location of our room because it was more private. You walked out the slider and right onto a patio, then grass, then sand, then water- NICE! The bay was perfect for floating, renting boats, sailing and laying out on the loungers that they have. There is a public beach right on the other side, but lots of vegetation make it difficult to walk through on the beach side. The towers have been remodeled, they look like they have great views, but they overlook the public beach which had lots of people, parties, hangers out. The people at the resort were very nice and the pizza in the restaurants was very good. The breakfast we had at the resort was good too. The pool was awesome (not large, no slides or anything like that- just a nice hotel style pool with a hot tub.) They have a nice workout room with treadmills- good air conditioning in there and next to that is the video game room- all the games are free!! Very popular with our family- Golden Tee and car race games. My understanding is that they are remodeling the resort one section at a time. Although the tower rooms are better, I don't like their location as well and we wanted to be right on the sand. The weather on the bay was better than the beach- not as windy and cloudy. The water was warm and the sailing was great.

Reviews.Title: “Don't stay in the 600 tower”
Reviews.Author: scootermae16
Reviews.Content: The rooms were very nice at the Bahia. The room was large (we had a king and a pull out sofa) and the mini kitchen was wonderful. Refrig and freezer, microwave, toaster, stove and oven! It also comes with kitchenware. We stayed on a Friday and Saturday night and there were multiple weddings going on in our building (the 600 tower across from the lobby). It was horrible! The noise coming from the music and people was awful. It went on past midnight. The walls were shaking it was so bad. I can't believe they put people in this tower with that type of noise. My husband had a race Saturday morning and had a problem sleeping. If you check in at the Bahia, make sure to request a room not in this building.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best stays ever”
Reviews.Author: NorthByNorthwestNh
Reviews.Content: Since my spouse was attending a conference at the Bahia in early June, we assumed a windowless boring same-old grind chain-type hotel. We were so happily wrong! What we found was a tropical paradise, even nicer than their own website. The low room rate made it an incredible value for all we got. After a speedy check in two hours early (thank you!) we parked next to our harborside room. We were thrilled with the kitchen suite with two queens, huge balcony, fully stocked kitchen (with seating!) and vanity. The condition was spotless. I could not find a speck of dirt anywhere in the kitchen or bath. The daily cleaning staff did even more than I expected, which included washing our dishes. I couldn't find a note to let housekeeping know we didn't require fresh linens every day, (to conserve energy), but I couldn't find such a note that is found in most hotels these days. First night we strolled their extensive and mature gardens and marveled at the sheer quantity of lush palms, flowering trees and pond and fountains. We said hello to the blind harbor seals, now safe in a habitat at the Bahia. Checked out their nice giftshop and bought discount tickets to San Diego Zoo there, as well as some snacks and drinks. The lounge at the Bahia is really fun. Walk through a Morroccan door and you feel like you are in a movie set with crazy fan contraption overhead. I with we had time to dine in the outdoor restaraunt with fountain and fireplace and beautiful tiles. Maybe next visit! We continued the walk ten minutes to Belmont Park (amusement park) and California party beach, Mission Beach. Next day we also walked the 2.5 mile boardwalk to resort neighbor, Paradise Pier to check out their lookout tower, which we had seen from our room. We saw an entire wing of the resort is being renovated. They were putting in new rugs and furniture while we were there. In the evening we dunked in the awesome hot tub and loved the set up with lots of space, and tropical colors and music. The conference room had the most gorgeous full window view of the charming bay with triple-decker antique paddleboats (more on that below). Also, the conference beverages, lunch and cocktail hour were fantastic, as were the staff. The view also showed a playground right on the sand for children and various rentals, including bikes, kayaks and sailboats. Weekly beginning Wednesdays, the Bahia Belle vintage paddle boat cruises around the picturesque harbor (which we got a "free" evening cruise as guests). There is live music and cheap yet great cocktails and sanwiches on board. Guest get off and on the boat every 60 minutes or so. Or better yet, just stay on it for the night (adults only 9:30 til the wee hours). We were less than two miles from Old Town. 40 miles to Legoland, two hours to Disneyland, 30 minutes to the Zoo (yes, we did all of these!) The hotel has a helpful brochure with directions to these and more. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place with good customer service”
Reviews.Author: KCSFCA
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bahia for a conference last week and really enjoyed myself. The room (actually a suite) was clean & comfortable. I had a view of the bay, and the room provided a couch for lounging & reading. I think because the hotel might be older, the tub was also big enough to be cozy for soaking (many newer facilities have smaller tubs). The staff were very friendly and helpful at all hours. The business center could be expanded & made more comfortable for guests, as it is very small, but I was able to check email & use the internet whenever I needed, so this wasn't a problem (fyi, I didn't bring my laptop so didn't use their wifi & cannot comment on this). The facilities have two seals that they care for, which adds a very peaceful feeling to the location. I didn't visit the bar, but the restaurant was nice for breakfast. The staff run a shuttle up to the incredible spa located at their other facility, the Catamaran (although if you are a walker, you could just head out). Loved the spa, needed the cucumber water & massage. Being near the ocean, I walked 3 miles on the boardwalk the first night in town. Really good sushi right next door. I would definitely recommend the hotel & would come back, should I return to San Diego in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Very Disappointed!”
Reviews.Author: Carrie0627
Reviews.Content: Was told this was the best hotel on the Bay. Was extremely disappointed within minutes of driving through. !/2 to 3/4 of the resort was under construction. Very little parking at all unless you want to park under ladders and construction crews. Room was very dated, carpet stained, a little smelly. Look like no updated since early 80's. Every time someone in hotel turns on water pipes make loud noises, all night long. Private beach is tiny. Does not feel like a 4 star hotel. The only thing good about the room was the view. But don't plan on your sliding door staying open, it's a constant fight!! This was supposed to be our anniversary trip, wow how sad!!

Reviews.Title: “Fun location”
Reviews.Author: Irisandson
Reviews.Content: This resort has something for everyone, boats to rent with or without captain, guests received free ride on their Bahia belle to sister property, so great way to go to pacific beach without fighting traffic. Accommodations were comfortable and accessible (we stayed in a small cabana with sliding doors opening to the beach). I would definitely recommend to friends and family and will stay there again

Reviews.Title: “Worst room I have ever stayed in”
Reviews.Author: fkonieczny18
Reviews.Content: To be fair, the grounds around the hotel are very nice. Pool was great and location is awesome. The Bahia should really be embarrassed to allow people to stay in their rooms. We had a room that quickly gained the nickname "Cell Block 9". When we walked up to the door, I was amazed to see the door was not hanging straight. It fit so bad in the frame that the deadbolt would not even lock. As we walked into the room, the smell of musty, uncirculated air hit us in the face like the old Mike Tyson would punch you. The room was dark and damp. The bathroom had hair on the floor and shower curtain. The bathtub was dirty and there was mold in the caulking. The rest of the room was not much better. I found trash from the previous people under one of the beds. Nice!! The pillows, mattress, and sheets were damp. I honestly feel like i shouldn't have paid more than $29.99 to stay in this room. Two of the walls were painted concrete blocks thus the nickname "Cell Block 9". I have never been to prison, but I imagine this is one step above a real cell block. By the second night my daughters, 10 & 7, where asking if we could stay at a different hotel. I would NOT recommend or will NEVER stay at the Bahia again. I really hope the management reads the reviews on Trip Advisor and decides to renovate.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the stay”
Reviews.Author: Sharkhunter2010
Reviews.Content: Clean, spacious rooms, perfect location on the bay

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay! Would definitely return/recommend”
Reviews.Author: tmc88
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here one night, but this was one of the nicest places we had stayed during our trip. Staff were friendly and accommodating - especially Rick who worked in the Bahia Cafe. He gave the best service, was friendly, happy and did his job very well! Rooms were comfy and the view from our room was beautiful. Would definitely recommend to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “A great family resort”
Reviews.Author: MeuterMedia
Reviews.Content: everything you wish for in a resort, water, beach, pool and lot's more. even a sea lion rescue pool. lot's of fun or the kids try to gety one of the rooms on the beach side there is currently a renovation process that will improve the rooms. meutermedia

Reviews.Title: “Nice and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: 2CuteMDchic
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my significant other. We were just visiing San Diego overnight. The outside of the hotel does not look very appealing but the inside is very nice. The room had a full kitchen, and living room. I was very impressed. Also, there is a beach right on the hotel property. We were only a few miles away from the San Diego zoo.

Reviews.Title: “close to sea world”
Reviews.Author: 1Char
Reviews.Content: first impressions seemed a bit grotty and a little "chavy" Once settled in, opinions changed, pleasent hotel, great location, so close to sea world which is well worth a visit and not to far from the zoo either which is also fab! its in a lovely area, a good loaction to walk to many places, and there are some lovely walks, bed was comfy rooms were a nice size and nice to have a large door to let some fresh air in! the room had a cute vanity area which was a nice touch, i believe all rooms have a balcony, which was nice to sit out on however the door out onto the balcony was poor, the lock isnt very good and can be opened easily and there is no room safe! Outside noise was a little bit of a problem a few of the nights, Harbour/Sea view rooms seemed much nicer and less noisy, a view of the carpark and reception, not as pleasent, the rooms are currently undergoing a revamp, which didnt effect us at all! parking was free and easy! a good littlew hotel really!

Reviews.Title: “The grounds are very well kept.”
Reviews.Author: JPTexan82
Reviews.Content: Stayed for two nights in Apr 24- 26th. Booked on Hotwire for $68.00. We had a bayfront room that you walk onto the patio and into the water of the bay we paid to upgrade to a water front room at check in for an other $35.00 a night. Best of all is there is free parking and with the bay front rooms you park right at your room. The room was a good size and it had a fridge in it. This room still needs to be updated and the shower did not drain very good at all. The room was clean and had a very good a/c in it. It is close to Belmont park and to the beach it is walking distance. The seals at the hotel is cool as well. Overall this is a nice place and will be even better when the upgrade is done.

Reviews.Title: “It was great”
Reviews.Author: MamaAC
Reviews.Content: If you watch a chargers game from minnisota,kansas city or Denver in December its 87 Degress.I love the hotel the beds were soft the gift shop is a little expenseve but its real great

Reviews.Title: “Great location for the beach”
Reviews.Author: Casandrajb
Reviews.Content: This is an older resort, but that have done decent job of keeping up with maintenance. During our stay they were remodeling several rooms, but it didn't affect us. We stayed in a king suite with kitchenette. Loved how spacious the room was. Views of the bay are pleasant, but the real value of this place it the short walk to Mission Beach and Belmont Park. There is plenty of eateries around the beach, but the kitchenette proved useful for breakfasts. Traffic could get ugly in front of the resort as Sea World closed or game let out of the sport park. The rooms were clean, the staff was friendly. We had gotten our rooms a very low price, but knowing their usual rates I would say the hotel is a moderate value. We weren't looking to spend much time at the resort after our first two days of beaching (gotta hit the amusement parks of So Cal) so we saved money and stayed elsewhere the rest of the time, but a week long stay would have been very pleasant. The seal feeding time was fun for the kids and the Bahia Belle is o.k. (definitely best in the day time). We were pleasantly surprised that the pool actually had a deep end of 10 feet. That seems to be more rare in hotels these days.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: robin1028
Reviews.Content: I was offered an email special, buy one night get one night for half off. I got a great price and with the half off I was able to stay a third night too. The rooms are clean and have everything you would need (mine had a small well equipped kitchen). My room was right on the bay which was beautiful and very relaxing. I brought some friends who had never been there before and they are already making plans to come back this summer with their families. THe hotel's location is perfect. It is walking distantce from the beach, amusement park, shops, and resturants. It is only minutes away from Old Town and downtown.

Reviews.Title: “Can we just live here?”
Reviews.Author: jlw45
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Marina Suite, which gave us the option of preparing our own breafast and snacks. The suite was huge, clean and modern with a great view of the harbour from our balcony. We were offered this upgrade from a standard room when we requested kitchen facilities for our week long stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pretty close to perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: butlerjohn
Reviews.Content: First of all, if you are reading these reviews, DO NOT BELIEVE the negativity!!!! My family and I are 3 or so star type of people. I dont need the Hilton on a vacation. The Bahia is all of 3 stars if not 4. If you are looking for beautiful grounds, AMAZING pool and GIANT hot tub, absolutely perfect location, the friendliest staff, and proximity to ocean/belmont park/mission beach park/pacific beach...the list goes on, the Bahia is PERFECT!!! The zoo, downtown, Old Town, USS Midway and Seaport Village are also within 10 to 15 minutes driving. Our room was #665 and had an amazing sunrise view over the bay. Furniture, beds, kitchen and all other details of the room were great! Cannot beat the sunrise view from balcony in this room! If you eat at the Bahias restaurant I reccomend the southwestern spring rolls! Yum! Also reccomend taking the 630 trip on the Bahia Belle, great sunset photo op while cruising the bay and sipping on a drink! Overall I would strongly advise anyone reading this review to IGNORE all negative feedback of this resort! I just left TODAY (4-6-11) and already miss it!

Reviews.Title: “We LOVED this place-when can we go back??”
Reviews.Author: Midgie2011
Reviews.Content: We were booked into this hotel by our travel agency, and after reading some of the reviews on this site, I was afraid of what we might get. It was only going to be for four days, with us doing a lot of sightseeing during the day, so whatever we got we could deal with. What a wonderful surprise! We had a kitchenette suite near the beach. It was large, clean, and inviting. And quiet, too! We met many people in the hall during our stay, but nothing interrupted the peace of our room. Did the TV have a lot of channels? No, but who comes to San Diego to watch TV anyway? And to the guy complaining about where the TP holder was placed, how come my 5 yr old could reach it and you couldn't? Get a grip. Every morning, we would leave our room to go to the dining room. It was a beautiful walk with flowers and friendly people. Every person, from the gift shop, to the groundskeepers wished us a good morning, and were extremely helpful when asked questions. In the dining room, we were offered a delicious and affordable buffet, with the most helpful waitresses ever. Thanks, Jean, for making us feel at home, teasing my girls, and getting us the weather forecast every moring so we could plan our day. When walking out to the beach for the free boat trip around Mission Bay, I couldn't help noticing how clean the beach was kept. My girls enjoyed the small playground and the sand (I wasn't afraid of them taking off their shoes). The trip around the bay at dusk was beautiful, and the boat crew were very good about answering questions about the area. Normally, when visiting hotels, I refrain from using the pool and hot tub, as I usually find them dirty, but here, there was a large pool that was in very good condition. The staff also went so far as to stretch lane ropes across the pool where the depth changed so that children wouldn't be taken by surprise. The hot tub, as well, was taken care of very well. Both pools were clean, well lighted, well maintained, with safety devices in place. As a former lifeguard, I have very high standards, and was very impressed. The location of this resort is perfect. We came for SeaWorld (5 minutes away) and the San Diego Zoo (20 minutes away), but found that it was fast and easy to get over to Ocean Beach for dinner too. It is close to the airport, the train station, and the car rental places (all of which we used). The pictures on the website do not lie when they show the beautiful surroundings and gardens here. Is this a 5 star resort? No, and it doesn't profess to be. But, did we get treated like 5 star guests? Absolutely, and I can hardly wait to visit the Bahia again. Thank you to all the staff who made this a wonderful place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “gggggggreat!”
Reviews.Author: koho5
Reviews.Content: great hotel, very close walking distance to beach, hidden garden with large ponds with ducks, also pool with 2 harbour seals, lots of rentals, bikes, boats, canoes, kayaks,etc., on site their own beach on safe waterway, rooms were large with balcony, great rates, highly recommened.

Reviews.Title: “Rude service and an old beat up room.”
Reviews.Author: Wobjaws
Reviews.Content: We reserved a studio room with a view. Upon arrival we were matter of factly told that there was a wedding reception going on above our room that night. When we asked to move we were told they had a standard room only or we could go elsewhere with no help to find another place. As we were with our baby we opted to stay. The room had ripped and stained sheets. Rust in the sink. Peeling wallpaper. Stains on the comforter a bad mildew smell, but it was at least quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful property - great stay”
Reviews.Author: FMC2011
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Bahia, where we just spent a week. We had a studio suite which suited our family perfectly. A double bed for each of the kids and a queen sized pull-out couch for ourselves. A little lumpy, but we didn't mind! The little galley kitchen was fabulous for us, with microwave, stove, and full sized fridge. There were the basic dishes and pans so that we could make an easy dinner and breakfasts in our room. The cleaning staff were friendly and did a fabulous job of keeping our suite very clean. The front desk staff were very accommodating. The pool facility is beautiful with a very large pool and huge hot tub. Especially fun for the kids was a small video arcade with "free" games. The property is beautiful with lovely garden areas, and a nice sized pool for their rescued seals. The location was great being on the bay, and within a couple of minutes walking distance to the ocean. We had a car and it took no time to get to anywhere we needed to be. We had a wonderful stay. It is not a top quality - 5 star resort, so if you don't go expecting that, you will enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “Old and Worn Out”
Reviews.Author: emhoffmainebear
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bahia from January 24th untill the end of my business which will be March 28th. I was very unhappy with the room and the Bahia. Working 12 hour days 6 or 7 days a week and needed someplace to relax and unwind and this place is not the place to do it. The room is very outdated and really showing it's age. There is a musty smell coming out of the carpet. Every thing needs to be updated. The kitchenette was nice to have but the stove was worn out and the oven would not regulate the heat as no matter what it was set on it would go right to smoking hot. The bathroom was showing mildew that paint and silicone would not cover up. The placement of the tp holder was one of amazement to me. It is mounted under the bathroom sink that you have to be pretty agile to reach it. The TV in the room was very old and the selection of channels was not very good. They use something called " Hotel Network" and it has a very poor selection of channels that do NOT follow the local TV Guide. Four channels are just about the hotel and it's services. The place was very noisy and rowdy that I had to call the front desk several times 3 nights in a row. The night security is nonexistent to maintain order and quiet at night. The housekeeping staff is excellent but they can't make a silk purse out of a pigs ear. Over all I would rate this a Poor. I don't know what was paid as it is a corporate rate stay.

Reviews.Title: “Should have brought a bulldozer instead of my wife and kids”
Reviews.Author: AZWEST
Reviews.Content: Let me start off by saying the web page looks great !!...The Bahia .. This can't be true... What a cool looking place to stay and right next to Sea World and Look Honey! It says right here they even have a small pond that they have some rescued sealions in ... "fed and cared for daily by someone from Sea World"... and now the unfiltered horror.... Believe all of what you read in the unhappy guest revues on this place and none of what you saw on their webpage !!!!!! I have worked in the construction and demolition trades for a long time and have traveled abit for my fifty years on this planet and I have stayed in a few shabby "Dollar Hotels" so pay heed as I have nothing to gain from lying... I grew up in Laguna Beach and have lived on the West Coast for most of this lifespan and I even used to work as a maintenance man for the Surf and Sand Hotel in Laguna Beach for a couple years in my youth (circa 1985) believe me when I say .. Wholly $H*T !!..What a dump !!!!!! The Bahia looks great as you drive up from the Hiway into it's "private drive" and stop at check in...um wait...where do I park for check in?!..I'll just stop here by the lobby doors and you run in Honey...there...that was fast!! ..o.k...go right and follow the signs to our room number....Honey?....what is this?!!...wait...are you saying one of these what looks to be a bunch of single car garages in a apartment complex in Fullerton or Anaheim Calif. are rooms for the guests....ouch !!...those poor people who have to stay in one of those boxes must be pretty pissed off...wait..what was our room number !???....170 ?? AAaah Nutz !!... O.k.. maybe I'm not seeing the diamond for the rough!...let's go in and see the.... What A piece of ....and who ordered THAT smell !???..LOL.. Nice Rug !!..Stay calm!...see ?..Nice Marina view baby..we can deal.. just open the slider and air it out a bit... it is the beach...moist and damp kinda comes with the surf and turf... Wow...THIS IS a little dank and musty mixed with ..bug spray?? Wait..! Why is there a road right outside our rooms patio? Honey!..our two little girls almost ran into a road with a speeding car trying to run to the hotels beach...um... Public beach and road ?.. and now someone is parking in front of the view of the marina and looking in the room as if we were his favorite drive in movie theater if we leave these curtains open...maybe we should upgrade to the room on top of this converted model A car garage...no wait... the railing up there is completely out of code !..wholly cats!..thats got to be a 12 inch gap between those bars !! Our 9 year old Downsyndrome daughter and her 5 year old sister will fall right back down here on this concrete porch !! and this 2 foot strip of lawn wont save em even if they did manage to jump out far enough to land on it..what !??...the bathroom huh??...your right babe !! There IS NO place to put your many female amenities...hey look !!.. the fridge is clean..um..don't use the ice in the trays dear..there is sand in them. I think someone used them as a shovel at the "private/public beach... ahh now..calm down girl.. let's try an see the bright side of this place..they have rescued seals .. We can take the girls up to the pond and watch the Sea World guy feed them and then go for a walk across the main hiway to the boardwalk and beach park ... Daddy....are they dead?... no dear..they're sleeping..they'll wake up when the.... GUY FROM HOTEL MAINTENACE walks up with a bucket.. throws ice chunks at them to wake them for feeding.. only feeds one and not the other who cant find the food because they are BOTH blind and have been here since 2008....WTF !!??? rescued or imprisoned?? I know sweety ..don't cry..lets go see the park and boardwalk... Daddy why is that man sleeping there on the bench and that guy over there too?? dosen't they have a home to go to with all they're stuff ??.. umm...I guess not... Daddy the swing set is broken and what does that spell??... Hey girls ...let's go back to the room and watch some t.v. ... Light the candle / air freshner we bought and let me grab a water bottle from the t.v. stand and ...5 DOLLARS per 1 liter bottle !!??..Neato!!..and I though the theaters were outa line!!..let's see what's on the tube..literally...this thing only comes with 13 channels...how almost retro !!..We could have more choices to watch if I want to pay 15.00 a movie..what is that...convieniance tax??... AHH..A nice lumpy bed..and would you look at that?!! only 4 whole outlets in the box..er.."room"... good thing we have a laptop and Netflix... there now...we're all on piled on one of the Queen (twin) beds to watch the laptop because behind the bed is one of the four outlets...nope...none in the bathroom... yup!...I think i'm gunna cut our stay short so that next year I can come back with my bulldozer and modify this eyesore for free...

Reviews.Title: “Old & Run Down”
Reviews.Author: RileyReagan25
Reviews.Content: I recently had the opportunity to stay at this beautiful resort (pictures) for a business trip to San Diego. The website and pictures make this place look like heaven. Unfortunately, the resort is old, run down, and is in desperate need of room renovations, and upkeep. The rooms are suites and include a kitchen, bathroom, and pull out couch. Again, old and not attractive at this price. The resort property is nice and it is in an excellent location (Mission Beach). You will have access within walking distance to the beach and surf shops, restaurants, etc. You are about a $25 cab ride from downtown if you are looking to visit the gas-lamp district. As far as the service and basic amenities go...I thought they were very poor. They make you pay for a newspaper while eating breakfast in the morning (hell, the Best Western gives you free US Today's M-F). I ordered a cab from the front desk that came 20 minutes late due to a "mix-up" as well as an extra pillow and coffee that never came. I physically had to go to the front desk to get these items. I guess this could be bad luck, but still frustrating. Lastly, the restaurant opened late for breakfast both times I chose to eat there. They advertised 6:30AM and the opened at 6:45AM both mornings and were hustling to prepare food. All in all, it's not the worst resort in the world...but when you're paying the "resort fees", I would have expected much better. It is a great location for all you beach lovers. I would not bring my family here on vacation as there are better options available.

Reviews.Title: “Solid 3 stars hotel”
Reviews.Author: rosweet
Reviews.Content: I booked Bahia due to its location and value. For $100 I paid, I got a suite with two full size beds and a pull out sofa bed. We originally booked Bay view studio with a request for two beds. However, at check in, the staff notified me that they only have King size studio available, and then upgraded me to Garden Suite, the room with most recent update. The room is big, clean, and updated. Even though the furniture and TV are outdated, but the beds are very comfortable. it's great value for family travel, especially with $5 extra you get two people breakfast buffet.

Reviews.Title: “Old, unsafe, worst night of sleep I've ever had in a hotel.”
Reviews.Author: mindmstris
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure where the hotel got the picture of the rooms that they placed on their website, but it was certainly not representative of the room we were given on arrival. The most important issue is that this hotel was unsafe for children. The balcony on our second floor room had rails that were spaced easily a foot apart; we were terrified that our daughter would get out there and climb right through them to a fall in the concrete below. Secondly, even when bolted, the doors open from the inside simply by pulling our the door handle. Our child could easily have exited the room and run into the parking lot behind. The second issue was the noise level. The hotel has virtually no soundproofing. The windows facing the public beach are single paned which provided no sound insulation for the party that was happening on the adjacent public beach. Worse still, the bedroom windows are louvered, and certainly have never been replaced since the 1960's or 70's. This provided no sound proofing from the constant foot traffic at all hours of the night passing as we were trying to sleep. Worse still, security made no efforts to eliminate noise of rambunctious guest which occurred all through the night. There was a very loud party in the room below us which went on until 11;00 Pm before we finally had to call security ourselves as they were obviously not patrolling the area. Although the loud guest did leave temporarily, they returned at 2 am when the bars closed. I perhaps got two hours sleep the night we stayed here. Finally, the hotel vastly over-represented the quality of the hotel. Our room looked like a 1970's museum. I'm sure nothing from the bedding to the lighting to the flooring has ever been replaced. Worse, the old plumbing creates unbearable noise. When our neighbor turned on the shower at 5:00 in the morning, we were sure a poltergeist was shaking the walls. The outrageous price that is charged for this room is for location only. If you are in high school and want a place for a hotel party without worrying about security busting it up then this is the place for you. If you are someone trying to enjoy a family vacation-STAY AWAY!!

Reviews.Title: “Website Photos VERY Misleading”
Reviews.Author: Travelor27
Reviews.Content: We couldn't believe it when we pulled up. Where was the hotel in the photos? Not to mention, there were no parking spots, or luggage carts available, so 6 days of luggage for 6 people had to be carried a long way! There were 6 other families with us and each family had at least two children. The pool was not heated as stated, the microwave in our rooms didn't work, the room was very musty. Nothing met our expections for what we paid! Never Again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: claireash
Reviews.Content: This Hotel was nice and clean and as long as you have a car is in a good location for Sea World, the Airport and the beach. Quite a way into city itself though. The Hotel has 2 resident rescued Seals which is a lovely touch and our room was nice and spacious with a great view over the beach. Only criticism was that the Air con was too noisy so could not have it on and watch TV or sleep. We slept with the balcony doors open which was OK as it was very quiet and we were on the first floor so felt safe.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, musty, out-dated rooms and amenties, mediocre service”
Reviews.Author: Meclazinemaven
Reviews.Content: You can't beat the location of this rather outdated hotel. It's close to the airport, attractions and the freeways, although quiet. Some rooms facing the bay have a terric view of the marina and we were able to watch sailboat races. Our room had a musty, slightly "dirty-carpet" smell to it and overall the room needed a good refurbish. The kitchen needed a desperate facelift, the bath was just okay, and the furniture was the same. The restaurant and bar area served decent food and drinks and we really liked the fish tacos. The front desk person had kind of a spaced out, automaton quality to her which didn't inspire hospitality. The ground were well kept, neat and clean. The maintenance/gardening crew would always greet us with a smile.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in the off season!”
Reviews.Author: scottoworn
Reviews.Content: I said that only because we stayed there in the off season and it was a great hotel! The only complaint is that the front door had a huge space between it and the floor which let in alot of cold air but besides that the room was great! Bahia rocks-the bad reviews were from people that stayed in the old tower I bet. Our room was very clean and well worth the price. Bahia is a great resort! The internet was a bit slow and does need a boost.

Reviews.Title: “The Best Location”
Reviews.Author: carolann10
Reviews.Content: If you want to feel like you are staying at a resort but paying hotel prices, this is your place. The gardens are immaculate. The pool and jacuzzi are immense. We stayed in a garden view room with a kitchen and it was perfect. Make sure you don't miss the little nature/garden trail in the middles of the hotel. And if you are there on a Friday or Saturday night, ride the Bahia all around the bay. The hotel is within walking distance to the beach and there are seals on the property that are fed twice a day. Enjoy!!!

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: steponmyknee
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bahia for one night. The location was great, but our room was dark, musty smelling, and in serious need of some repair. We were placed in a room with 2 double beds, and when I asked for a room with a loarger bed, I was told it would require a $25 upgrade fee. We chose to "rough it", so neither of us got much sleep. If you're looking for a hotel with great location and access to all of the fun activities at the beach/bay, and don't plan on spending a great deal of time in the room, the Bahia is a good option. If you want something a little nice, go to the Catamaran on the other side of the bay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Week at the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: IceGurlie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I (mid 20s-early 30s) just returned from a 7-night stay at the Bahia. We booked with this hotel because it was recommended by several friends familiar with the San Diego area. We're so glad we went with this hotel. The location on Mission Bay was perfect for all of our activities. We were within close driving distance of La Jolla, downtown San Diego, and Coronado, without having to pay an arm and a leg for parking. It was one of the few hotels we found in our preferred areas that offered free parking...and plenty of it! We were also able to walk from the hotel to Belmont Park and Mission Beach, which was nice. We stayed in room 491, on the fourth floor of the tower all the way at the end of the road. While it's a longer walk to get from that building to the pool and the restaurant, we had no issues with noise from the reception areas, as I've seen other people complain about on here. We booked a Bay View Studio, which had a king size bed, a sofa and arm chair around a coffee table, a small dining table with two chairs, and a kitchen with microwave, toaster, stove and oven, full-size refrigerator, sink with garbage disposal, and a pass-through with a breakfast bar and two stools. We also had a balcony with a great view of the bay and a lounge chair. The accommodations were clean and comfortable for the two of us. Housekeeping always kept the towels, tissues, toilet paper, and bath products refilled, which is something we've had problems with in other hotels. The amenities at the property were great, too. They have two lighted tennis courts (which we did not use), a heated pool and jacuzzi (LOVED that jacuzzi!), an exercise area and arcade, an indoor/outdoor restaurant and bar, and shaded lounge chairs on their private bay beach. They also offer bicycle and water sport rentals. On Friday and Saturday nights, they offer hotel guests free cruises on the bay on their Bahia Belle boat. (This is offered nightly in the summer, but we stayed in November.) Non-guests can pay $10 and enjoy trips back and forth the bay to the Catamaran Hotel. There are family hours and over-21 hours, a bar, and live entertainment. We spent an hour on the boat on Saturday night and had a really great time. Our favorite part of the Bahia is the seal pool. They've rescued two blind harbor seals and they live in a pool near the lobby. You can watch their feedings twice a day, and they were a treat to see as we came and went from the hotel. As adults, we found them so entertaining. If you're traveling with kids, they will love this added bonus. The only real negative we experienced was noise from our neighbors. I've read complaints about noise at the Bahia, but I don't blame the hotel for what we heard. I blame the parents. There was a family staying next door with at least two young children and every day from 6-8 am, we were treated to high-pitched screaming. This wasn't an issue of a fussy baby, these were young children playing. When they weren't yelling inside, they were yelling outside and the noise from the balcony was even worse. We had no noise issues with any other neighbors...reasonable volumes can't be heard between the walls. But if you're unfortunate enough to be next to a room with parents who can't or won't discipline their children and remind them that they aren't at home, then you might have a problem. Even with that, I would return to the Bahia. Everyone on the staff was fantastic, the property and the room itself were wonderful, and it was a great value for our money.

Reviews.Title: “Charming beach cabins in fabulous location are fun in any season”
Reviews.Author: thaberer
Reviews.Content: Expect funky and you will love this hotel. It is charming old-California style and retains its mid-century beach-cabin feel. The grounds and beach are beautiful and well-maintained. The staff is friendly and enthusiastic and obviously well-trained. The historic paddle-wheel evening bay cruise is unique and fun (but skip the drinks, they are the only weak spot here). The Tangiers bar is a better bet - great drinks, food and service, too. And don't miss the restaurant - the service is amazing in this age of usual indifference. Although we visited in the off-season, the weather was perfect and the rates were low. You can find newer, more glitzy hotels but this hotel is a gem that I hope stays in business for a long time. W'll be back! P.S. Great for kids, too, but we are older and enjoy the off-season quiet.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing at first”
Reviews.Author: KazandMatt42
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay by the beach as it was the last four days of a busy trip to the USA. The bay area is lovely but we were put in one of the old bungalows, it smelt of damp and was a bit dark and dated, most certainly not worth the money we paid. Unfortunately the weather wasn't good either so it felt very disappointing on arrival. We stayed here for one night and asked reception if we could move the next day, fortunately they had a room available in the main hotel opposite reception which was much better, newer and cleaner. Great location for Seaworld but a bit far away from everything else and, if like us, you did not have a car it was a pricey cab fare to the town and zoo. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and the restaurant was good. We had a nice stay but would recommend you book the room type otherwise you will be allocated one of the old bungalows.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff but hotel in desperate need of modernisation”
Reviews.Author: Z00tie
Reviews.Content: We booked a great value trip with Allegiant for a flight and this hotel. We only paid $500 for a flight and three nights at this hotel. The value was great and the hotel has a great pool a tennis courts and the ability to hire boats. The hotel is quite out of downtown and you need a car to get around. We had a great time, the staff were great but my only complaint is that the rooms and buildings desperately need modernising!

Reviews.Title: “Comfort right on the beach - but avoid weekends!”
Reviews.Author: PRFluffy
Reviews.Content: San Diego is very spread out, but if you want to stay at the beach, the Bahia Resort is well worth checking out. Right on the waterfront, the huge hotel has a great variety of rooms - we stayed in one of the main blocks, quite close to reception and had a huge room with a sitting area, balcony, kitchenette and nice bathroom. It was all clean and tidy, if a bit "tired", and being close to reception meant we saw (and heard) a lot of traffic, but it was a comfortable place to stay. And any visit to San Diego's tourist attractions (zoo, old town etc) means a relatively pricy cab ride. The buffet breakfast was very good value for money, with a huge selection and some of the best orange juice ever. However, do avoid weekends - the first day we were there there were 4 weddings taking place, and 3 on the next day - add in several "corporate events", and the whole place became very impersonal and overcrowded. The staff did their best, but it must be hell in the summer when there are 5 or 6 weddings every day!! Do visit the sealions who have been rescued by the hotel, after accidents at sea, as they're gorgeous.

Reviews.Title: “Pluses and Minuses”
Reviews.Author: slross
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bahia Resort for one night in late October while attending a conference, and had mixed feelings about the stay. On the "plus" side, the location is very good, the grounds are nice, the bed was clean and comfortable, banquet food and service, as well as restaurant service were good, and the rate was excellent. The minuses were a few experiences with rude staff members, a dirty-looking bathroom floor, and the fact that the hotel scheduled a wedding reception to run until midnight - with music and dancing - in a room that had sleeping rooms beneath it. The hotel is a little worn around the edges, but depending on what one is looking for, I would recommend it, with qualifications.

Reviews.Title: “ROACHES”
Reviews.Author: paluch
Reviews.Content: We were suppose to stay two nights at $463.00 per night,We arrived at 9pm on a Friday night checked in went to bed I was woken up at 2am with two ROACHES running down the length of my body we both jumped out of the bed and was able to kill one of them.We had to wait until morning to go to the front desk to complain,There answer was we will give you $100.00 discount on the room and that's it.we had to find another hotel to stay at for the next night.it was a HORRIBLE situtation.I suggest not to reccomand anyone to stay thereby no means,and this was a $400.00 room can you amagine.

Reviews.Title: “a very nice place to take the significant other to say you love her!”
Reviews.Author: funseekerFontana
Reviews.Content: To Whom it May Concern. The Bahia is a very nice get away for a couple to enjoy a nice sunset,bottle of wine on the beach and an evening on the bay. San Diego is such a beautiful city coupled with a great vacation resort location and the two combined make for a very romantic way to show your significant other that you value them in your life. The rat race of our daily world requirements cause us to forget what matters. A day at a place such as The Bahia Resort gives you a reality check on what really matters. I strongly recommend this Day Away. Mr. Fonseca..

Reviews.Title: “Great Location and a good staff at a run-down hotel”
Reviews.Author: Brian2078
Reviews.Content: Three of us spent 4 nights there for a conference in September. I was very interested in this hotel because I plan to bring my spouse to San Diego for a vacation within the next 6 months. I went with two colleagues from work and we all had separate rooms which were scattered across the complex. All three of us refused the rooms they put us into and we upgraded to better rooms. One colleague's room smelled strongly of cleanser, another room was dark like a cave and my room was spacious, smelled like an ashtray (a non-smoking room) and the furniture was out of the 70's and looked dirty. The carpet was filthy and I was uncomfortable setting my belongings near the floor. The staff was very good and upgraded all of us (for more money). We all ended up in a modernized wing but my room was still too dark for my liking. While we were upgrading, a couple of newlyweds came back into front desk after seeing their room. They were from Europe and bride was crying and saying that the Hotel doesn't look like what is shown on the internet. We stepped back and suggested to the staff that they should help the groom out of his predicament. The staff seemed to do a good job with the newlyweds. The location is within walking distance of Pacific Beach and that is the biggest plus for this hotel. The problem with this hotel is that it is old and in need of a significant modernization. They have two (or three) modernized wings that are non-descript rooms in a 5(?) floor arrangement. The rest of the hotel has rooms that are like stepping back in time along with the original-appearing furniture and carpet. I will return to San Diego for a vacation but will not be staying in this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Dilapidated, dumpy, and disgusting”
Reviews.Author: gt3smitty
Reviews.Content: The hotel isn't dated, it's a complete dump. The website only shows a few nice rooms and the main building. Once inside the rooms you'll find they are perpetually damp, and smell of smoke. The carpet was over 20 years old and god only knows what was on it. The floor in the bathroom was peeling up and the windows didn't completely seal so when it rained water came in. The location was great, and if you plan to be drunk and vomit all over the room and stay near the beach i'm sure it's a real bargain. Run away like your hair is on fire.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant but a little dated”
Reviews.Author: littlejac
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 5 days at the Bahia in September 2010. This is a pleasant hotel in a wonderful location, right on the beach at Mission Bay. It is somewhat out on a limb, especially if like us you do not have a car. The bus fares do eat into your cash as you need to use the buses to get into the city. The hotel, although fairly large, has very little in the way of amenities. We didn't make use of the restaurants or bar, preferring to go out to eat in the city or somewhere else on the bay. There is a paddlesteamer which sails across the bay at night in the season and Friday and Saturday nights off season, it is free for hotel guests and takes about 30mins each way. Our studio suite was large with a kitchen, and was elegant, high ceilinged and with 2 Queen beds, large sofa and armchair, small dining table and 2 chairs. The decor was a little old fashioned, but very clean. There seemed to be quite a few different types of room, single storey, two storey and studio blocks about four floors high. The reception area was quite small, the staff efficient if a bit distant, but when we arrived at 1.30pm, we were informed our rooms would not be ready for at least 3 hours This meant we were forced to wander around the area to find something to eat while we waited. As we received a free upgrade on booking, I do not know the going rate for our room, except that it was in excess of Â£100 per night.

Reviews.Title: “Good value but noisy”
Reviews.Author: christina_c74
Reviews.Content: Visited with my husband and son for the weekend. We booked a bayview suite on the 2nd floor. Location of the room was great. It overlooked the marina right where the Sternwheelers were docked. I loved that the â€œbeachâ€� was right below with plenty of covered lounge chairs on sand. We arrived a bit late on Friday night and there were a few parties (or so it sounded like a few) going on. Loud music and loud voices until after midnight. There was a wedding (or weddings?) going on so lots of doors slamming and people talking in the parking lot behind our room (which was where the bedroom was located). Even louder parties the following night. To me it was a minor annoyance and thankfully it didnâ€™t keep my 4 yr old awake. The Bahia CafÃ© had decent food and great service. We ate there for breakfast both mornings. We also ordered room service one afternoon â€“ the sandwiches were not great. I ordered a club sandwich that arrived cold with cold French fries. The rooms were very spacious, especially the living room area. There was also a small kitchen that was stocked with dishes, mugs and pots & pans (no silverware; I assume you need to request it). The showers did not have the best water pressure. The full-size bed was really too small and not comfortable to sleep on. Housekeeping wasnâ€™t on the ball; we left our room for 4.5 hours and they did not visit during that time. Instead they called us at 4pm and asked if they could clean the room but we had to decline since our son was napping. They couldnâ€™t come back at a later time as they were only there until 5pm. I wouldâ€™ve been more annoyed if we were going to stay longer. If you plan on visiting soon, be advised that they are doing construction on the property and the parking area close to the bayview suites is partly closed off. This made it very inconvenient to park the car close to the room (worse at night). We got lucky the night we arrived but had to park on the opposite side of the property the following night (just after going to dinner and coming back around 8pm). And the parking lot is not the easiest to maneuver through; there is hardly any room for two cars to pass each other and it was dark to drive through. Iâ€™m not 100% sure I would stay there again if only for the noise factor and parking situation. The rates were decent though so Iâ€™m not saying never. And my son really enjoyed visiting the two harbor seals in the seal pool. â˜º

Reviews.Title: “OK but very noisy”
Reviews.Author: ydoow
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a part of the hotel that was adjacent to the main office and restaurant. My room faced the driveway. The room was a large suite with furnishings that were dated (i.e., an older refrigerator that buzzed). The internet was free and the food and room service were good. On Friday night the noise was extremely loud - yelling, loud music, banging doors. This was nonstop until after midnight. The accommodations might be better in one of the hotel buildings farther from the driveway and restaurant area.

Reviews.Title: “Never been treated so disrespectfully!!”
Reviews.Author: kansasfamily123
Reviews.Content: Arrived at Bahia at 230pm and understood when room was not ready since check-in was at 4pm. Had requested a quiet room. Came back at 3pm and informed by person working the front desk that a 3rd floor room was ready but if I wanted wait there would be a quieter room on the 4th floor. So I decided to wait. They stated they would call me on my cell when the room was ready. When I came back at 3:56pm, a room on the 3rd floor was ready. I informed a new front desk person about the conversation I had earlier. I waited to speak with the original one I had spoken with. She informed me that she had never told me that. She then go the manager, Heather, who basically said that I lied. That the employee was denying that she had said that. And so she was not sure what to believe. Why would I wait a room that was ready if she had not said that. It is not a quiet room. The people above me are loud. The doors slam all night. The sliding door out to the balcony is loud. This is not a very friendly hotel. No is it a very respectful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia is just how I remembered it”
Reviews.Author: lahMT
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a wedding. While the property is dated (our family stayed here in 1965 and it still looks almost exactly the same), it is in a great location, was clean and well maintained, and the staff was exceptionally nice and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Great location and value!”
Reviews.Author: wadle
Reviews.Content: Our room was located right off the beach, the kids could play in the san while we sat on the porch. Wonderful value for the location! The Bahia Belle is a wonderful added bonus! Will stay again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice location - but tired”
Reviews.Author: SoCal_Worldtraveller
Reviews.Content: I spent three nights at the Bahia Resort for business in Oct.. I bet at one time this was a premier hotel/resort. Just being honest here: 1) The elevators in my 5 story wing had issues on several occasions: didnâ€™t work sometimes, wouldn't go to certain floors, closed/not working, etc. (I heard the maintenance man say to another employee, "well, theyâ€™re just getting old". Not what you like to hear. 2) My room was very large with a full kitchenette, however, old and dated. 3) The view from my room was great, right out to the bay. 4) Walls were thin. I was woken up by the room next to me using the shower at 5:30am, Sounded like they were spraying the water directly on the wall behind my head. 5) Bathroom tub had cracks, peeling, etc. Not unusual for an aging hotel. 6) Staff was great. 7) Large conference room/ballroom 8) Just a comment here, but my bathroom had the oddest placement for the toilet paper roll. Hard to explain, but just imagine reaching low behind the toilet, and underneath the sink. The designer of this "Contortion Exercise" should be shot!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful grounds ,old rooms,but very clean”
Reviews.Author: Michigan96
Reviews.Content: stayed here for the weekend .the pool and the hot tub are beautiful and well maintained .The rooms are very old but were clean .

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Value”
Reviews.Author: williebeth
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Bahia Resort for an extended weekend and would recommend this hotel to anyone traveling in San Diego. We booked a second floor Marina Suite which included a large living room, kitchen and king size seperate bedroom. The room was perfect for our family of 5 and it even had a balcony overlooking Mission Bay which was about 40 feet from the room. We booked our room as part of one of their package deals, we chose the Zoo Package, and it reduced our room rate by 20%. Check in is a bit late, 4pm, and when we arrived our room was still not ready but the Hotel staff immediately offered us Restaurant vouchers (i didn't even complain). Their grounds are well kept and the views all around are great, the pool was big and empty...we were the only ones using it becasue of some drizzle. In house restaurant was perfect for breakfast and the Hotel is close to the Boardwalk and Belmont Park. We walked to the boardwalk each day. Also was only a 10 minute drive to downtown San Diego. Only complaint was that they do not offer boat, bike or kayak rentals in the rain.

Reviews.Title: “Better than i thought”
Reviews.Author: spur365
Reviews.Content: Didnt quite know that to expect before arrival due to alot of negative reviews. We stayed 2 nights in a studio room with a very handy kitchin. I agree with the recent reviews that you cant expect 5* luxery as this is just a 3* resort. The parking was free, pool looked nice and had fast free Wifi that was good. Room was clean though the room did have a slight musty smell. Nice suroundings and beach on door step. The kitchin was clean and equiped for about 4 people.

Reviews.Title: “Beach front with kitchen, great for families”
Reviews.Author: kinzab
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure what people expect when they stay here, but we had a delightful time. The hotel is older and slightly worn around the edges, but it's charming attributes and price more than make up for the Bahia's age. I don't think you will find a better bang for your buck. Staff were very nice and helpful at check-in. We received a free upgrade to bay view even though the hotel was sold out. We had a studio with kitchen. The full kitchen is great and saved us a ton of money. Room was large and held our lots of our stuff. A few hundred feet from our room was a choice of a public or private beach. We mainly stayed at the private beach. Water was shallow and calm. Shaded and cushioned chairs were provided. Sand was very clean and soft. Hotel is acrosss the street from the ocean and Belmont Park. Our children, ages 2-11, had a wonderful time. Easy commute to Sea World and the Zoo as well as downtown. Friday and Sat night offered a free cruise on the Riverboat Bahia Belle. It was a beautiful 1 hour journey between the Bahia and the Catamaran resort. Again, fun for kids and free! We stayed on the buy 3, get one night free promotion. This brought our room down to a very reasonable rate. I feel the Bahia was an excellant value compared to other hotels. This is a hotel I would suggest for extended stays for beach time and a great location.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location”
Reviews.Author: toby-2004
Reviews.Content: Just returned from 11 days at the Bahia. Friends had been the year before and loved it and came with us again. The hotel was in an excellent location close to the beach and a short bus ride into town. We found the staff very friendly and helpful and ate at the restaurant a few times, no complaints there. Ok the hotel was old, it's been there since the fifties but the grounds were well maintained, the room was comfortable and clean and we had fresh towels every day. Our room was on the other side to the beach and we were warned that there may be traffic noise and lights shining in at night but we had little disturbance and it was quite quiet. At the end of the day if you want 5 star rooms then you have to pay a 5 star price and if you're not in the room very much then I would rather save my money. I would definately go back and I recommend San Diego as a great place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: AZ-Family-Travelers8
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our second stay at the Bahia and it has definitely become our "go-to" hotel in San Diego. We love the vintage look and style of the hotel -- it's definitely not a cookie-cutter motel like similarly priced options. You can't beat the location -- a private beach on Mission Bay, 5 minutes from Sea World, a few blocks from Mission Beach and Belmont Park, and a quick drive from hundreds of dining options in the Pacific Beach area. The lush grounds are immaculately landscaped, the rooms are private and most have a stunning view. The patio of our room was shaded by a canopy of ancient knarled trees and was just steps away from the private beach. Each morning our 4-year-old daughter delighted in feeding the flock of ducks that made their rounds around the resort. The hotel also houses two blind harbor seals that are a joy to watch. The hotel has a great pool with a large heated spa and free pool towels. We swam every night. For older kids, there is a free arcade located off the pool area. The fitness center looked nice, although we didn't use it. The restaurant is okay. The service is fine and it is very kid-friendly. The food is not bad and is fairly affordable. The breakfast buffet is a convenient stop before a busy day of fun and sight-seeing. There are a lot of great restaurants to the northeast in the Pacific Beach neighborhood just a short drive away. The rooms are acceptable. Ours have always been clean and comfortable. (My husband is an exterminator and always inspects every room we stay in for bedbugs -- nothing ever noted here at the Bahia.) The furnishings are not luxurious, but are usable and comfortable. We particularly enjoy the privacy afforded by the layout of the rooms. We have never had a problem with finding parking close to our room. In response to the many bad reviews on this site: This is definitely not a 5-star luxury resort. It is a clean, comfortable, friendly place that is conveniently located to all the fun that San Diego offers. I would not consider it a "destination resort", although it does offer a lot for the price we pay for our rooms. Speaking of price, I would not advise booking a room directly from the resort, as their "rack rates" are pretty high for what the hotel is. Book through a tour company like Get Away Today and you will save a lot of money and will definitely get your money's worth. Overall, I would recommend this hotel to anyone who wants a comfortable, clean room with a private beach, a nice pool, a great location and beautiful vintage surroundings. Great for families or couples on vacation. Book through a discount tour company to get a good deal.

Reviews.Title: “Dated, dirty, but nice staff and comfy bed”
Reviews.Author: murph1503
Reviews.Content: Good location, friendly staff....but the room was dirty. Carpet needed cleaning, looked like toilet not cleaned from last guest (dribbles down the front of the bowl). No shears on the windows. If you want light with the drapes open, then you have no privacy since you are open to the world. I was told this was a management decision...where else have they cut costs at guest expense?? Rate is high for what you get...I've had better rooms at Holiday Inn express.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely my favorite hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: ArizonaGirl554
Reviews.Content: I have been staying at this hotel since my parents first brought me here in 1965. The Bahia has a wonderfully efficient and friendly staff who will make your vacation or business trip a great memory to treasure. My sister and I vacation there every fall without fail. We look forward to staying there again next fall. Rooms are clean and comfortable and the location is divine right on Mission Bay. Beautiful setting for many weddings and parties.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing special”
Reviews.Author: Piolina
Reviews.Content: Not quite sure why this place is called a resort. It's a very old and big hotel with nice views (if you get one) but nothing to write home about. The rooms are very spacious and have kitchenettes, which can be helpful if you plan on having meals in the room. Rooms were cleaned but only at the end of the day (we returned to our room at 5 pm one day and the room hadn't been made yet). Towels were not changed even when left on the floor or in the tub (they were put back on the towel rack even if they were damp). The free wi-fi was nice but very weak signal other than at the lobby. The restaurant served decent food. Staff was hit or miss though. I had to arrange for my own transportation to the airport because they could not help me with the shuttle. All in all, this place is okay if you can get a good price for it, but I'm sure there are much better options in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: firestarter56
Reviews.Content: My wife and myself stayed at the Bahia for 10 days at the beginning of September. We had enjoyed the resort so much that this was our second time after being at the resort in 2009. The resort location cannot be bettered. Water / beach most of the way around with one being the Bahias own private beach. We were in a Bay Studio room in the main building on the 4th floor on the right as you enter the resort. Views form this floor were spectacular. The only small point was the noise from reception / entrance however we had the door open for fresh air and if closed the noise would be reduced. The room was large, clean and modern with two double beds, couch, table, TV and two chairs and a small kitchen with microwave, cooker, toaster, cups, saucers and cutlery etc. Shower / bath was clean as was the vanity section. Rooms were regularly cleaned and they even cleaned up one or two dishes which were left in the kitchen area over night. All staff were very pleasant and helpful including reception, dining, Ivor at customer services including domestics and gardeners. The grounds were very well maintained with no signs of litter or mess with the private beach raked daily. The location is perfect with Mission Beach just over the road as was the park and Belmont Park which has a roller coaster and other rides. Some of the previous negative comments are we feel a bit petty to say the least. Great place for a holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing week inSan Diego”
Reviews.Author: pinkymn
Reviews.Content: Our stay at the Bahia was a pleasurable one. . . . again. This was our third year in a row and we had such an enjoyable time. The location is excellent, service, hospitality and people were the best. We plan on going back each year to the Bahia as long as it's available.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, spacious room”
Reviews.Author: SuzanneCh
Reviews.Content: I was a little worried about this reservation, because of the mixed reviews I read. But my family was pleasantly surprised at the space in the room and the woderful view. Make sure you book a newly renovated room as they are the larger rooms. Our room was redecorated but not a complete overhall. The doors and carpet were not replaced as far as we could tell. Our room was comfortable and clean and it even had a kitchenette and a balcony. You can't beat the location...close to Sea World, Mission Beach, Old Towne San Diego and the Zoo. Overall we had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel in excellent location”
Reviews.Author: sanshoe36
Reviews.Content: Stayed recently for a coulple of nights on a tour around California. Got a free upgrade to a suit overlooking Mission Bay. This meant that the beach was virtually on our doorstep and we could see the Seaworld fireworks every night! Room decor was maybe a little dated but it was a decent size.The pool is very nice with a pool bar and a huge jacuzzi. We found the food quite reasonable with the breakfast buffet a big hit! ($70 for 6 of us)You also get a voucher to have a trip around Mission Bay on the hotels paddle steamer. These take place in the evening and feature live entertainment and a bar(lasts 1 hour) Seaworld was only 2 minutes down the road in a car which was great for the kids (age 9 & 5). As well the fishy shows and exhibitions there was also the Sesame Street Bay of Play which is great place for the kids to play around Sesame Street themed soft play area's, climbing equipment and meeting characters from the show. A word of warning,if you want to purchase any alcholic beverages whilst in the park then I.D must be produced by ALL ages! We also took a trip to Del Coronado Hotel which featured in hit film 'Some Like It Hot' and has also entertained lots of famous People. This place has an Excellent beach! (About 20 mins drive from Bahia resort) Bahia resort was a lovely hotel in what is a lovely City(San Diego)

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: ldmc1
Reviews.Content: The room was a bit tired, but very spacious. The grounds were lovely, and the staff was incredibly helpful. They had a great gym, a lovely pool area and a great location. Cute beach as well. We wished we had more time there.

Reviews.Title: “Ehhh....”
Reviews.Author: hppyadri
Reviews.Content: We stayed in one of the Bay Front Suites...I had specifically asked to be put on the ground level, we have 3 toddlers. When we checked in, we were on the second floor, the registration person said I had asked for 2nd floor!!! They did not have any ground level suites available, so up we went to our room....the balcony was very dangerous for our toddlers, they could easily have fit between the balcony bars, there was no safety precaution in place, so we could not spend time out there, I didn't even feel safe being out there with them. As far as the cleanliness, I would give it a 6 out of 10. There was a cockroach in the bathtub the last night we were there....gross!! The kids really enjoyed the pool, and you can't beat the location, but for the price we paid, I would rather go somewhere else next time.

Reviews.Title: “totally chilled out holiday”
Reviews.Author: truffles27
Reviews.Content: We stayed in Bahia last year loved the tranquility, room was great overlooking the Bay found public transport cheap and easy to get around all part of the fun of the holiday, staff were very friendly, room was on 4th floor nice and quiet, lovely grounds, enjoyed so much going back 30th Aug 2010 for 2 weeks although a bit dated inside all the rest made up for it we are not difficult to please as long as it is clean and comfortable have requested same room hope we get it.

Reviews.Title: “It's ok”
Reviews.Author: chocolateloverLondon
Reviews.Content: This hotel is ok - not fantastic and not dire. Just ok. On arrival we were given a room which although clean smelt really musty and damp. We complained and were told that it was the last available room in the hotel. They actually said that they had had that complaint before! We had booked a year ago through an agent and were told we would have been better to have booked direct and specified what type of room we wanted as booking through an agent just meant we were assigned whatever happened to be available. Anyway, we made a bit of a fuss and the manager, (the staff were very helpful) did in fact find us a better room which actually had a small kitchen area, seating area, and a view over the beach. The hotel is situated right on the beach which is ok if that is what you want. If I had known better at the time of booking I would have chosen to stay in the old town, where the hotels have a bit more charm. It was clean enough although in need of a bit of refurbishment in places.
