I would not particularly recommend the hotel to my friends because I think it is better suited to families with children who may want to be near the beach.

Reviews.Title: “2.5 star hotel, 4 star price”
Reviews.Author: Godricmapleridge
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 3:45 and were told that the room would be ready in 15 minutes. During the course of the next hour I had to check back twice and at 5:00 it was cleaned. After a long day of travel this was unexpected and annoying. Although the $50 food and beverage voucher somewhat appeased us it really wasn't what you would expect from a hotel that is charging over $300 a night. The room although spacious was sorely outdated with beat up furniture and undersized uncomfortable beds. Most modern hotels have queen beds not doubles. It was a bay view suite that overlooked a public parking and picnic area. It was also home to a band of gypsies who lived out of their vans and congregated outside our room, What a joke. Parking was another story as you didn't have a designated spot and sometimes had to park on the other side of the complex even though there was a spot outside the room. On a positive note the staff very friendly and the rooms clean. This hotel needs a total overhaul and hopefully reviews like this will open their eyes. There are better choices in Mission Bay for the price.

Reviews.Title: “Mediocre hotel for the price.”
Reviews.Author: bkcraw891
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia with family and requested 2 double beds in the suite room. They said since we came late the rooms were taken eventhough we had a guaranteed reservation. They were nice at the front desk but not accomodating. We ended up getting another room in the older section on the right side of the complex. These rooms have not be updated and were still decorated with 70's furnishings. The first room we looked at smelled bad and was not acceptable so we had to keep the suite and pay full price for an extra room. We gave up the room the next night and had them put a rollaway in. The rooms at the end were updated but still lacked any comfort. The hotel is very convenient to pacifc beach and Sea World. It is also a short drive to most anywhere in downtown San Diego. The right side and end of the hotel has a public access in front of the rooms. We had lots of noise as soon as the access is open. It is only closed 10pm to 4am. The plumbing was also very old and you could everything from the upstairs room. I would suggest elsewhere unless the one story buildings are your preference on the left side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fun in the San Diego Sun”
Reviews.Author: libbabeth
Reviews.Content: Every year a group of friends gets together for a week of fun. This year, I decided to stay at the Bahia. What a great decision! The room was great and the staff was evebn better! Mike C. and the crew at the front desk couldn't have been nicer or more helpful. Let's not forget the location. Close to the beach, restaurants, bars and just about anything else I needed. I would highly suggest The Bahia to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Not really worth the money.”
Reviews.Author: TravelBug128
Reviews.Content: Now that I've been there, I'd say the hotel is about 75% what I'd imagined based on the photos provided by the hotel, even after reading the reviews here and 'adjusting' my expectation accordingly. We stayed at a bay front room, and it wasn't what the pictures on the hotel website show. The room needed some serious updates. The mattresses were firm and probably new, the pillows were nice, provided firm but comfortable support, but the rest of the room was stuck in the 70s, 80s. The curtains covering the entire wall facing the beach had many holes so in the morning we could see light coming through them. The AC unit was loud and other than the tiny window in the bathroom we had no other way of letting fresh air in (we didn't want to leave the sliding door open for security reasons). The bathroom was clean but the bath tub was leaking and old. The sink area was very small and there was no counter space. The room only had 1 armless chair that had stains on it. The carpet was the basic dark gray type that you'd find in restaurants. Yes it was nice that we were just steps away from the beach and most of the staff members were very friendly and helpful I would not recommend this hotel to a friend, at least not for the prices they charge.

Reviews.Title: “made "June gloom" enjoyable!”
Reviews.Author: bsyfamily
Reviews.Content: Bahia resort was a welcome retreat! We arrived early on our check in day July 5th and spent the day checking out the bay-being the day after july 4th-it was busy and tons of people were still out! We walked the water and found seashells-the kids were loving it! After a awhile it got really cold. I went in and asked the front desk if we could have an early check in-NO WAY! but I suspect becuase it was after the 4th. The man that helped me gave us a key pass to the pool and we were able to grab our suites and hop on into the jucuzzi-they also had towels readily available,nice! after getting warm, we ordered a light snack from the pool grill-pretty sweet! The kids also took advantage of the free arcade and every night after that! Our room was a bay room studio on the 2nd floor. two doubles and a pull out sofa sleeper with a kitchenette. I slept awesome-the beds were super comfortable! We made breakfast every morning and had our late night snacks in our room. The view was incredible! Walking distance to the oceon-with plenty of fun stuff to do! Every morning the boys would get up and drive down to the beach to surf-and never had any problem finding a parking spot at the Belmont park. But really this was a super short walk-there is so much to see that before you know it your there! Overall-I really liked the Bahia-the grounds were well maintained and very lush! The staff was friendly! My husband and I went down and had breakfast one morning while the teens slept in and it was good! The Belle cruise was a super treat! There was always a maid in the hall busy, so whenever we needed something like new clean fresh towels she always helped us out-no questions asked. I even used the washer and dryer, simple easy and convienant! The only negative was the weather-it was cold! the sun never did come out! we wore our sweaters the whole time and wished we'd brought more pants! oh also, we brought two cars and were able to park them both on the property-no problem! we spoke to securtiy and were given an extra parking pass!

Reviews.Title: “STOP - READ BEFORE YOU BOOK”
Reviews.Author: Traveler7101
Reviews.Content: This hotel, not resort, was built in the 50's and you will know that when you step in to the hallway. It smells, old, musty and a mystery componet. I belive that the bedspreads may have been original and the shredded apolsrty on the sofa was not recent damage. It was not anything like the site would have you belive with there neatly staged photos. I beleive it is possible to have a nice hotel that was built in the 50's, however this one is not it! Down this road was a much nicer resort and the price difference was the cost of parking.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bungalow and New Year's Eve Fireworks”
Reviews.Author: SofiaLeRed619
Reviews.Content: I had lived in downtown San Diego for 5 years so while back for a visit I didn't feel like paying top dollar to be in downtown since it would not feel that special for me. For New Year's Eve we really wanted to find a mix of classic beachy vibe and yet still be able to walk to some entertainment for the night. We ended up staying at the Bahia and walking across the street to the beach and going to see a reggae concert at Cannes. The fireworks display at Mission Beach was beautiful and the location was perfect for what we envisioned. For the price we didn't expect the hotel to be 4 star, so when we checked in we were pleasantly surprised when they upgraded us for free to one of their Bungalows. Our room had a lovely view of Mission Bay and the sunrise. Although the bathroom could definitely use updating, we were not after the 4 star experience so we didn't mind as it was clean. The great thing about the bungalow was that it felt like an apartment since it had a separate living room with comfortable couches and a gas fireplace which was wonderful to sit next to and have a drink during the evenings. The small kitchenette area with fridge was also an added bonus. We would definitely stay here again provided we could get a good rate again.

Reviews.Title: “very family friendly and relaxing atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: imjustme2010
Reviews.Content: we would recommend this hotel to everyone...we actually stayed at a 5 star resort on coronado island and cancelled the rest of our stay there to come back to the Bahia much more relaxing and friendly atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Family Fun”
Reviews.Author: ellegax
Reviews.Content: Came here with 1 preteen and a teenager. Fabulous view of the fireworks from the Bahia Belle & went back to room and saw the Sea World fireworks. The room is spacious with kichenette breakfast bar and dining table. Walking distance to the beach and Belmont park. Private marina very nice and safe for children. The restaurant is fair to good. Will stay here again very comfortable and nice for families with children because there is lots to do. Pool is small given the amount of rooms but marina and beach are alternatives

Reviews.Title: “Highly Delighted”
Reviews.Author: BarleyLincolnshire
Reviews.Content: Having recentley returned from a weeks stay at the Bahia I felt it important to add my positive review as it is so easy to critise and complain these days. We had a wonderful time with no complaints at all. Thje room was on the 4th floor with brilliant views accross the bay..clean and spacious it was cool, airy and had a good size balcony to enjoy the sunsets with a glass of chilled white wine. All the staff we encountered were of the highest possible standard and made our stay so very memorable. It was 31 years ago as a young boy that I visited San Diego, celebrating my 50th birthday at the Bahia was well worth the return. I read with interest other less complementory reviews...these were certainley not our findings..as experienced travellers from the UK we were highly delighted with the value for money and would recommend to other UK visitors.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place, Location, Staff, Food, Etc.”
Reviews.Author: OUCHo
Reviews.Content: Great place to vacation. Worth every penny! Great location right on the bay, and minutes from Sea World, Old Town, Gaslamp, etc. The food and service was excellent. Especially the Tangier bar/lounge. Late night amenities are always great. Pool, jacuzzi, arcade, and a fitness center. Although the rooms could use a little "handy-man" servicing, i'd say it was a good night's sleep. Very comfortable beds, and a GREAT view. . . that is if you get a bayfront room. All-in-all, its a great place to visit!

Reviews.Title: “If you want an "honest" review ........... Read this !!”
Reviews.Author: chowdahead76
Reviews.Content: Just got back in town from a 4 day 3 night stay at the Bahia . Before I start with this review allow me to tell you that I am your average 40 hour a week worker . Not rich , not poor . Just middle class family man . So if you fall into this category then this review is perfect for you ......... You ( like I did ) probably read all these reviews about the Bahia , and probably had your head spinning trying to figure out what to believe . I will put all the questions to rest . The staff seemed fairly friendly . In all honesty other than checking in/out you never see them again . We paid $118 a night for 3 nights to stay in a garden view suite with a kitchen room 480 . The Room itself .......... Met all my expectations and then some . Very very clean . Nothing wrong with it at all . Very good sized . In fact you can spend more money on a Bay view suite ( which is on the other side of the hallway facing the bay ) , but to be honest with you its not necessary . From our room you could see a long stretch of the beach anyway . So not really feasable to pay for the upgrade unless you MUST see nothing but water . If there is one thing that one could argue its the size of the bathroom . You literally have room to stand in the bathroom , or jump in the shower . They chose to make the living space larger and a smaller bathroom instead which didnt really bother me , but some people may be annoyed with it . The shower was a bit odd cause the shower head was literally at neck level . I am only 5-9 so I know its not because I am tall . lol I had to duck down a bit to wash my hair . Again not really a deal breaker when judging a room to me . I care more about size , and cleanliness which this room far exceeded my expectations after reading all those reviews . One thing I will say is that you will see a lot of reviews that claim an "odor" . I cannot pinpoint it , but when you first walk into your room there is a odor . Not a good smell , but not a bad smell either . The best I can explain is that I have stayed in beach front hotels in Maine , and N.H. before , and it honestly just seems to be a smell that comes with an ocean front hotel . So anyone familiar with the beach can probably relate to what I mean . If it was a terrible smell I would have said something , but it just smelled beachy ! The Grounds ...... Pretty darn good I must say . Now I dont want to say flawless like the Hawaii resort I once stayed at , but very nice surrounding features without a doubt . Lots of tropical plants , palms , flowers etc..... And everything from what I saw was well maintained and clean . The Beach .......... The beach was great . You are a 10 minute walk or a 2 minute car drive to the main beach with the waves , stores , shops etc... or if you just stay on site you are on a nice secluded sandy beach where the peninsula ends . We took the kids for a walk every morning and evening , and saw maybe 5 people total . The water is also a tad bit warmer there than the main beach . The Bahia was a great stay for us . I would rate it a 8 star of out 10 . Again its not Maui , but considering the fact that we have stayed at hotels in hotel circle for $150 a night . I would take the Bahia over those places at the price we paid in a heartbeat . Definitely above average stay . Great food , very nice room , and pretty cool beach too . If you have any questions about this resort , or the surrounding area please feel free to email me at Chowdahead76@yahoo.com We were here for a vacation with the kids that included the beach , Disneyland , California Adventure Park , and Seaworld . So we are familiar with the area if you have any questions .

Reviews.Title: “This is no resort”
Reviews.Author: Jack71311
Reviews.Content: This is not a resort on the beach. This is a motel on a marina. And not a very good motel since the rooms and the grounds are nothing to write home about. I have nothing against average motels but they should not be claiming to be something they are clearly not. I wanted to have a nice vacation, and looking at their web site I figured this would be nice. In my experience 200 bucks per night should get you something good. The only good thing about this place is the location - 2 blocks from Mission Beach, but you can get that for half the money. If you are looking for something decent skip this place. I have wasted my vacation so you don't have to waste yours. You're welcome.

Reviews.Title: “BAY VIEW SUITE GOOD”
Reviews.Author: jr818
Reviews.Content: We spent 400 on two nights ...We were happy with the place real clean and close to sea world and Beach..we would definitely come back....location looks a a little outdated inside but for the price it is a nice location and very safe and clean

Reviews.Title: “Good for price”
Reviews.Author: oban34
Reviews.Content: We were looking for a good rate with three young kids and found that the Bahia's rates were in line of what we were looking for. The service was good and always tried hard to help us. The room and resort show there age but the location to Seaworld and Mission Beach were great. It was only about 40 minutes to Legoland and freeway acess was easy. The room was very dated but clean. Limted TV channels for children viewing was disapointing. I would not suggest the cafe for dinner as the food was tasteless. There are many good options on Mission blvd for food. Overall its a good value if you are spending most of your time outside of the room.

Reviews.Title: “Would never come back, location is good, but needs updating and cleaning!”
Reviews.Author: kcdragonfly
Reviews.Content: From the exterior grounds, it is clear that they spend a lot of money to get you to stay here. Gardens and grounds are clean and well maintained. They were sealcoating the entire parking lot while we were there and line painting - again money that would have been better spent on the interiors. I was staying with my youngster, so upgraded in advance to a suite so I wouldn't have to go to bed too early. The room was sadly disappointing for the high price (did not look like the website) because everything was old and grungy. Carpet was threadbare and falling apart, ancient astroturf on the balconies, 70's furniture and weird room layout, was supposed to have a full sized fridge but it was still a bar fridge. The bathroom had splatters of old toothpaste on the tile by the sink and no where to put your toiletries, no fan to control the humidity. The bedroom beds were comfortable, furniture dinged and a rubby gruncy gas fireplace (unsealed! can you say CO2, not that we used it - but ick). I checked every morning for bedbug bites, and appeared to have maybe one. We would come back from Seaworld to let my boy nap and at 2pm the room was not 'cleaned' - and then they would finally come around but I didn't want my boy to be disturbed, but even on the days when they did come around it appears that cleaning consists of replacing towels. In 7 nights, my room was 'cleaned' 3 times. Location is great as it is walking distance to the beach and Seaworld, but that's about it. Bus service is right outside, easy to get anywhere on a couple of bucks and 10 minute bus to Old Town transit centre. Staff was friendly enough. Never ate at the hotel. Boat cruise was nice, and we could see the fireworks from our balcony. Annoying school bus showed up and idled outside our room for 20 minutes at 6:30am then shut off then start up at 8:30 again!, and then again in the evening at 9pm - it would arrive and idle and then finally shut off, not sure why you need to pre-warm a bus up 2 hours before you are going anywhere and I certainly did not need to wake at 6:30 on my vacation! Bus should have had to park out by the highway! With my 'upgrade' (ha ha), I paid probably $200/night - way too much for this dump. On such prime real estate, they should do much better at upgrading these interiors. My MIL's room had an annoying dog barking on a balcony, as well as the public beach right there (parties and bonfires!)

Reviews.Title: “exellent location”
Reviews.Author: tucsontimmy
Reviews.Content: this is the best place to stay if you want to spend time at the mission beach area, everything is within walking distince...(in flip flops) we stayed in older section of this resort and found it charming/home-like. felt safe and secure(on second floor)..left sliding glass door open all night enjoying the sea breeze..the grounds were very nice, plants/palm trees..very resort like....plenty of parking...

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding sevice, excellent location, loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Les1231
Reviews.Content: Would highly recommend this hotel. Lots to do, beautiful grounds, friendly staff. My wife and I had a great time and would definately stay here again. Our room was clean and comfortable. Food and service was excellent. Enjoyed the pool, fitness centre, tennis courts and beautiful gardens. Close to everything, can't say enough.

Reviews.Title: “good location”
Reviews.Author: RobertandJoann
Reviews.Content: The Bahia is located close to Sea World and with easy access to Old Town, the Zoo, Seaport Village and the city it makes for a good location. One downfall is the noise from the surrounding roads.

Reviews.Title: “motel trying to pass itself off as a resort”
Reviews.Author: beanandme
Reviews.Content: Here for a conference. We booked a garden view double, looking forward to staying here because website made it look so nice. I've been at nearby Paradise Point before, and assumed this would be similar. Should've checked trip advisor first! Hotel complex looked suspiciously motel-ish on arrival. Once I got in our room I spent about 90 seconds before calling front desk to request upgrade. The room was tiny, very musty smelling, every surface covered in grime, and looked like it was last updated in 1982. I was afraid to touch anything. The friendly front desk clerk moved us (for $35 more per night) to a studio in the (very ugly) tower at rear of complex. Here is another problem, parking is not assigned, so you may end up in a spot pretty far from your room. This room is a marked improvement over the first as far as decor and cleanliness, but I still feel so icky from that first room I'm reluctant to sit down. Grounds are nowhere near as lush looking as website appears. I feel like I'm trapped in a cheap apartment complex. If I had to sum up the Bahia in one word, it would be yuck. I wouldn't ever come here for vacation, but at least this room is tolerable for our short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value Resort”
Reviews.Author: zackhay
Reviews.Content: I stayed at The Bahia Resort on a trip that was a combination of business and pleasure. I found the hotel on expedia.com for $89.00 per night. I thought looked to be a nice place for the price and decided to book it. The location is excellent if the primary reason your visit is Seaworld. If not the hotel is a quick drive or cab ride away from Pacific Beach. The room was similar to an upgraded motel room. We parked right outside our door. The beds were comfortable and the decor was reminiscent of island style. The bathroom was another story. The bathroom featured white tile floors and walls and became very steamed up after a quick shower. The tiles were slightly dirty and a few were even cracked and needed replaced. I did not dine in the restaurant at all during the course of my stay. The pool and work out area were quite nice for a hotel in its price category. One of the amenities the hotel features is a free boat cruise of the surrounding harbor. The hotel's boat cruises hourly during the day for family cruises. At night, the boat becomes a floating bar were you must be twenty one to be on the boat. Overall, a nice hotel with a great hotel. At one point I am sure that The Bahia was a top of the line resort in the early 1970's. Today it needs some work however, still provides a great inexpensive resort experience.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME Resort. AWFUL Location.”
Reviews.Author: wassupjonnyg
Reviews.Content: It was my first time EVER visiting CALIFORNIA let alone San Diego. The weather was awesome I will give it that. I was here on vacation and minded my business as such, but I ran into some pretty arrogant people in this area that I think were just lookin for something. Aside from that the resort itself was BEAUTIFUL. Believe it or not the final 3 days I just remained at the resort. Nothing too spectacular in the area besides the pizza shop that sold 40" pizzas. Most places are a good drive away. I highly recommend the resort, even MOREso if it was located somewhere ELSE. Venice Beach was Nice!!! Never going back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for visiting the University of San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: sgerlak
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed here for 4 days while visiting the University of San Diego. The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Initially, we were booked in a "garden" room. When we checked in, I asked if there were "other room options," and we were put in a a very nice, recently renovated room on a high floor (by request). There were plenty of towels and free WiFi. Parking is free and convenient (you will be given a hang tag). The pool area was lovely, but the sand beach on the bay was even nicer for reading (me) and sunning (my daughter). There were play areas for young children and big shady cabana chaises for the rest of us. It was very pleasant being surrounded by seniors and children alike. The staff was really helpful when I needed to do some unexpected correspondence. They helped with the business center, provided paper clips and cheerfully scrounged up plain business envelopes for me (without hotel logo). The rescue seal pool and gardens are beautifully maintained. We did not eat at the hotel restaurant. Although it looked very nice, I never saw anyone eating there. The hotel is a 2-block walk to the Mission Beach. It is also just a few steps from a nice bay-front walkway that heads north, much nicer than walking on the road to reach several restaurants a bit north of the hotel. It's also a nice little walk to the University of San Diego boathouse, where you can watch the rowers. If you are on a higher floor as we were, we had a nice view of the pool area, water and boats. It was a tiny bit noisy in the evening as we were above the main entrance and near the pool, but that was easily handled with earplugs and worth the tradeoff for the view.

Reviews.Title: “Pictures are misleading but OK”
Reviews.Author: EyeJen
Reviews.Content: We were in a bayfront studio and kinda outdated. There was a huge drilling machine doing work on the roof from 9 - 3 which was pretty aggravating since cement was getting all over our balcony. Although a housekeeper did come to clean in up around 4, the idea of a nap or relaxing on the balcony were not an option. The pool is nice..especially for really young kids since there is a kiddie pool roped off. The pool was freezing...no heat at all. The room itself and inside atmosphere below my expectations. The outside/gardens/seal pool/beach was great though and so was the location. Would recommend only if you plan to be running around all day doing things and not spending it leisurely at hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice... had a great room in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: KennyRogers
Reviews.Content: My family and I (Wife and I are 36 with kids 17, 15, and 7) really enjoyed almost everything about this resort. The room we had was a nice studio with a kitchenette that met all of our needs perfectly. It was clean and the beds while not the best were comfortable enough... and the pullout couch was perfect. We were on the ground floor looking out at the seal pool. The 2 seals (Billy and Gracie) were out playing or sunning every day and are so cool! We loved watching them everyday. I can say that the hotel is built well as 2 hours after we got there the earthquake hit... what a wild ride that was! Not one problem with the hotel though. They did do some "maintenance" over the course of the week to the facade on the east face of the building. We were treated really well by all of the staff too. The food was good at the cafe... albeit a little pricey. Especially the drinks. The breakfast buffet was fantastic. They have the best little waffles! The grounds are beautiful and the views were amazing... watching the fireworks across the bay at Sea World was a nice way to end each day. The pool was really nice and clean and the hug hot tub was fantastic after a day full of walking! Walking distance to Mission beach and the ocean walk. Great restaraunts all around! Party stores are also right down the street across from Belmont park (A cool midway with a huge wooden rollercoaster). I would stay here again and recommend families to do the same!

Reviews.Title: “I was very pleased.”
Reviews.Author: ScottsdaleSlinky
Reviews.Content: This hotel met all of our family needs, yes it was dated, but very clean. We had a Bay View Suite/Seaworld package for four days. It was perfect ly located to watch the nightly Seaworld fireworks. We ordered room service a few times- all tasty, and fast. The pool even had a baby pool sectioned off. Huge hot tub could seat around 35 people- fresh towels provided. The Arcade games were all free of cost, which certainly helps. We were able to park directly in front of our door. We also took the complimentary Friday Night Bahia Belle Cruise, lots of fun with yummy cocktails. Right before I went on this Spring Break trip- I read some terrrible recent reviews which scared me- but we went and were really so pleased. I will for sure go back to this hotel- it really had so many great features. Huge fridge, oven, microwave and near by Trader Joe's. We spent two days at Seaworld and one day at Coronado. Great trip.

Reviews.Title: “Don't do it!!!”
Reviews.Author: chuckie59
Reviews.Content: This hotel came highly recommended from a coworker. I booked a bay front room, and can say that the view itself was nice. Now for the rest of the story. The room had a musty, old smell to it. The entry lights were out, and the couch was, well, we had to put a blanket over it before we sat on it. I also believe it is about time to change the bed cover as well. Enough of the small things. At about 1 am, I went to the very small bathroom, and to my surprise, I was not alone. A very large cockroach took offense to my being there and charged past me into the living room. The next morning my girlfriend unfortunately found his mate, a slightly different looking individual,(which we killed). To add to the fun, the toilet backed up, and after deciding enough was enough, we made coffee, only to discover that there were no cups! I told the front desk, and their response was, "Sorry about that, have a nice drive back home" Later an assistant manager said that water front hotels sometimes have vermin, and the best that they could do was give me a refund of $75 (?). I later received an online comment card, which I filled out, and have never heard from anyone concerning my complaints. Needless to say, I will not be taking that coworkers advice anymore...

Reviews.Title: “Not worth it”
Reviews.Author: iheartindy
Reviews.Content: Like others, despite the mixed reviews, we decided to give Bahia a try. Well, we booked it for 11 nights and only stayed 3. Let me explain: The Good: 1. Nice size hot tub which I thought was nice. Room was average, more like a motel feel and appearance (wallpaper coming off). 2. Nice staff. 3. Belle was a plus, although never rode it. 4. Location is great! 5. Seal pool was pretty cool. 6. Restaurant is nice and good (at least breakfast, I can't speak of dinner). The Bad: 1. Looks good when you first arrive, but gets worse after the lobby area. 2. We had to buy an air freshener due to the old basement smell (as others complained of). 3. There were bugs (once again, as others complained of). The last night we stayed there, we found a roach in our bathtub! 4. Showerhead is super low; my husband had to squat to wash his hair. The roach and low shower head pretty much did it for us and we had to leave. Can't say I'd recommend it, even to people on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected in the least.”
Reviews.Author: jrobba
Reviews.Content: The Bahia's website makes this hotel look great. It was ok, but I definitely expected better. The bathroom in the room was gross, and the room itself, was dark and dingy. It had a small uncomfortable bed, and the location of the room we had was in like in median of a parking lot. Definitely no good. On a positive, the hotel is in a great area, in Mission Bay, very close to Seaworld. It has a nice pool and jacuzzi, and the seal they have out front is a cool exhibit. That's where the positives end. This hotel had bad service, and overall was just not worth our money. I've learned to take less risks and stick with a brand. I usually stay with Starwood, that includes Sheraton and Westin and I am usually not disappointed. I would definitely not recommend this hotel, as there are many better ones in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing trip to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: GrandePrairieCanada
Reviews.Content: My little family (2adults and 2 young children) travelled to San Diego March 4-10 and stayed at the Bahia. We were very impressed with the kindness and service of the staff. From the minute we arrived we were treated very well. The front desk staff kept the kitchen open a few minutes late so that we could order after our long journey from Canada. The resturant staff took time to chat with us everyday and accomadate our childrens needs. Both of the concierge' were invaluable in finding great local food and bike rentals. The grounds are immaculate and lush. We enjoyed the clean pool and hot tub everyday. The location is great, very close to Sea World and just a block away from the ocean. We will definately return. Thank you!

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated & Over-priced”
Reviews.Author: mawokc
Reviews.Content: Well, we wanted to end our trip with a nice hotel. We selected this one after reading some reviews and looking at the website. It was a bit misleading. It's not beach front, it's bay front. It was nice to walk outside the sliding glass doors and onto a personal patio and the sand and bay. The rooms were pretty outdated for how expensive they were. The bedding seemed quite old and kind of disgusting. Painting the rooms and new bedding would really help this place, if nothing else. I'm sure at one time this was a really nice place. For as much as they charge per night, they can most likely afford to keep up with it. They need to lower prices if they don't intend to keep up with it. The staff was friendly and very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful view; disgusting room”
Reviews.Author: KayceeD
Reviews.Content: We were "upgraded" to one of the bay view bungalows. If they offer this to you, DECLINE! The set up of the room itself is nice. You have a complete bedroom and a living room with couch, table, microwave, and refrigerator. The bed and bedroom were clean as was the bathroom. The problem came with the couch which smelled like urine. The rooms are also somewhat old, the furniture in the living room is rather crummy and the walls look like cement block.; not a look I really crave for a hotel room. We had to get to the room by going under a metal staircase which was somewhat creepy. Parking by the bungalows was a joke. Not enough parking and we had to park in a lot that was a little bit away from our room. The one redeeming thing was that when we walked outside the patio door, we were right on the bay. It had a small patio in front of each roomand a grassy part by the water where we dragged the lawn chairs. My husband rented a fishing pole and bait and was able to fish in peace. However, the staff at the front desk are unbelievable. My husband had seen people fishing and asked at the front desk where to rent the equipment. No one knew and no one offered to find out (even though the shop ended up being practically next door). I told them about the urine smell on the couch and the response was a tepid "oh really?" The desk clerk said she'd send a maid in to see about the couch but, as we were checking out, that didn't help us. The rest of the hotel looked better than these bungalows but since we didn't stay there, I have no idea how those rooms compared. I was just so totally disgusted by these bungalows that I will never contemplate staying here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bay View Premium Room Was Good”
Reviews.Author: DonH
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia for 2 nights prior to a cruise from San Diego. In spite of horrible weather, we enjoyed outselves. The location in Mission Bay is convenient, across the street from the bus stop. We took the bus to Old Town where we could get the trolley to downtown, including the cruise ship terminal. (You could go all the way to TIjuana on the trolley if you wished.) Other than our initial taxi from the airport, we did not need a rental car. Despite some of the previous reviews, we had a very nice room which was clean, comfortable, and quiet. We were upgraded to a premium room (no. 364, on the ground floor of the Marina building) with a kitchenette (which we did not use). I took a walk around the property, and it was evident that the building we were in was one of the newer ones.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: madcity49
Reviews.Content: After reading some negative reviews we still decided to give the Bahia Resort a try. We were very plesantly surprised !! The location was perfect and the grounds were lovely. Our room was clean and spacious. The staff was excellant. Our daughter worked with the resorts tennis pro who was one of the best she has ever worked with. We will stay here again!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Nice view of the bay, lots of walking”
Reviews.Author: BTT
Reviews.Content: Although claimed to be a "resort" hotel, this is a busy business hotel. During the week we were there, there are a number of small business meetings being held there simultaneously. Luckily, many of them have catered meals so the conference room is not very busy. The hotel is located in Mission Bay with many bay view rooms. The buildings are rather old and the rooms are also showing their ago. That's been said, the rooms and hall ways are very clean. Everything works and I did enjoy playing my iPod on the alarm radio. My room is huge: over 300 sqf including a sitting area, full pull out sofa, full kitchen, as well as separate dressing room and bathroom. The weather in San Diego is always nice and walking on the beach is pleasant. If the bay is not good enough for you, the Pacific Ocean is just across the street. There are city bus lines and stops right in front of the hotel. The hotel staff are nice and helpful. The food served in the restaurant is good and reasonablely priced. The bar also serves food after the restaurant closes. The only problem I have is there's a lot of walking. My room is located at the building in the end, about 1/3 mile from the front lobby and restaurant. Ask for a closer building if you don't want to walk much, or the opposite. It has a very big swimming pool (I didn't use it). It also has water sports on site such as kayaks, small boats, etc.

Reviews.Title: “It has superior staff and is central to just about everything!”
Reviews.Author: VanG4
Reviews.Content: It is right on Mission Bay and is central to just about everything. Many beaches within walking distance and at your doorstep! Can't wait to go back again. The staff is the best from groundsmen to the top.

Reviews.Title: “So not worth it”
Reviews.Author: msgerena
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bahia for the Marine Corps Ball in Nov. 2009. The pictures on the internet were extremely misleading. We were put in the wrong room initially. The "bungalow" we stayed in was disgusting. It looked like a motel. It smelled extremely musty and I was hesitant to sleep in the beds. Housekeeping was horrendous. We asked for our room to be cleaned, even called the front desk to remind them. Housekeeping never showed up. I called again for additional linens and for our bed to be made and the employee couldn't give me wash cloths because she was out. She didn't even make the bed or clean the room. The catering service was terrible as well. The food at our event was disgusting. The only good thing about the hotel was the sister hotel the Catamaran where they had spa services. However, after going there I felt even worse about staying at the Bahia.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful!”
Reviews.Author: hollyberry1130
Reviews.Content: Tha Bahia was a wonderful resort with fantastic service. The concierge even gave the kids sand toys to play with at the beach. We saw dolphins on the boat ride, the kids enjoyed the playground and game room and we had a wonderful view. My only complaint was that the food was a bit lackluster for the price. I would certainly recommend the Bahia to anyone!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: R6_Rider36
Reviews.Content: Me and my new wife stayed here for the start of our honeymoon, it was fantastic! The service we recieved was amazing and the hotel grounds were stunning! The room was lovely with a huge bed and large tv and a stunning view! We would happily go back again and again!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect stay!”
Reviews.Author: fletcher_munson
Reviews.Content: We loved our stay at the Bahia resort. When we arrived we were greeted by two lovely ladies and they made sure we stayed in one of the recently rehabbed buildings (with a view of the beach). The hallway looked old, smelt weird and we were super skeptical.. until we walked into our room. It was perfect! It had the look of a really expensive resort room - super spacious, clean, beautiful - with a kitchenette. We loved the location too - it had its own beach and was about 1/2 a mile from Mission Beach. The receptionist also recommended Santana's (24hrs tacos place about 2 block from the hotel) and I had an awesome veggie burrito from there. There are plenty of dining options within a 1 mile radius. Highly recommend Bahia!

Reviews.Title: “get an extended stay discount or the 4th night free!”
Reviews.Author: CaliforniaTraveler73
Reviews.Content: If you're looking to stay in the Mission Bay area and with bayfront views, this is definitely a hotel worth considering! It's a Mediterranean style resort with its own beach, tennis courts, an Olympic-size pool, whirlpool/spa, gym, tennis courts, a restaurant, bar and water sports equipment for rent. Other pluses include free parking, internet service and room service. I also heard that the Bahia Belle at the pier takes hotel guests on free bay cruises during certain months. In any event, I stayed at the Bahia with some family members in December and a couple of them received the fourth night free. They have some other fantastic packages on their website where you have the opportunity to save even more; for example, there are discounted rates for an extended stay (2 nights or more), plus other packages or discounts to local attractions. They will even arrange for a spa treatment at Catamaran. Currently, winter rates are about $99, but at the time we stayed the minimum was about $119 for a garden view. In December, we stayed at a bayfront double room at $159, which was still a good deal considering the views and amenities. The room was contemporary and comfortable. It had a kitchenette, sofa bed, patio, and even had its own ipod docking pad! The staff was wonderful as well; they were accommodating and friendly. If you don't like your room, do request another one. We had a breakfast buffet one morning at the cafe and drinks another night at the bar, but there are also plenty of choices to eat nearby. Other nearby attractions (besides Sea World) include Belmont Park - inexpensive fun for the whole family - and don't miss free sunsets at Mission Beach; or you can just relax at the hotel's bayfront beach. As long as you don't expect a luxurious Ritz-Carlton property, you likely won't be disappointed. Save your money for more fun in San Diego while still experiencing all the comfort and ambiance of a cozy resort hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Room dark, creepy, old looking, with ants crawling in cupboards”
Reviews.Author: cargosmith
Reviews.Content: We arrived with two wee ones in tow anticipating a nice "bay view" room with one bedroom & kitchenette at the Bahia Resort. Boy, were we in for a sad surprise. Our view consisted on the back of an old Ford truck. And I paid extra for this view?? The ground floor room was dark and echoed slightly as there were weird tiles on the walls. It gave the room a subterranean feeling, like being underground. I didn't dare let my baby crawl on the carpet. We asked for another room. Unfortunately, still no improvement. When I opened the cupboard under the tiny sink in the second room to stow my baby supplies, there were ANTS crawling around in the old wooden cupboard. Ugh. That was it. We checked out the next day and spent the remainder of our stay in San Diego at another - WAY better, spotless, newer and cheaper(!) - well known chain hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, location location location, older property but well maintained”
Reviews.Author: Xybek
Reviews.Content: The outside grounds and garden areas are immaculate and the gardens are well cared for. The front 'seal pool' is well done, compares well to some Sea World exhibits. Pool is heated, sauna, fitness center are excellent. Many walking/biking trails. The 'Business center' is a small room with a single PC and printer. Good for printing on-line ticket vouchers. Room rental was 'Bay View' Room (a suite). Beds clean and comfortable. Kitchen and Bath had been refurbished at some point, although they told me this was not a refurbished room. Furniture condition good. Free internet is both regular wireless and also wired. Two TV's, free HBO. Can get internet on the TV but who does that? I overheard two other customers asking for better rooms, and getting them. You might do well to ask if unsatisfied with your room. If you have a complaint take it to the front desk to see if they can satisfy any shortcomings. I found that staff went to great lengths to make the stay better. Great hotel staff and reservation desk. Hotel emailed a satisfaction survey form after our stay. Booking - I received a MUCH better room rate by calling the hotel phone instead of using the website. Suite was $152 per night for 4 nights over the Christmas holiday, compared to about $186 for the same thing on the web. 'Bay View Suite', is large suite type room with two queen beds and a convert couch. Prices in the area can be crazy but I thought this was a good value, especially over xmas when holiday rates can spike. My only unresolved complaint was that the side bedroom was dark and cold (Main room in-wall heater did not ever do much to heat the side room, and only had small desk lamps in the room). Apparently they could not help with a space heater. Note: San Diego can be cold this time of year at night. Location - you can easily walk to either Mission Bay (smooth water play area) or Mission Beach (big waves and surfing). A nice little market with reasonable prices about a block away, many parks, marina rentals, beaches nearby. The hotel has a section of private beach, but we found the area entirely uncrowded this time of year.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Vacation Resort!”
Reviews.Author: SparkyDMFD
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at this hotel at the recommendation of a travel agent who had spent countless family vacations here as a child. We were absolutely thrilled with our accomations with a "Bay View Suite." Our room had a large patio overlooking Mission Bay. We were only a few short blocks to the Ocean, which was an added treat. The customer service provided at the front desk was premier. This resort is also conveniently located near many attractions. We would welcome the opportunity to return to Bahai Resort in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “had its own beach”
Reviews.Author: EllieK1
Reviews.Content: it had its own beach! i had a villa wich was right on the beach

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely fabulous place for family”
Reviews.Author: omega0000
Reviews.Content: We are a family of five and had a really lovely big room with sofabed and two doubles, plus a fully functioning kitchen - though we didn't use it as restaurant buffet breakfast too tempting! The pool is great, nicely divided into areas for swimmers and toddlers, the tennis court is fun, kids loved the sea lions and the beach - we went in August and it didn't feel too busy at all. Staff really friendly and helpful, rooms clean. Great location for Sea World and easy to get to other parts of San Diego. Would thoroughly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I'm sure it was nice in 1983!”
Reviews.Author: tiffany1231
Reviews.Content: For most visitors the location of the hotel, which is hardly a resort, is surely prime. It is close to Mission Bay, Belmont Park, Sea World and a host of other area attractions. Secondly, there is a bit of quaint-ness associated with the hotel that make it interesting...a small lagoon with rescued harbor seals and a small private beach (with a completely blocked view due to bloats in the slips) add a certain charm. That is where the luxuries end. We stayed in a bay view suite. The room had an ok layout, but was tighter than I imagined from looking at the photos online. The curtains, beddings and other tapestries were at least 20 years old. The carpet was shameful, stained, ratty and in worse condition than any place I've EVER stayed (rental apartments included). The room included a small kitchen, I considered this to be a plus...until I entered the room. The hotel is next to a small bay where one might rise early to fish; apparantly the previous guest had done just that and proceeded to clean those fish right in the kitchen. Upon opening the doors the first time I was met with an offensive odor that seemed to permeate the entire suite. I believe that the fisherman may have cleaned fish in the sink and then garbage disposal-ed the remains and guts. The smell lasted the entire stay. Next, we had intended to eat dinner at the hotel restaurant but missed the serviing hours due to traffic. We ordered room service and were truly disappointed. We were served leftovers from that morning's lunch buffet. The salad was limp and nothing resembled anything fresh. The house champagne shared by my husband and I was more like Squirt soda. In addition, we were told our food would arrive within 40 minutes. Over an hour later it finally arrived. With three small children in tow, waiting that long for food is not acceptable. After dinner I planned to get the kids settled down by purchasing a movie from the television system...at a price of close to $15.00 per movie we decided against it and we drifted off to sleep while watching the local news. There were other things that led to our disappointment as well: a lack of supervision in the pool area, where a large team of teenage soccer players took over the hot tub and proceeded to "dive" into the spa, splash and worst of all...wipe their runny noses on their hands and them rinse them in the water (this is where we got up and left). In addition, as spa owners, we were very concerned that the spa did not appear to be heated properly...as it was several degrees too low. The worst part of our stay happened four days after we checked out. I looked at my online banking statement and found that the hotel had overcharged me by $438.00! I phoned the front desk and was told that it was a system error. The woman didn't seemed surprised at all, and stated that it was happening to a lot of people. That I should call my bank. She then gave me a number to an accounting department to call in the morning to have the charge reversed...I just phoned and that number has been disconnected. I can understand a billing error...but considering the fact that she knew and was aware of this problem I should expect that a "resort" would CALL ME immediately and my bank to explain THEIR ERROR. I now have to give up my time to repair their flub. I went to the Bahia for two reasons...they were listed on the Sea World web site and they claimed to be a world class resort. Sadly, I will not return for many more than two reasons.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome resort! Will definitely recommend to others!”
Reviews.Author: henderson_9
Reviews.Content: This resort has everything to offer! It was very comfortable and family friendly! The location is excellent! Sea World is right around the corner and the entire area is absolutely beautiful! I can't wait to try it in the summer season! Awesome hot tub & heated pool! Very large rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Getting what you pay for..”
Reviews.Author: BilkoSheffield
Reviews.Content: Well this was the 3rd time we have visited the Bahia. Stayed in a Bay view studio. Must say I had read a few of the reports on this site. After mentioning this at reception upon arrival. We were put in a nice Bay view Studio instead of the garden view we had booked. The room was clean, if a little dated. No real problems to complain about. The staff are all great and very helpfull. Just remember this is a non rated hotel and not 5star. If thats what you are looking for, look again. This is a great hotel at the right price. Oh and the location is fantastic. Enjoy your trip.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families.”
Reviews.Author: GunnaEastYorkshire
Reviews.Content: A real gem! Great location on the beach close to the local attractions, Sea World about 5 minutes away. Rooms large and spacious with comfy beds. We had a kitchen as well if you wanted to make your own food. Great views over the bay. Pool open late and handy to let the kids let off steam, nice hot tub. There is a games room near the pool with free arcade games which is fantastic for kids, and adults! They have a boat which goes for trips round the bay and as we were guests it was free. The rescue seals are cute and you can walk to the Belmont Park in 10 minutes.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay will go back again”
Reviews.Author: traveltime21
Reviews.Content: The location of the Bahia Resort Hotel is wonderful! Short walk to beach and beautiful sunsets, close to Sea World. Clean rooms, helpful friendly staff made our stay very enjoyable. My wife said the spa was wonderful!!!

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our Stay”
Reviews.Author: valfrnandz
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Bahia Resort for a business/leisure trip. Upon checkin we were upgraded to a suite overlooking the bay. The room was modern, spacious and clean. The large balcony was a great place to view the Sea World fireworks in the evening - which were beautiful reflecting off of the water. As a guest of the hotel you are free to enjoy the bay cruise in the evenings - make sure you do, it is a lot of fun. We ate at the onsite restaurant for breakfast once, while the food was plenty the price was a little high.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation insomnia- bed bugs ruined my vacation”
Reviews.Author: Live4greatfood
Reviews.Content: Pros: It's a good location to Sea World and Beltmont park, and next to the bay. You get nice views if you have the bay view room. Price is cheap for the location, but there is a catch. Staffs are friendly. Cons: Believe whtat everyone said about outdated rooms. The carpets,beds, and curtains are very old. There are cracks in the shower wall very outdated bath room if you stay at the regular rooms. The suit looks newer but the kitchen is very outdated also. We didn't care much about old stuff, we knew it's only a 3 stars hotel wasn't really expecting much about it anyway since we live in S.Cal we just needed a decent clean place to stay and enjoy our short 3 days vaction. We stayed for 2 nights there and the first night we stayed at the regular room, both my husband and I slept in the bed near the curtains and woke up 4am in the morning because our skins were so itching. We had to take a shower. Good thing is that we have our 3 yr.old daughter were overall pj that covers the whole body and feet. She was fine the first night. I went to the front desk to complaint to have them change all the sheets but immediately they gave us a upgraded room. We thought the newer room would be better. This time my husband slept with my daughter. I slept again the bed near the window, I thought the newer room would be better. But let me tell you I woke up at 2 am , 3am, and 4am . Ear felt itching first, then my feet, and legs and then the whole body. I was so tired I didn't want to get up, and then I couldn't stand it anymore so I got up and took a shower. I sat on the sofa for a couple hours until Sunraise. It was a horrible experience if you have small children do not bring them there. PLEASE! Until they updated their room and matresses.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia is our San Diego spot”
Reviews.Author: aramanuman
Reviews.Content: We've been to this hotel twice now, and have enjoyed both visits. It's a bit old, but not too pricey and the rooms are very large. I like the kitchenettes in the rooms and the views of the bay. We ate at the restaurant once and were treated very well. Decent food. Didn't have much to do with room service, but the front staff were very helpful and nice. The hotel offers many different kinds of rooms, and most are very quiet. We enjoyed the pool, too. Nice, secluded walkways, gazebo, tennis courts. We visit San Diego at least once a year and appreciate Bahia's proximity to Sea World, too. Good value and a lot of variety.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place For A Wedding”
Reviews.Author: happystewardess
Reviews.Content: Excellent food. Professional staff. Perfect location.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for Families”
Reviews.Author: eliana23
Reviews.Content: Great location and complex which makes up for it being an older property. We could have stayed right there and not done anything else in San Diego. Super friendly staff as well. Nice sized room which was great for our family so we didn't feel like the 4 of us were right on top of each other,

Reviews.Title: “Room was a bit tired”
Reviews.Author: GAIL001
Reviews.Content: But i think it could have been our room was in the shade, felt a bit damp and musty, but we got used to it. It was clean and the bathroom was very good. The restaurant was very nice but no change in the menu, was good food and plenty of it though. The pool looked lovely and the whole resort was fantastic so beautiful, and peaceful. We loved it. The concierge again was very friendly and helpful and so were the reception staff. The hotel was very near a bus stop and you could hop on a bus and a have pass for the day for only 5dollars, and get off and on as many times as you liked. This hotel is lovely but so is san diego.

Reviews.Title: “Run Down”
Reviews.Author: musicman77
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel on a recommendation of a friend. We booked through a travel service and pre-paid for 5 nights. We only stayed 3. We booked a kitchenette room. We were in the fourt story building at the end of the property. When we entered the room, we noticed a musty smell. We then discovered that the toilet was plugged. The closet doors were not on their tracks, but were leaning against the closet. The sofa had holes in the cushions and you could see the padding. We asked to be placed in another room. We were moved to a room on another floor. This room had a working toilet and the closet doors were connected. However, the sofa was also worn through with stuffing poking out. The carpet was old and threadbare. My wife was afraid to walk on the carpet in bare feet. We had two double beds. These double beds are not large enough to sleep two people, so my son and I tried the pull out bed in the sofa. The pullout bed was worn so that we both rolled to the middle. We could not sleep. The kitchenette had a good woring refrigerator. We did not try the stove. The cupboards were just bare boards when opened. Our first day there we woke up and went to Sea World. We retruned to our room at around 5:00 p.m. and our room had not been visited by the maid yet so we wandered around grounds by the bay for awhile. The second day we were there we were awakened early in the morning by strange noises. We later found out that the building had plumbing problems and they were using a snake to try and clear the sewer lines from the building. The day after the third night there, our toilet plugged. When I called the front desk I was informed that the sewer lines from the building again had problems. sure enough, the snake was again employed. Because we could not sleep, the plumbing prolbems, the run down furnishings and the general disrepair of the room, we left and checked into a different hotel. When we left I spoke to the peson at the front desk who acted if this was not the first time this had happened. The only bright spot was the cruise around Mission Bay on the hotel ship. It is a short "cruise" but my family enjoyed it, except for the fact that we are non-smokers and there was no designated smoking area so it was hard to escape smoke. We would never again stay at this hotel. If you are going to Sea World, stay at a hotel farther from the park and drive a little farther, you will be better off.

Reviews.Title: “My entire stay at the Bahia was flawless!”
Reviews.Author: Nando504
Reviews.Content: Every staff member is an asset to the Bahia, friendly, efficient, helpful, courteous. They take care of the resort as if it is their own home and treat you as a welcomed guest. The grounds are beautiful, the dining delicious, the bar a quiet yet fun spot, it is just a short walk to the ocean, the rooms very comfortable. I give the Bahia a top rating.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing and overpriced”
Reviews.Author: OxieNZ
Reviews.Content: On 31 December 2008 I booked a quiet, non-smoking Bay View Deluxe Suite on the 2nd floor for two nights (2 and 3 October) for my husband, myself and our 10 year old daughter at the rate of US$239 per night. On arrival we were given Room 161 on the ground floor. The room (with separate bedroom) was very spacious and the bed comfortable. Upon arrival I was amazed at how outdated the dÃ©cor was. The bathroom looked original, ie not updated since about 1960. Anyway, our biggest disappointment was the fact that at no stage during our stay did we have a Bay View. I was really looking forward to being able to sit and enjoy the view. Parked in the street outside our room were three large motor homes. They were there the whole time of our visit, so we did not see the sea from our room at all. I understand that it is a public road outside, but I doubt very much if it is legal for motor homes to stay there night and day. The reception staff were indifferent to my complaints and not sympathetic at all. From my point of view I did not get what I paid for, so should not have been charged the full amount. I would have been better off having a room near the pool at a lower tariff. If it is common practice for motor homes to park day and night in the street outside then the Bahiaâ€™s website cannot offer Bay View Deluxe Suites should there not be any Bay Views. The hotel is in a great location should you wish to visit Sea World which was one of the reasons for choosing it.

Reviews.Title: “Older, but beautiful and a fun place to stay with kids”
Reviews.Author: AZFamily7
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights at the Bahia and it was great overall. I was a little nervous after reading the mixed reviews of the hotel but decided to stay due to the location. We were all disappointed to learn that the Bahia Belle only runs on Fridays and Saturdays in the winter time, and we stayed Sunday-Thursday. Our room looked quite scary from the outside, but inside it was fine. Roomy enough for us and our 5 kids. We had a few issues (the TV in the living room didn't work, and one lamp had no light bulbs) but maintenance took care of it right away. The kids loved being right on the beach and playing in the grassy areas all over the hotel. They have a small playground right on the beach with sailboats for renting, (they were hide and seek spots for us!) There is also a complimentary arcade which was a huge hit. I don't think I'd stay here for a nice business trip away, but it was a great beachy place to take the family!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: AnnLib
Reviews.Content: The resort was beautiful and the staff was wonderful and helpful! I would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Had my wedding guests stay here (my wife and I also)”
Reviews.Author: jneuberg
Reviews.Content: Fantastic. We did our wedding at another locatoin (sunset cliffs/thursday club) and the Bahia was super accomodating. Absolutely no complaints. Walking distance to the beach/boardwalk, great pool, fun bar, boat rides around the bay. Free internet, Free parking (the Dana next door charges for both) Outstanding!

Reviews.Title: “Bahia really cared about my comfort and enjoyment!”
Reviews.Author: SeattleJoel
Reviews.Content: Our trip was a pleasusre before we even left for San Diego. The concierge was extremely helpful in email conversations, and practically had our trip planned for us before we even left! Upon arrival with our two yonng children, we were told we'd have a short wait before our suite was ready, but only because we had been upgraded to a beach view first floor room. What a wonderful surprise. Our sliding glass door opened to a terrific view of Mission Bay, and the beach at the marina. The resort itself is very close to Sea World, and within reasonable driving distance to the zoo, and the ocean beaches. Grocery shopping is a snap, just a short drive away. This are not new buildings, but beautifully cared for grounds, pools, and well maintained rooms well make up for any aging.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing Time at the Bahia!”
Reviews.Author: weaverama
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently spent a weekend at the Bahia Resort Hotel in San Diego. I was a bit worried what the room would be like after reading several poor reviews on TripAdvisor! When we got there, I think I was holding my breath as we opened the door to our room! Fortunately, when we walked in the room, it was a very pleasant surprise! It was beautifully furnished with 2 beds, a couch (with a pull out bed), two chairs, a round table, and a coffee table. We also had a small kitchen (nice surprise!) with two bar stools at the counter! The room also had a small bathroom, with separate vanity area. The balcony overlooked the small beach on the side of the hotel, with a view of Mission Bay. The only thing we did not like about our stay - the local restaurants are very difficult to go to if you are driving because hte parking is lousy! Other than that - we had a great time and would definitely return to this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Completely relaxing!”
Reviews.Author: momlette
Reviews.Content: We did not know what to expect because this was a free 2 night stay we got from our credit union. We didn't even make the reservation. But we were pleasantly surprised. Our room was big (a seperate bedroom with 2 comfortable beds) and a small kitchenette and living room. The bathroom was quite decent. The decor was old, but if you're playing out on the beach, you don't want to be coming into a fancy room with sandy feet and clothes! We were so happy our room had a kitchenette. We went to the grocery store (very close) so we can have a couple of meals in. We even ordered in Pizza. The Bahia Belle was so much fun and so nice. We road the Belle to the other side of the bay where we had a wonderful dinner. Got back on the Belle for our ride home. The live music was fun! It was so great not to have to worry about driving and parking! I can't comment about value...like I said, it was a free trip...but I'm definitely looking into coming here for a family reunion.

Reviews.Title: “Great Experience”
Reviews.Author: Flowinna
Reviews.Content: Really nice resort! We wanted to have a nice family vacation without paying too much money and decided to try something at home (knowing how many people are choosing San Diego for their vacation :) We enjoyed so much! We felt like we went to Hawaii :) The resort has a wonderful garden and the rooms are looking either into the sea(the bay) or into the garden. The room (we had a garden view room) had a feel of a separated cabin. The location is great and unbeatable. The view of the bay is incredible. They have a great private beach, very nice pool, kids activities that we really liked, kids playground on the beach and music performances in the restaurant. We really enjoyed all of these and much more and highly recommend the resort to everybody.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, helpful staff, big pool, but just a tad outdated rooms.”
Reviews.Author: jacaru
Reviews.Content: We got a good online offer for the garden view rooms a few months back and booked them. Unfortunately, they don't offer connecting rooms so my kids were in another room but at least were next door. The pool is huge and the hot tub very large too... a highlight of the hotel. Food is affordable, and staff were friendly and helpful. Unfortunately, we got what we paid for in terms of ambience with the rooms. These are the older cinderblock-construction rooms. The furnishings were fine and reasonably updated, but the rooms were a bit dark and cell-like in feeling. I might try to spring for one of the bay-view rooms next time. My younger daughter had a blast at the Belmont Park, and we enjoyed the bike path around the bay. One potential hazard with hotel: there were at least 4 events both nights we were there, so it can get noisy if your room happens to be where the event is. But it was fine for us.

Reviews.Title: “Straight out of the 60's”
Reviews.Author: Kaysclan
Reviews.Content: The beds are small, the bathroom is tiny. The windows are thin - we listened to a loud drunken conversation outside of our window at 1:30 in the morning. We had to call security. The security man walked by smoking, and it was as if the smoke was in our room. We heard beeping all morning, it ended up being an alarm clock several rooms down, but the walls and rooms are so thin, we could hear it. We were going to stay for 4 nights, but quickly checked out after the first one. The price was not outstanding. There was broken glass on our patio. It was one of the worst hotel experiences we have ever had. Do NOT book this with a trip on Travelocity. The hotel was reasonable about us leaving, but I had to spend forever on the phone sorting it out with Travelocity.

Reviews.Title: “I think you could get a better deal elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: canadian_trish
Reviews.Content: We prepaid for three nights here but wish we'd only spent one night here. Pro's: we could park right at our door so we didn't have to walk far with our luggage. The view was nice from our bed onto the bay (we stayed in room 111). Close to the beach, and Seaworld, only a couple blocks away. Con's: there was a tiny sink with mini-counter with dim lighting, so not great for getting ready. The carpets were very old, dirty, and could stand a cleaning. The bed was very swayed, like with a big dent in the middle, so you couldn't lay flat, which made for a sore back in the mornings. The patio doors were very hard to open/close/lock and didn't come with screens or sheers, only blackout curtains, so if you wanted light you had to rely on very old yellowish lightbulbs, or be open to everyone walking past to view your room. When you move on the bed, the lights would flicker, depending on where the cord was. The TV was small, old, and in a bad spot - right up next to your head, so you had to really turn your head to watch tv. the bedspreads were really really old and I didn't even want to sit on it, I don't know when they were last cleaned. One day we didn't receive any maid service, but we didn't really mind that much since we had lots of towels. The toilet ran until you jiggled the handle, which makes it feel like home I guess. hahaha. We could hear the people in the next room word for word since the walls were so thin. The pool was okayyyyyy, but nothing special. Just a little square pool. Although there was a big hottub area, but it always seemed to be full of kids. I would never recommend this place for the price they charged. We checked out and went to the Westin and paid less. For this place we paid $134/night for the bay view room. It's in serious need of a complete overhaul.

Reviews.Title: “This place SUCKED!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: holybass1
Reviews.Content: On the first night, we went to the buffet and we didn't like being seated outside in the back and in the dark (I would also like to add that we were the only black family there)while old white people glared at us as if we didn't belong there. There were plenty of places that were well lit, toward the front, and not reserved so we just ended up leaving to get tacos. Also, when I went into their on site store to buy some things, the manager who worked in the store totally ignored me (she wouldn't even make eye contact), but spoke to all of the white patrons who came in after me. Overall, this place sucked; it had an old musty smell, no A/C, the floormats in the shower were dirty and mildewed. It was also infested with ants. We were given the wrong room; we were promised a beachfront room and ended up getting a view of the back parking lot. The place had an overall creepiness to it and they should be ashamed of themselves to charge people so much to stay 2 seconds in that dump!

Reviews.Title: “We cant wait to go back, we had a wonderful time!!!!”
Reviews.Author: 3handsomeboys
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went for our 1 year anniversary. We wanted to enjoy ourselves and have a relaxing time. We couldn't have picked a nicer spot. Our room was so nice and comfortable, it was better then we expected!!! We spent a lot of time by the pool drinking Margarita's which were very tasty!!! Our suite was facing the Marina and we were able to see the Bahia Belle come and go in the evening, it was a beautiful view. We only ate breakfast at the cafe and the buffet was awesome, we were saying how we would go back and eat even if we arent staying at the hotel!!! We had such a wonderful time that we plan on going back in October for my Birthday!!! I would recommend this hotel for a couple wanting a nice relaxing time or even a family wanting a fun vacation, lots to do and great location....... Leticia Serrano

Reviews.Title: “DISGUSTING.”
Reviews.Author: CiaoNiks
Reviews.Content: Whatever you do, make sure you are not staying in a garden view room. Me and my boyfriend paid $160 for the night (tonight) and when walking into the garden area I was getting worried. Pink little bungalows that made me feel like I was entering a janitor's closet. I do alot of traveling and am never picky about rooms as long as they are clean! When we entered the room every thing was out of date and the room smelt of urine. The carpet was very unclean, I did not even want to remove my shoes. The bathroom was covered in mold and the bed spread looked and felt 30 years old. I have stayed in hostels much nicer than this and would rather of paid $60 to stay at a Motel 6. We were very disappointed and asked to get a refund. The man at the front desk had no problem refunding our money even though they have a 24 hour cancellation policy. So we gathered this must happen alot. Thankfully we only live 2 hours away and were able to return home. The bay view rooms (which are the ones they advertise online) look nicer and they are in a completely different building. I can not recommend this to anyone. The price is ridiculous for such unclean rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel.... Fantastic weekend !!!”
Reviews.Author: returnvisit0r
Reviews.Content: We travel to San Diego quite a bit. We have family that live there. It was always hard to find a hotel in our price range that was as nice and clean as we liked. That is until we found the Bahia Resort. We used to travel around San Diego and visit family. Now the family visits us at the Bahia. We hardly ever have to leave the Hotel. The food is excellent. The Tangier bar is excellent and the beach is excellent!!! The hotel is always clean and the staff is always very polite and helpful. We will not be staying anywhere else when we come to San Diego.! We always stay in either the garden or bay view studio. They are very large and the view is great. The Bahia is the best value for the money.

Reviews.Title: “relax”
Reviews.Author: refugehop
Reviews.Content: I have enjoyed the Bahia Resort on other occasions, that's why we continue to come back. It is located in a great spot, where we can enjoy walking, bike riding, water (bay & beach) or just hanging out.

Reviews.Title: “We didn't want to leave”
Reviews.Author: phoenix01
Reviews.Content: The grounds were lush and tropical and view was stunning. Our second floor room overlooked the hotel's private beach. We had a nice balcony. The king sized bed was comfortable and the service was excellent. Would gladly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, terrible room”
Reviews.Author: Florida40
Reviews.Content: The hotel staff are great and knowledgeable and the resort itself is beautiful, but the accommodation (we stayed in room 169, second floor) was horrible. We arrived after a 12 hour flight and decided that we would not be spending much time there. There is carpet on the landing as you approach the apartment and carpet inside and outside on the balcony!!! Needs dusting on a regular basis and fridge should be cleaned on a regular basis. I'm sure it's been there since the hotel opened and was the source of the smell along with the air conditioner. Please Bahia owners get rid of the carpet. I would have to say look for another place but in that location as it's close to many things and beautiful. San Diego is beautiful. Travelled with an 8 & 12 year old and another adult

Reviews.Title: “An Awful trip”
Reviews.Content: This was an awful experience. We called in at 10:50 AM for our room and they told us room is available. We arrived at the hotel and checked in; the room was next to noisy traffic area in front of the lobby. We told them this room is too noisy; and we need another room, they told us they will call, as soon as, they have the room ready. We waited and no calls until we got tired and went to lobby at 3:40, then they told us the room is ready. We saw the room and the room stunk. We had bought ticket to sea world and could not waste the tickets by spending another four hours on the room. We went to SeaWorld came late and slept at stinky room. The sofa had stains, the forth floor had a leak dripping water on the third floor (our room 426). Next day we complaint and they give us another room, which had rust in the bath tub. I asked them, we only need a clean room. They told us; we do not have another room and we had to wait few hours. I could not destroy my kids and my vacation just waiting on a room for second day, therefore, I asked them to check us out and we will go to another hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome family friendly resort with so much to offer!!”
Reviews.Author: LQGIRL
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for a weekend getaway or longer! My husband, myself and our 18 month old stayed for a friend's wedding that took place at the resort. It is an awesome place! Definitely kid friendly. Has a great pool (with food & drink available poolside), tennis courts, & it is right on the ocean. The wedding was put together beautifully too! This resort has so much to offer. You don't even need to leave . . .

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful birthday celebration at the Bahia Resort Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Texan22
Reviews.Content: I decided to treat myself to a stay at the Bahia Resort Hotel to celebrate my 60th birthday. My aunt and uncle from Chula Vista and cousins from Chula Vista and San Diego helped me celebrate. I had never stayed at the Bahia Resort Hotel before. The grounds were beautiful, and my room had a wonderful view of the bay. The private beach was a treat. The hotel's staff were customer friendly and very helpful. The Cafe Bahia and the Tangier's Bar were relaxing places to eat & drink. I will always remember this birthday because of the Bahia Resort Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort”
Reviews.Author: jodeemax
Reviews.Content: Our family took an Easter trip to the Bahia Resort and had the time of our lives. The resort was very convenient (especially since we were traveling with young grandchildren).
