When we arrived we parked our car and never had to use it until we checked out. Everything was right on site, walked, or took tours to the places we wanted to visit. Staff was very friendly and the food at the resort was excellent and reasonable. We had an ocean front room wih play area for the children right out our back door. It was one of the best short trips we have ever taken. The only thing I wish we could of done was bring our small dogs, then our vacation would have been complete. We plan on taking another family trip to the Bahia in the fall. It's grounds were a photographers dream. Lush and greenery on one part and a beautiful ocean on the other.

Reviews.Title: “tropical paradise without going to the the bahamas”
Reviews.Author: dgr25
Reviews.Content: when I first walked into the lobby, the host greeted me immediately with great hospitality, i they were knowledgeable about 15 questions i had because this was a spontaneous 2 day getaway. the Marina suite room was great mellow style. plasma tv's, little bar and kitchen, frig, hairdryer for lady's, great view outside the sliders onto the patio with two lounger chairs. the marina is a rocks throw with a little two-chair canvas covered lounger. Bed was great in the separate room, but the only complaint about the whole trip is that the pull out bed in the sofa was a little rough sleep. My buddy told me, I was in the separate nicer room.hehehe. BRING BIKES!!! its 2 seconds away from the boardwalk get in the crowds people watch because there is plenty to look at.....A prodigious amount shops,restraunts, pubs/bars and so much more. us 4 rode our bikes farther then the girls wanted too without a doubt, but we found great eats everywhere shops to browse.. i liked the fact you can have a great time with your friends and at the same time you can have a romantic time with your girlfriend or wife at the same place. next time, im going to book in advance maybe get some package deals, and spend at least 2 nights if not a week...

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, friendly staff, great experience”
Reviews.Author: TUBird19
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for price, convenience to the beach, and 4 star quality. I received all of the above with the ease and also received exceptional customer service from the front desk and room service. The room was large, cozy, and perfectly romantic. We were located within walking distance to the beach and surrounded by many restaurants and other attractions. I have zero compaints about the Bahia Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Nowhere Else on Earth!”
Reviews.Author: cal57Md
Reviews.Content: Originally from SoCal, when my daughter graduated from college, I promised her a trip home. Weird staying in a hotel where you used to live, but I wouldn't stay anywhere else! Clean, quaint and comfortable, the proximity and availability to all the fun was perfect. Even though they're connected, the rooms have the feel of individual cabanas. Mission Bay is beautiful and Pacific Beach rocks, not to mention Sea World and Old Town. We ate on the lounge patio every meal we could. Isabel, our server, made us feel like family and made the trip even more special. I am looking foward to taking my husband as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Adequate...just”
Reviews.Author: Bo_Nidle
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the rooms facing into the bay with a view of Seaworld. Rooms were in need of redecoration. Aircon worked but was very loud. Be aware that the road and beach on this side are open to the public from around 7am to 11pm. The result is that the beach area immediately in front of these rooms is always populated with members of the public so you have very little privacy and vehicles driving up and down continually, beach parties with fires and some staying overnight. Staff were courteous in general but the level of professionalism varied. In the restaurant we were left with a feeling that if we did not wish to partake of the themed evening buffet we were something of a nuisance. Location is good for the city and Seaworld and the nearby beach is also good. Cleaning staff were efficient so no complaints there. Boat hire was good and the guys running it friendly and courteous. To sum up: It was adequate but nothing to write home about. Would we use it again? I'm afraid not.

Reviews.Title: “The best value for a family San Diego vacation.”
Reviews.Author: bubbataz
Reviews.Content: Let me first start off by saying that I know when people first look at our marks for the Bahia, they will probably think that we just zipped through the ratings not really considering and waying each one. We did. The main things we were looking for was privacy on the beach, and close to attractions. We stayed in a marina suite at the bahia. As for ratings cleanliness; The room was clean, modern, and well furnished. The grounds were clean, well manicured, and spacious. The restaurant was clean, well staffed, had a great atmosphere ( live music for dinner, aesthetically pleasing ), and very affordable. I have a teenage son so having an buffett bar is very helpful. As for service: whether it was housekeeping, grounds staff, restaurant, or the front desk. Everyone was friendly and acommidating. As for location: hard to get better we had the benefit of a private stretch of beach on mission bay, yet we were only 1 1/2 blocks from the ocean. Close to seworld and an oceanside amusement park. Everything was close,yet we still had privacy. As for value: this is probably the greatest thing that we found out about the Bahia. Unlike some of the other resorts in the area the Bahia doesn't niclke and dime you to death. Other places would have a descent room rate, but then you pay for parking, to use the gym, ect... ect.. At the Bahia parking is free, the gym is free,they have a free arcade, they show movies at the pool at night with free popcorn and soda, you get a free cruise on the paddle boat around mission bay, ect.. Great value.

Reviews.Title: “This worked great for us”
Reviews.Author: Luv2VacationForever
Reviews.Content: This place was a great destination for someone traveling with small children. The location doesn't get much better. They have a lot of great things for kids to do without leaving the hotel, which makes the price of the hotel not seem so bad. The rooms - many people have complained of old and musty. These places are old, and they are along the beach, which will make anything old and musty. We had a garden view room, which I would recommend for noise reasons, and it wasn't bad at all. It was very clean, and the place seemed newly remodeled. I would definitley stay here again. Two complaints - the parking was iffy...don't get in too late. The price is a little high, but you are definitely paying for location.

Reviews.Title: “Time for a makeover.”
Reviews.Author: Anne-Mari08
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights. I was very apprehensive having read such bad reviews just before we got there so was expecting the worst. However it wasn't awful. The rooms where we stayed in were clean enough, not gleaming, but definitely needed redecorated. We were in the little pink "huts" at the back of the resort which had a good view of the seaworld fireworks but not much else going for it. Room had everything we required but luckily we didn't spend much time in it as it was rather depressing and tatty.Location is good for the Zoo and Seaworld and Mission Beach is a short walk away. Food was good in the restaurant. Staff were mostly helpful. Did have one grumpy waitress.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great with our 2 year-old”
Reviews.Author: f8ster
Reviews.Content: Overall a very nice stay. We were in one of the suites, which was large (but expensive). It was nice to have a separate bedroom; our child slept in the living room on the foldaway couch. The beach outside the back door (see pictures) is very clean, very calm, and uncrowded, even on weekends. The location of the hotel is excellent, about 4 minutes from Sea World. Traffic in the area is not great on the weekends. There's a grocery store (Ralph's) and Starbucks about 10 minutes away (our room had a kitchen). A GPS is helpful. The place was quite quiet while we were there and we generally didn't have any issues with noise from the adjacent rooms. The rooms are not what I would describe as gloriously elegant, but they're typical of other resort hotels and were more than adequately furnished. The room was clean and we had everything we needed. The hotel has several rental boats, including kayaks and a little electric boat that held all 3 of us. We had a great time cruising slowly around the bay and we got lots of good pictures. The water in the bay is very calm and there's no surf on the beach -- it's almost like a lake shore. Our 2 year-old loved waking up and going straight out to play on the beach every morning. The beach was very close to our porch, and several families let their kids play on the beach while they sat on the porch. Overall, it was tough to find too much to complain about, other than possibly the cost. However, we will definitely consider staying here again and we really had an excellent stay and vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent.......for what it is”
Reviews.Author: michael71201
Reviews.Content: Its a hotel built 50 years ago, that has held up incredibly well considering its located on a beach (think sand) and in a Marine Climate (think erosion). I travelled with my son, who is 8 and he considered our room Awesome, and did not want to leave. The pool and gameroom were Awesome in his opinion. The hotel, was safe and right near a beach and Mission beach. Short cab or bus ride to Sea World. The staff, seemed stuck in a situation they could not control. Outdated computers, limited amenities for guests, probably alot of people with high expectations. The staff was unbelievably accomodating. I could have cared less for anything but a safe experience for kids, but staff members kept going the extra distance to make us feel at home.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful resort--Incredible value!”
Reviews.Author: NASCARFAN5
Reviews.Content: Stayed one week in a bay front deluxe suite. The room is very large with a full kitchen. The suite was very clean and modern. Beautiful, lush grounds were maintained daily. The beach is combed every morning! Gorgeous gardens and ponds. Wonderful assortment of activities for children 4 and above everyday! The pool is lovely and so fun--BBQ and island music to listen to while you relax or play in the pool. Dive in movies at night--this place was awesome for kids! The restaurant's food was fabulous. The Jamaican Buffet and live steel drum music was the best night for us! The staff, service, and rentals for watersports was great. The Bahia Belle Boat Cruise was fantastic. The Captain and crew were so polite and professional, and the cruise on the bay was so entertaining. The front desk staff, cleaning staff, and restaurant personnel are very attentive and polite. Nice, modern equipment in the fitness center. Excellent location--right next to Belmont Park, Sea World, and Mission/Pacific Beach. We loved this resort!

Reviews.Title: “Unwelcoming Staff, Marijuana Smell, Not Enough Parking, Old Place, Very Overpriced”
Reviews.Author: PatriciaLaska
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to this Hotel for her B-Day. We planned to stay for 3 nights but checked out as soon as we could. The hotel was quite old and very overpriced. The staff was unwelcoming and very unaccommodating. The place was dirty and full of questionable characters. At times, Marijuana smelled throughout the hotel premises during the visit. We had a very bad experience in this Hotel. Even though this is supposed to be high class hotel, it is not that at all. Do not get fooled by the high prices. Staff is bad and the Hotel is very dirty. Everything is old. The AC is not working. Lack of parking spaces. Very bad hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Over priced, under renovated, location was good.”
Reviews.Author: AZdreamgirl
Reviews.Content: If you have stayed at a resort before, you may be dissappointed. The rooms havent' been renovated or revamped within 5 years or longer so that takes away from the hotel right when arrive. For the price you are paying you expect up to date decor. Also there is one resturaunt and one bar at the resort and a small lap pool, that can get pretty crowded pretty quick for a resort/hotel that size. We did venture over to the Catamaran resort which had a few more options for dinning, so that was good. I enjoyed the private beach and the marina. We rented a kayak and a powerboat, that is what saves this resort from being a complete disappointment in my oppinion. While the weather and location make up for it, it was not what we had hoped for or expected. We will not be returning there again.

Reviews.Title: “TERRIBLE - would not stay again”
Reviews.Author: moogun
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for only 3 nights (thankfully), it was reccommended by Air New Zealand when we booked other accomm, but it was terrible. We had stayed at the Howard Johnson, anaheim which was lovely. We found this VERY dated, the room was at the back of the hotel on the bottom floor, it had floor to celing windows with a sliding door that the kids couldn't even get open, there was no privacy if the cutains were open to let some light in as we faced the grassed area that people walked across, and with them closed we only had two little lamps to light the room. The kitchenette was just OK as well as the bathroom. Whilst the room was quite large by hotel standards we just felt it was very old and dingy. People coming back at night were very loud and disruptive and as we were on the bottom floor there was constant noise from the above room. I also could not believe that people staying there had dogs in their rooms - absolutely not acceptable in my book and we felt disgusted after realising that animals had slept in our room (sorry if i have offended people but I believe dogs should live outside). We paid just over $800 AUD for our 3 nights and felt ripped off. We walked around the establishment to see if we would upgrade but they all seemed old and dated and I felt we would be wasting our money, so we stuck with our room. I was very annoyed because I had e-mailed this establishment twice before our departure to find out what type of room had been booked for us - they had not responded to either of them. The free games room for the kids was a positive in a hotel that is in desperate need of some modernisation, especially if you are asking people to pay that sort of money, I only paid $1100 in anaheim for 6 nights. Thankfully San Diego was a lovely place but do some homework as there is much better accommodation options around.

Reviews.Title: “Great family vacation spot for kids”
Reviews.Author: m511266qa
Reviews.Content: We love to stay at the Bahia every year. The kids love to swim in the huge heated pool! We also are impressed with the size of the rooms and always get the Bayview Suite. Its perfect for our large family of 6. We also get the bonus of watching fireworks from our balcony. We will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Met ALL our needs!”
Reviews.Author: zfishpond
Reviews.Content: From beginning, (making reservations) to the end, (both check out and lunch after lunch closing time), our experience was a sound investment of our time and money. We were pampered, needs met before we could finish making our request known. Our son's reception was awesome. The serving staff was both friendly and attentive. Because of the late night reception the night before check out, we asked for a one hour extended check out time. We were granted that request. Because there was a time delay for one of our party, their check out time was extended beyond the check out time. The Bahia Resort truly loves to meet the needs of their guest. We had a group of 10 come into the cafe for lunch 10 minutes before closing for the afternoon to prepare for the dinner hour. Our hostess/server Jeannie was so gracious. She treated us like we were guest in her own home. I can't say enough about the great friendly service.

Reviews.Title: “paradise on the coast”
Reviews.Author: TCVeteran
Reviews.Content: Bahia is the finest hotel experience I have ever had in the continental US. The service and friendliness of the staff is outstanding. The facilities, location and activities are all five star. Wonderful surroundings, relaxing atmosphere and great location to walk to the Pacific ocean beach or catch a bus to Old Town or Downtown. definitely the place to stay again next trip to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “We enjoyed our stay!”
Reviews.Author: TerryinSD
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a week in one of their Marina Suites, which was a nice size for our family of 3 and our dog. The hotel just became pet-friendly and we were happy to be able to stay there with him. The location is great! We went on daily walks and bike rides along the beach and bay. We knew it wasn't a 5 star hotel, so we weren't expecting that. The hotel is old, but they keep it up as best they can. Our room was clean and the staff very friendly. We will DEFINITELY stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice with some caveats”
Reviews.Author: GatoRat
Reviews.Content: The Bahia Resort hotel is located in a very nice, very accessible part of Mission Bay. Pacific Beach is a short walk away and there are several activities located right on the hotel property. The pool was a little cool, but my kids loved it and my wife and I enjoyed a leisurely swim as well. The hotel was quiet and our room had a good view. I recommend this hotel with a few caveats: 1) It's old. I liked the feel and ambiance, but others may find that it isn't modern enough. 2) Since it's adjacent to Pacific Beach, it can get chilly, especially in June. This is no fault of the Bahia, but some guests apparently don't understand San Diego and that this is common up and down the coast there. 3) The beds were a little uncomfortable. My wife and I couldn't quite pin down why since we've slept on harder beds without a problem. It might have just been the smaller double beds we had. 4) The food on premises is VERY expensive and VERY family unfriendly. Fortunately, there are several family restaurants in the area. 5) The TV didn't always work well for pay movies. This wasn't a big issue for us since we weren't in the mood, but for a longer stay my kids may have wanted to watch a movie and that would have been hit or miss.

Reviews.Title: “Quality and service doesn't justify the price”
Reviews.Author: seyyah_2009
Reviews.Content: After paying $200 per night, our expectations from Bahia were higher than what we got. Although the rooms were spacious, they were old and not very clean. The location of the hotel is right by the beach but the weather was cloudy and cold when we were there, so we didn't use the beach or the pool. There are also not many restaurants close by, so you need to take a cab or bus to go to the old town or gas lamp quarter. Overall, I don't think this hotel is worth the price, esp. during May/June, when it is never sunny in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “In the Middle of Everything!”
Reviews.Author: Sneech
Reviews.Content: Staying here was for business, so free time was at a minimum. But with the Bahia being not only on Mission Bay (meaning I could sit on the beach at lunchtime), but was only a short walking distance to the ocean beach with its activities and a 10 minute drive to Downtown San Diego. The hotel has a nice indoor/outdoor bar and restaurant; food and food value was excellent! I didn't have a chance to use the pool or fitness center, but for someone who was "trapped" there for work (with no car-but the concierge was VERY helpful in setting up taxi service), this is an excellent resort at which to be "trapped"! PS: When you go, say "Hi" to the seals, Grace and Billy for me!

Reviews.Title: “Will be my family vacation spot from here on out !!!”
Reviews.Author: kritter_9
Reviews.Content: Love this hotel, we went during Easter with our 5 year old son they had great activities for him and a wonderful egg hunt. Rooms and grounds are beautiful, and you are within walking distance of the boardwalk with rides for the kids our son loved it.

Reviews.Title: “The Getaway we needed!”
Reviews.Author: sandiegonative2009
Reviews.Content: I took my husband here for one night as a surprise so we could get away without the kids for some time to relax. We stayed in a bayfront room that overlooked the Marina and the Bahia Belle. I was very impressed with how friendly the staff was! I had requested early check in, which, let's face it, you almost always NEVER get when you request it but the woman at the front desk sent someone out to clean a room right away and they were able to get us into the room a whole hour earlier than even early check in was! The private beach has lots of covered lounge chairs and is perfect to lounge on all day-which is what we did. We enjoyed a really nice lunch and cocktail out on the patio at the Tangiers lounge and had a really relaxing late dinner at the Cafe Bahia. We took the complimentary cruise on the Bahia Belle at sunset which was fantastic, complete with cocktails. We didn't participate in the 21 and up only cocktail cruise later that evening but I'm sure it would have been fantastic. Overall a GREAT trip for the price. I've heard some people complain about the rooms but honestly, our room was very clean and well kept- it wasn't five star bed linens and completely updated furniture but it was clean and relatively new and really we spent almost no time in the room so it was perfect. Was perfect for us as a couple and would be perfect for families as well as they even have a playground on the beach!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful wonderful wonderful”
Reviews.Author: MichelleCUtah
Reviews.Content: What an amazing trip. The garden view room was wonderful. so clean, newly refurbished and was huge. It even had a kitchenette that I wasn't expecting. Staff was so helpful. And the location was perfect, close to everything we wanted to see. The Gardens were lavish, the restaurant wonderful it and the beach was perfect. I highly recommend this hotel

Reviews.Title: “Family friendly and an amazing place in the most perfect location!!”
Reviews.Author: stranchant
Reviews.Content: I have read many of the reviews on here and see many valid points for the ones that did not enjoy their stay, but mine was amazing!! First of all I took my wife and 2 year old son here on a short trip since we live only 2-3 hours away. We arrived at around 1 and were placed immediately into our room which was a Garden View Double. They view of the garden was amazing and the families of ducks that were always moving around the property made my sons day. While I will admit that there were minor problems with the room such as some updating to items that had rusted (rails for closet door), there was nothing else wrong. We went to Sea World which was a 5 minute drive at the most and downtown many times which put us in the perfect place. One issue we had was that the boat, "The Bahia Bell" only ran on Friday - Sunday during the spring, but we were advised that it ran everyday in the summer and is free to resort guests. The grounds I will say again were amazing!!! They had their own private beach, which we took our son down to play on some of the slides and swings along with picking up sea shells and playing in the sand. The Seal pond for two of the animals was a perfect size. We actually spoke to someone when at Sea World that knew the hotel and we were told the care of the seals was one of the best along with the enclosure exceeding the normal standards. Every one of the staff we spoke to were very knowledgeable to the animals on property and would give you times to when the seals are fed so you can watch. The pool area was great also. The hot tub was absolutely huge. I think it could fit around 22 people inside it, along with the pool that was great size also. Throughout the stay we were very pleased with the care and overall feel of the resort and they have gained a loyal customer.

Reviews.Title: “great location, disappointing rooms”
Reviews.Author: zhuchka
Reviews.Content: The hotel was in a great location and the grounds are nice. The pool was nice, but the area and pool itself was too small for the amount of people staying their. We spent most of our time on the private beach, which was nice and relaxing - not too many people. It was in walking distance to the ocean and boardwalk. The room was a total let down. It was a typical motel-type room. It was clean, but just "felt" dirty and was pretty depressing to look at. There were water stains and bubbling paint on the ceiling. The only natural light source was a sliding glass door, so in order to let any light into the room you had to open the blinds and every person that walked by could see into your room - not very pleasant. Our air conditioner made a terrible noise when we it was on, so we couldn't sleep with it on at night. I cannot stress enough how awful the room was - we tried to only sleep in it and spend as little time as possible in it. Also, the walls are paper thin, so we could hear our neighbors conversations and it was loud at night. The staff was friendly. Our only complaint is that we had the desk staff order us a cab the day we checked out to take us to the airport. They forgot, then forgot again, and finally on the 3rd request we were able to get one. We got to the airport a lot later than we wanted to. The food in the restaurant was typical hotel food - nothing special, kind of bland, and overpriced. For being so close to the beach, the price is right. But I would not recommend this hotel to anyone - it just wasn't worth the bargain.

Reviews.Title: “NOT as described! This place is a ripoff!”
Reviews.Author: EllicasMom
Reviews.Content: My husband and two girls (ages 4 and 6) planned to stay at this "resort" for our spring break, 6 days and 5 nights. I am the trip-planner of my family and i ALWAYS check out tripadvisor.com before booking any hotels! I truly do not know how this hotel has the rating it has on here! FIRST of all, the pictures on the website for this hotel are extremely deceiving! This is NOT a resort, it is not even an hotel, i would call it a MOTEL...you motor in and park and walk to your rooms. The pool is much smaller than pictured, the "private beach" is a bay/marina filled with ships, rental boats, dinner-cruise ships, etc. It's a bay, so this is expected, given, but it is very crowded with vessels up on the beach. (Please be aware, your kids cannot get in this water! Its nasty, like any harbor would be. AND the sand is dirty, muddy.) While we were waiting for our room to be ready (4pm checkin with kids is horrific) we tried to go to the little outside bar/restaurant, but noone greeted us, asked us if we even wanted anything, we sat ourselves and after a few minutes got up and left. Outside the bar they have this little sad "pen" with a little bit of water in it where they keep two sealions. They looked miserable. When we finally checked into our "Bay Front Suite" on the first floor on the "private beach" I walked in and immediately told my husband, "I am not staying here!". Call me a hotel snob, but this room was reminiscent of the cheap hotels my dad used to make us stay in after a long day's drive in our stationwagon on our way from Ohio to Oklahoma to see my grandparents. This room's walls were completely bare, exposed cinderblocks painted white, one small tv sitting on stand on a wall opposite two Full sized beds, both covered in those nasty old quilted bedspreads that are sewn to fit the bed like a slipcover. The room did seem clean, but i would NOT have let my kids sit on that bedspread just for the sheer fact that it was probably 25 years old. I honestly did not even look in the bathroom, i just turned back towards the sliding glass door that led to the little patio, and walked out. Once we made our way back to the lobby to refuse staying here at all, we noticed several cars full of teenage boys, maybe college kids checking in, and it totally dawned on me that this was the equivelant to the beach motel that i stayed in my senior year of high school with girlfriends for spring break in Daytona Beach. NOT the scene for family with small kids. This place should have cost about $69 a night, that is the most i would have paid to stay here (if i was 18 and on my first trip w/o the 'rents). At $189 a night it was a total ripoff!! The girl at the reservation desk didnt bat an eye when we said we werent staying. She checked us out and didnt even say goodbye. We immediately called the Hyatt which was right next door, basically, and got a great deal for $159 a night! Go read my review of THAT hotel, because WOW!! We loved it! (BTW when we checked in at the Hyatt, the girl told us we were the third family that had come from Bahia just during her shift!) Stay anywhere else but the Bahia, the place is a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia offers value and amenities”
Reviews.Author: MrTimSeattle
Reviews.Content: The hotel may be older and not the most luxurious, but for amenities and location, this is a value gem. Every staff member we dealt with was curteous and responsive; the service was simply excellent. The customer definitely came first at the Bahia. Yes, much of the construction is older, but I would much rather have service, location, amenities, and value than a mint on my pillow and add on fees every time you turn around. The Bahia is excellent for families with children. They have seals up front, an arcade with free games, shuffle board, tennis, and a beach on Mission Bay where you can rent various water craft. The grounds are beautiful, and you can walk to the roller coaster, ocean beach at Mission Beach, and various other restaurants and activities. It is a short drive to Sea World, the zoo, and other San Diego attractions and you can arrange discounted tickets through the hotel. The swimming pool and hot tub are very nice as well.

Reviews.Title: “Great value!”
Reviews.Author: Scott43Albuquerque
Reviews.Content: Our family was very pleased with the service and amenities offerred at the Bahia Resort. All of the staff we encountered were very friendly and helpful. The grounds are beautifully kept. The pool and spa are very nice. And just a few minutes from Sea World and other attractions. The rooms are in need of updating (don't expect luxury hotel)-but for the price they worked just fine. We would definitely return to the Bahia if we visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Great price, good service! Highly recommended.”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTracy33
Reviews.Content: I received an email with some discount deals on hotels, and this one came up. We got a great deal, so I wasn't sure what to expect, but we got a great room, awesome location, and terrific service. They gave us a really nice, large room, over looking the bay, with 2 beds and a pull out bed. Lots of room, and a kitchen too! The pool is really nice, and the grounds are kept beautifully. Service with a smile. We had cocktails and appetizers at the Tanger's bar. Yummy food, and we caught happy hour, so the prices were reasonable. The only thing I wished for was softer sheets, and a nicer pillow, but I'm a sheet snob, so I'm being really picky on that one. I've stayed at the Catamaran, which is super nice too, but quite a bit more expensive. This is just a slight notch down from The Catamaran in my opinion, but we got a much better price. You should ask for one of the newly renovated rooms. I think that made the difference. The first night was a little loud, as we had some major party animals in the next room, but the second night was very quiet. Free wireless internet in the room made business easy. Gotta love the free parking. Found a perfect spot the first day, but had to park a little further the second day. It's not so bad walking to the car when it's a beautiful sunny day!

Reviews.Title: “Don't believe the pictures on the internet - big disappointment”
Reviews.Author: novatravelor
Reviews.Content: If your primary interest is going to the beach you "might" like this hotel - otherwise it was a dissapointment all around. Our room was "renovated" but the bedding was uncomfortable and the bed spreads were outdated. Even though we PAID for two people to share the room the room was not set up for sharing. There was a vanity outside the bathroom but there was no mirror. There was no full length mirror in the room and the room furnishings were low quality. The hotel staff was not friendly and the management was just short of rude. The restaurant was adequate but not somewhere you would want to eat at every day for a week. The conference facilities were adequate - although there was only one computer in the business center. There was only one large room for our conference and one other smaller room - breakout sessions had to be held on the paddle boats. On the boats It was hard to hear the speakers over the sound of the air conditioning and when the air conditioning was turned off you could smell desel fuel. At night the outside paths are dimly lit or the spotlights shine into your eyes and not on the paths. There is a lot of foliage so women don't feel safe being outside at night. with the dim lighting. There is no soundproofing between rooms so you can hear "everything" happening in the room next door. Rooms on the second floor are not accessible by elevator so it's hard to carry a heavy suitcase upstairs unless you are lucky enough to get one of the renovated suite rooms in a buidling with an elevator. This location was convenient if the only thing you wanted to do was go to Sea World or Mission Beach - not much to do in Mission Beach at night. Bus service was reliable; however many activites close up early at night and after attending a conference all day didn't leave time to see much of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay..........”
Reviews.Author: nativeguy23
Reviews.Content: I would definitely stay here for the location. The hotel does offer good views of Mission Bay and that would be a plus. The grounds of the resort well kept. The room we got reminded me of my college dorm rooms. They were single and two story pink cinder block rooms. They were ugly on the outside but semi nice on the inside. Also at night, it was sorta dark and with all the vegetation on the property, a concern if I was a female walking alone at night. The water pressure was okay and the only problem I had were the guests checking out at 4am and dragging their luggage down the steps which were right next to my bed window. Pluses: Only a block and a half to Mission Beach. The bus system is great. Only 5.00 for an all day pass which also includes the trolley that goes from the Old Town Transfer Station to downtown. Just hop on the #9 bus and there you go. The BEST thing about this hotel was the free high speed internet. I loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: sheelar
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia Resort March 6-9 and was delighted with the staff, services and location. Right on the bus line to get to where you need to go (SeaWorld, Whale/ Dolphin watching, bar and grills, ect) The bus pass cost $5.00 a day/ unlimited travel for that day. The resort is about one block walking distance to Mission Beach, Mission Park and Belmont Park. When we ate at the restraunt at the resort, great food and good and friendly service. The front desk was always helpful when we needed a place to go or what to do. If you dont mined walking a bit, then this is a great hotel to stay at for the price.

Reviews.Title: “The nearness to most attractions of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MaxST
Reviews.Content: We've had a very nice week i San Diego, Bahia Resort Hotel sharing my interest for golfing with my wifes interest to see a lot :-). We'vw been visited almost all attractions of San Diego: Old Town, Harbour, Balboa Park, Downtown (great shoping) etc. Clever directions from Hotells personal made it easy. Evenings at the pool or in Tanger Bar closed nicely each day.

Reviews.Title: “We had a good time”
Reviews.Author: connors18
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent a few days here after Christmas. He had always wanted to go to California, so I let him plan out the entire trip. He booked the hotel through American Express, so we got a bit of a discount, which was great. We stayed in one of the rooms on the first floor, near the water. One of the great things was that I could open our patio door and walk outside to take pictures of the sunrise and sunset. However, that was also a bit of a problem. We had to leave the curtain closed most of the time so that people walking by couldn't see us. The location is great. We were so close to Sea World and the Zoo. The Wild Animal Park was fairly close too. We rented a car and drove to La Jolla. That was fantastic. Even if you didn't have a car, there was enough to do around the resort. We walked across the street to the beach and had fun along the boardwalk. Taxis are readily available and we didn't find our trips to be expensive. The staff at Bahia were nice and were helpful when we were trying to rent a car. Breakfast wasn't included, but the buffet there was really good. We didn't eat any other meals there, we usually got food at whatever attraction we were at. They did have a tennis court, pool and gym, but I didn't use any of those, so I can't really comment about them. Overall, we were happy with our stay at the Bahia Resort.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It”
Reviews.Author: justmeone
Reviews.Content: GREAT HOTEL AND LOCATION rooms very large clean and compy staff very friendly and helpful i would recomend this hotel only 10 mins from airport 18 dollers in taxi top tip use the local buses and trams 5 dollers a day travel where you want tram stops at the mexico border so a day trip to mexico costs 5 dollers 4 hours tour costs 35 dollers

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic holiday”
Reviews.Author: MrTBlackburn
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from California where we celibrated my husbands 50th birthday.He allways wanted to see the whales in a natural inviroment.We chose San Diego as they are their at this time of year.But what a lot this city has to offer.Are hotel was first class good food very pleasent staff great location.We got around on the local trasport system.A bus and trolley pass is only 5 dollars a day even cheaper when you get one for a few days.We also took the city tour trip this is a good way to find your way aroud the city.If you like boats history or you just want to relax by the wonderful ocean this is a place ont to miss.We cant wait to return.GlenysEdge

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews about our time there”
Reviews.Author: bardahl
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia twice during our 2 week stay in CA. The first 4 day stay, we booked a bay-view studio, and requested another room the next morning. The room was in the older building and had many problems (very dirty carpeting, patio door sliders impossible to open with crud build-up in track, electric outlets not working, bedside lamps not working, coffee maker broken, tub clogged and wouldn't drain). We were upgraded to a marina suite which was lovely, spacious, private and quiet...until our upstairs neighbors came home from the bar at 1:00 a.m. and made a lot of noise. Rooms are not very soundproof. Very annoying, but not the end of the world. Our second 3 day stay was better (we were in a studio in the newer 5 story building). The room was very nice. BUT again...as you can't choose your neighbors...the people next to us kept us up all night with drunken screeching, swearing, fighting, and door slamming. We had an early flight the next morning and were afraid if we complained, our neighbors would retaliate. They were awful!! Once again, longed for soundproofing. During our stay, I had been looking at the Bahia through a perspective of perhaps coming back with our grandchildren (ages 5 and 7) for a family vacation. The place, on the outset, seems ideally suited for a family vacation, but given the rowdies that we had for neighbors, and the late night noisy crowds on the grounds, I think not. It would be hit or miss with the comfort level. It is also a conference center and set up for large parties and weddings, so you can expect almost anything not conducive with a family vacation. I will say this though, the staff was very helpful and accommodating. And not at all their fault that people have little respect for others.

Reviews.Title: “You can probably do better”
Reviews.Author: VirginiaGirl19
Reviews.Content: I won't say our stay here was terrible, but I will say it could have been significantly better. I would not stay here again. I would, however, compliment the photographer that took the photos posted on the hotel website, because he/she is a photographic genius. The place did not look similar to what was advertised. We booked a package deal through Orbitz, and I got the general impression that this may have been part of the problem. We arrived at about 3:30 in the afternoon, 1/2 before check-in time. There was a problem with the reservation, which took them 45 minutes to figure out. The entire time, we were listening to the concierge desk staff offer arriving guests their choice of rooms. When our turn came, they did not give us a choice, and did not give us the type of room we had requested (and paid for a month previously) on Orbitz. To their credit, they did give us $25 in food/drink credit. When we arrived at the room, the accommodations were not suitable for habitation. The mold/mildew smell was so strong that I was concerned that I would have allergy problems, let alone my more allergy-prone boyfriend. There was also flood damage and stains on the carpet. I asked for a room change, and we were taken to a room in a more recently renovated area of the hotel. This room was much more acceptable, but there were a lot of little issues, such as the cheap towel racks continually falling off the walls, the shampoo/conditioner not matching, and the suspicious wet cleaner spot about a foot across right in front of the bathroom door. I really didn't want to know what might have been there. Once, when we asked for a change of sheets, the maid came to the room and merely made the bed, rather than change the sheets. We had to call again, and waited quite a while before anything was amended. The fitness center was not in great condition, although the pool and the hot tub were fine. We ate breakfast, which was overpriced, but decent. I don't know about the rest of the food. In sum, definitely not a great stay, and not worth the money, but it wasn't horrific.

Reviews.Title: “Our favorite hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Jeagle
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at a number of hotels in the past. Some have been for business and some for pleasure. This is now our favorite hotel for pleasure. It is older, but very well kept, clean and very convenient to everything we like to do.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Traveling4Fun_n_Work
Reviews.Content: My Mother and I took a "girls" trip here in September 2008. We like to try and get away once every year or two. Bahia was definitely a decent hotel, it wasn't quite as nice as we'd expected. We had some weird issues with the Maid staff as well. For instance we never had enough towels for 2 people. Upon arrival there were NO Bath towels, only hand towels and wash clothes. We also ordered a package that included Corona's with Chips and Guacamole. First we told the front desk to have it delivered on the 2nd day of our stay, but it was delivered on the 1st night, AFTER we'd already had dinner. So we decided to save it in the fridge for the next day. Well when we went out for breakfast,our room was cleaned, and they removed the un-opened chips that we'd saved IN the kitchen. We had to call the front desk and finally speak to a manager before we got more chips to have with our day old guacamole. The Kitchenette did NOT have a microwave which we though was odd. There is a full Stove w/ oven, but it's not easy to re-heat leftovers as we planned. We did also order passes to SeaWorld and the San Diego Zoo, and we received that upon check-in and it worked out great. The location is a good location if you plan to visit seaworld. Our patio area was also nice as it opened to a grassy area with palm trees. Overall this is a decent hotel, and they tried to fix our issues, but depending on your expectations it's not the "nicest" place. It also feels overpriced for what you get.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have asked for anything more!!”
Reviews.Author: WSlakers34
Reviews.Content: I constantly receive emails with different hotel deals and this one caught my eye. The promotion was to stay at the Bahia Resort Hotel in San Diego, CA for $99/night. My plan was to just have a nice weekend with my boyfriend and be close to home. I am so happy with my choice to stay at the Bahia. The first thing I want to compliment is the service. After I made my reservation online, I realized that it wasn't a good weekend. I was positive that I wasn't going to be able to reschedule without the having to spend more money. When I called the hotel, the representative was very polite and was able to switch my reservation to a different weekend with NO penalties and using the same promotional rate. When we checked in, the employees in the lobby were very welcoming. They told us about the discounts that were available for Bahia guests to different local attractions (Sea World, San Diego Zoo, etc). They also gave us complimentary tickets for a cruise around Mission Bay that we could use anytime before the end of the year. The room that we stayed in was not your typical hotel room. It stood on its own with no rooms above or below it. There was a parking space right in front of our room which was very convenient. The room was much bigger than what I expected. The bed was comfortable, the wireless internet was great, and there were plenty of towels and pillows! My favorite part of our room was the sliding glass door with the Mission Bay view. At night, we even got to watch the Sea World fireworks that were right across the bay. It was absolutely gorgeous. There were plenty of things to do near the hotel and lots of eating establishments nearby as well. We were able to go kayaking, walk around Balboa Park, shop at Fashion Valley Mall, and eat fresh sea food without doing a lot of driving. The location of the Bahia Resort was excellent! Unfortunately I did not have time to visit the many of the amenities the Bahia has to offer such as the pool, spa, tennis courts, and fitness center but all of the information about these bonuses were available in the pamphlet that was in our room. I was, however, able to dine at the Tangier Bar where the food was delicious and the service was top-notch. I highly recommend the Bahia Resort Hotel to anyone planning on visiting California or, if you are like us, just looking for a nice place to spend a weekend close to home. I can't wait to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Theme park visits”
Reviews.Author: Gus and Dee
Reviews.Content: My wife, daughter, and I spent two nights here over Thanksgiving in the San Diego Area to visit Lego Land and Sea World from the Los Angeles Area. We stopped at Legoland on our way down and spent most of the day there. The Bahia resort was only 15 minutes away; we got there at nightfall and checked into the four-story portion of the resort at the end of the peninsula, overlooking the bay. My wife had won the stay in a contest and we were truly amazed on how nice it was. We travel worldwide including Europe, Asia, South America, and all over the US. Using TripAdvisor, we were somewhat skeptical with the prior reviews (We had several hotels to choose from the contest). We checked in and the staff was professional and got us our room in short order. We did ask for directions to a local steak house but the person that evening had limited knowledge of restaurants. On our way to the room we noticed that the place seemed completely full on this Holiday weekend. We got to the room and it was gorgeous and spacious. We think they had recently redone the room with tile in the bathrooms, furniture drapes and all. The bathroom was neat and the shower was good (a value point for us!). That night we found the Embers Bar and Grill, just over the freeway, on Mission Bay road and we had a fine inexpensive dinner. Next morning, my wife and I walked in the rain while our daughter slept, to see the birds on the beach just outside of our room. It was very peaceful and picturesque. Sandpipers, gulls, and mud hens were everywhere. We checked out the pool and workout room. The pool was a bit chilly for November but the large spa was very inviting. We got our daughter up, went to a breakfast up the street and then went and spend the day at Sea World. That evening we had our Thanksgiving dinner at the hotel restaurant that had a great staff and very accommodating. After a full Thanksgiving Day of marine animals and walking, we got back to the hotel putting together our Christmas cards on the large nice table in the room. Next morning we spent time in the spa and workout room and prepared ourselves for another day of Legoland (We had two-for-one tickets). The Hotel was a great relaxing point of our stay and unlike most places we visit, it became one of the highlights rather than just another place to rest your head. We highly recommend this resort for a visit to the San Diego, Carlsbad, Mission bay area.

Reviews.Title: “It was ok”
Reviews.Author: ihateuall1986
Reviews.Content: The hotel is ok if you are just looking for a place to sleep, the rooms are old and have a funky smell but look clean, the free boat ride is lame, the boat is old, the music is a joke, the drinks are pricey and the food they offer is a sandwich you have to pay for. The hotel pool is strange, it has some wierd carpet around it, the hotel bar was probably cool in the 70's but today its lame, parking is a pain and the hotel beach is nasty. The good things about the place are: Compared to other hotels in the area the price is reasonable. Its close to the ocean and you can find some casual places to eat or have a drink there. Its close to sea world Its a quick drive to the airport, downtown, mexico, coronado Games in the game room are free The rooms have a fridge

Reviews.Title: “Delightful”
Reviews.Author: TMEvans
Reviews.Content: This was a great get away place for my husband and me. The grounds are beautifully maintained, overflowing with palms and tropical plants. Although the weather was not always perfect while we were there, we spent some time on the private beach and would love to go back for more time there. The staff was friendly and our room had a great view of the marina opposite. We could have spent the whole trip on our spacious balcony watching the sailboaters, windsurfers and kayakers. I would strongly recommend. A very good value.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay and Overall Experience”
Reviews.Author: old33
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia in June for our Honeymoon. We were referred by my parents and previous guests who have also stayed before and they were spot on with their analysis. Our commentary is based on the following facts: 1 - We stayed there for a week. 2 - We had one of the newer renovated rooms. 3 - We used the entire facility. Before I go further, it should absolutely be noted that the best asset for the facility is the staff working there. Polite, courteous, and helpful are understatements. Granted it was almost 6 months ago we stayed there, I still remember how helpful Patrick at the front desk was for any of our questions (where to eat, where to get surf lessons, etc.), the breakfast server who translated in french for us so we could send a post card out, and the older maintenance man who fixed our many personal things (bike spoke, backpack, and others nothing to do with the hotel). Location - Wonderful. Walking distance to the beach. So many activities within the immediate area. If you have a rental car, that's great but we could make due without one if need be. If you are a walker, this is a perfect spot. Dining - Again, wonderful. Never had a bad meal at the cafe. There are a ton of restaurants to try in the immediate area and around San Diego but the quality made it difficult to really venture out. Bar was great. Only wish was that there was more brands of beer on tap but we could make due. Rooms - Perfect, but again, we had the never renovated rooms. Based upon the other reviews, I would try to snag one of these if possible. Nice beds and flat screen tv's. Loved the fact that there were no bugs so we could leave the sliding door open and have fresh air at night. Pool and hot tub - Fantastic. I believe the water is heated but very clean. Lots of room, even if there are a lot of people there. Love the tiki bar there as well. The Bahia is an outstanding resort as long as you are educated about the place. Like any place, there are both positives and negatives. We never saw the negatives so I can't verify the other reviews. I would recommend this without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Outdated, dirty, muldy”
Reviews.Author: Hinney
Reviews.Content: The hotel is good located and the staff is really helpful and nice. So much for the nice part... we booked a room directly at the bay-beach. When we first walked into our room I did not know whether to be disgusted by the wet and moldy carpet which was covered in sand or by the moldy and peeled wallpaper. The bathroom was not any better: the shower leaked and was dirty and I did not want to sit on that toilet. The room-furniture was dusty and very old. We did not even unpack, just walked out the room and back to the lobby. The staff knows about the condition of their rooms and we were the THIRD couple standing in line to complain about. We were offered a nicer (and clean) room at 4th floor ~ needless to say that we booked the Bahia because we wanted the private beach entry from our room. After all our stay was a big disappointment, we did not get what we paid for and we are not coming back. The resort could do so much better if they would take care of their rooms, because the garden, pool, beach and restaurant are well maintained, the staff is nice - it is just the rooms...

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful place - thoroughly recommended”
Reviews.Author: wilkopn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia for four days prior to a cruise from San Diego, and we really liked the hotel. It is laid back but has everything you need for a good stay. Our room was a bay view studio, and we had plenty of space and a small kitchen area, two large TV sets, and a very comfortable bed. The place was kept very clean, and the grounds were well landscaped and maintained to a high standard. The reception staff were friendly and helpful, and we enjoyed the grounds, which include a pool where some rescued seals live. The restaurant was pleasant and we loved the breakfasts (my wife loved the French Toast in particular!) Location is great, as Mission Beach is nearby, with shops and small restaurants. It is close to the airport and to Sea World.

Reviews.Title: “okay stay if outdated is your thing ...”
Reviews.Author: peony062
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia while visiting friends in San Diego. We got a good price through AMEX and you get what you pay for. Although the room was very large, it was outdated. We stayed on the 4th floor with a king size bed. It had full kitchen with utensils/dishes, living area, and balcony. We only stayed one night and even though it was okay, I don't think I would stay there for a vacation. You could see the wear and tear of the place where ever you looked. I will say the view is gorgeous and it's close to sea world, the beach and close enough to do san diego attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Love this hotel again”
Reviews.Author: abqlobos
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at this hotel in 2006 and liked it so we stayed again now in October and it did not disappoint us again. When we arrived in San Diego it was late and somehow we got lost driving, I called the hotel and they were so wonderful in giving us directions to get to the hotel and stayed on the phone until they knew we would find it. Also, our luggage with all of our bathroom stuff was lost during our plane ride, so the front desk found everything they could to give us until we could go to the store the next day. They also upgraded our room to a suite which was perfect for our kids, since it was nice and big and had a small kitchen. The location of the hotel is the best part about it. You can stay on the property and hang out on the bay or walk a short distance and be at Mission Beach. It was so wonderful. I've recommended it to our friends.

Reviews.Title: “Great get away for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: NP_momSFBayArea
Reviews.Content: My husband and 2 young sons had a great time while I attended a 3 day meeting held at the Bahia. The hotel is very nice, but casual and not pretentious at all. The kids enjoyed the pool and the beach and the proximity to Sea World and the Zoo. Even Lego Land was not too far for my husband to take the kids while I was in the meeting. The room was very comfortable and clean. The hotel restaurant had really good deals on kids meals and the regular menu was also very good. The food was definitely above average, much better than expected. It was nice to know my family was having a great time while I attended workshops and wonderful to be able to get together with them on breaks. On the day I only had a half day session we were all able to take a swim and make it to the Zoo for a family outing with plenty of time to not feel rushed. At the end of a long day it was also a pleasure to be able to relax and have a really good meal and drinks in the hotel restaurant without having to get everyone in the car and drive. Wish we could have stayed a day or two longer so I could have enjoyed it more!

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional”
Reviews.Author: geosher
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Bahia for 5 nights, had a wonderful time. The room was excellent, clean, quiet. The pool was beautiful and was kept clean. We were lucky enough to have been upgraded to their bayview suite which was wonderful with kitchen, two plasma tvs, tons of storage. Housekeeping did a wonderful job every day. I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone and would happily return myself.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time at the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: BurbankBbear
Reviews.Content: Although our stay was too short my wife and I loved our stay at the Bahia. Our room overlooked the harbor and was very nice. The resturant was clean and relaxing, the food was very good and the service was very good as well. The most inportant question - would we go back? ABSOULTLY!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: lvsteve
Reviews.Content: My stay at the Bahia could not have been any better. From our arrival,the staff was very professional, and made our stay enjoyable.Our room was so nice with our own private beach right outside our door! Great hotel, will stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bizarre hotel "resort" falls short”
Reviews.Author: lucasthree
Reviews.Content: We stayed there labor day weekend, 5 nights. We paid for a garden view room. Not a budget rate, but at full price. We, at first, got a room with a view of the lobby and car parking lot. We were told of a party of 200 people that would be making noise that night, "let us know if this becomes a problem for you". I immediately complained and got a dirty tattered room that did have a view of the garden. The concierge was courteous and helpful. The front desk people were less so. The decor in the room was of low standard, vintage 1970. It appears that every building that went up there is from a different era. Different colors, layout, decor. On the last night, I finally received an upgrade that was refused earlier in our stay. That wing of the building was renovated and acceptable, but the room was not ready when they said it would be. We had a toddler traveling with us. We called ahead and asked for a crib, forgotten by the staff when we got there. The crib was small and dirty. I would never consider this property again, the thought of that dirty, dark room sends shivers just thinking about it. The only positive thing was the location. Close to SeaWorld, Mission beach. Some nice beach walks nearby. Get your shots if you stay there.

Reviews.Title: “great resort”
Reviews.Author: bblbi
Reviews.Content: great location: close to beach; on the bay; near SeaWorld and Zoo.

Reviews.Title: “don't judge a hotel by its picture”
Reviews.Author: zoeboeNY
Reviews.Content: The Bahia looked beautiful on its website, but once we got there and to our room, we had to leave. The room was very outdated, cinder block painted walls, and the room smelled like bug spray or something used to exterminate bugs. The room was very dark. The "garden view" was more like a jungle view. The bathroom had lots of black mold. They offered us a different room, which was just as bad. Maybe the "ocean view" rooms are better, but we checked out (and the front desk personnel was very nice), no charge. We went across the street to the Hyatt for for $5.00 a night more. Go to the Hyatt!!

Reviews.Title: “Like nowhere I've stayed, and not in a good way”
Reviews.Author: username_is_my_name
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia for three nights in mid-August. Our trip was primarily a family visit, but we were looking forward to enjoying the usual amenities that an establishment with similar prices would offer. Unfortunately, this was not the case at the Bahia. While the room itself was comfortable and provided lots of options for making one's own meals, the grounds are very outdated and need to be completely overhauled. It is virtually impossible to get anywhere without walking through a very crowded parking lot. I understand that the Bahia must do a lot of business, as my first night there I almost did not get a parking spot anywhere remotely close to my building, but they need to figure out something else (anything else, really) to do with the parking situation. I arrived late at night and realized the next day that some other lucky guest had likely checked into (and then immediately out of) my room. My mother, aunt, husband and I had requested adjacent rooms. Somehow my mom and aunt ended up in a king sized bed on the 4th floor, the room next to them had the two doubles they'd requested, and my husband and I ended up in a room that really should become an office - 1st floor, right by the entrance to the building. The room was like a fishbowl; if we kept the drapes open, anyone who wanted a Pepsi or some ice or had to work on the property saw completely into the room (not to mention that the Pepsi machine was actually broken for two days). I had to change in the bathroom area. If we closed the drapes... well, I'd rather not pay over $200 for a cave that could be on I-95 in any state. With a full itinerary of family visits, I ignored the first night's spectacle of one (understandably) very angry man parked directly outside of my room, headlights on, ranting about being screwed out of HIS room (the place was supposedly booked solid). I ignored the constant stream of cars pulling up to my window to drop off their luggage (since the parking spaces were potentially a 10 to 15 minute walk from the building). I ignored the really fun hammock right outside my window that every kid understandably had to scream and run to, then struggle with parents trying to pull them away from it. But once I had a second to breathe, I was pretty ticked off about my room. The Bahia's fix? Take $75 off my bill (which totaled over $800). On top of that, they "forgot" to take that pitiful deduction off of my bill, thereby delaying my early-morning rush to catch a plane for another family event. I just returned home today (almost two weeks later) and am hoping that the Bahia's management will make a better decision in terms of customer service now that I have time to deal with the issue. Perhaps the most disappointing thing of all was the pool area. On my last day, after getting nowhere with a reasonable fee adjustment, I figured, "Hey, enjoy some California sunshine before getting on another plane." The tide was rather low and I wanted a swim so I went to the pool. The pool, which is pitifully small for a resort of that size, had a rug around much of it. The rug smelled like you'd expect it to, I suppose; at first, it smelled like sausage, then mildew, then feet, then I went back to my fishbowl, ordered a bottle of wine, and waited to get out of there. My waitresses were extremely gracious and helpful and the seals are really cute. My TV was broken and the repairman came immediately and was very pleasant and efficient. The bed was comfortable. Other than that, I would not recommend this to anyone unless you plan on needing a place to crash and not much more, in which case, save your money and go to a motel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Fiber-Tech
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th trip to San Diego and the Bahia as well. We stayed in a Bay front King and it was great. Had a patio on the bay, the room was clean, large and comfortable. The staff was very pleasant and helpful. We ate at the Bahia Cafe many times and had room service twice. Great food. The grounds and swimming pool are kept immaculate. A short walk to Mission Beach and the ocean. We will stay there on our next trip.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel for Families”
Reviews.Author: NickyU
Reviews.Content: Our group of 7 (two families) stayed here at the beginning of August. We had two ground floor rooms which were really spacious with a lounge/dining/kitchen room, a good sized bedroom and bathroom. We had a bay view, which had great views of the Seaworld fireworks in the evening. The hotel is a bit dated, but the size of the rooms is a huge benefit for families, we stayed in 9 hotels during our tour, and this had the largest rooms of any. The pool area is a bit smaller than it appears in the photos, but the beach is nice, we hired kayaks which the children enjoyed. We ate in the hotel for breakfast, which was a good buffet, and also for dinner. There is a good choice, although on both occasions we opted for the buffet, which was fine. The hotel is well located for Sea World, and in the evening we walked to Belmont Park for a ride on the roller coaster. The only problem we encountered was that when we arrived our rooms weren't ready, which seemed to be a common problem. If we visit San Diego again, we will probably stay here, but arrive a bit later to guarantee getting our rooms on time.

Reviews.Title: “Wow! Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: whimbrelboy
Reviews.Content: Excellent resort, nice pleasant beach & pool. Staff always willing to help. Would highly recommend

Reviews.Title: “Overall this is a great place to stay with your family”
Reviews.Author: robo44
Reviews.Content: My kids and I stayed at the Bahia for a week, (July 18-24). This is was our second trip to the Bahia in the past year. If you chose the Bahia you wont be disappointed, but donâ€™t expect a 5 star place. We would stay again. Plenty of activities, and clean fun environment for everyone, the rooms while tired were big and adequate. The pool was great and overall the place was good for the price. Price was competitive and reasonable during the summer months ($225 per night height of summer) given the average San Diego rates for all hotels (1-2-3 star) were $185. The resort is situated on the Bay with great views and access to the beach area and water. The grounds are well kept and groomed. Access to water sports, boating, and sailing are all right on the property and can be rented for a reasonable price. The pool was always at the perfect temperature, and clean. On the weekends they play live music. The front desk staff was always happy to help out and try to make your stay comfortable and address our needs. While it is true the lobby is smallish, it really depends on when you arrive as the amount of crowd you should expect, we arrived and were able to check in at 3:45pm and had no lines or waiting. Free rides on the Riverboat to their sister property is always fun. The kids loved Gracie and the seals on the property. Proximity to all the attractions (SeaWorld, Zoo, Legoland ect) canâ€™t be beat. Our room was a double bed garden which incidentally is the same size as the Bay View Suite. We had 2 beds, and the couch folded out into a queen-size bed, was perfect for us. The room also had a small kitchen and full sized fridge. This was perfect after a stocking your own food to cut costs. The negatives: It is true that the rooms are outdated for the most part, but we really only spent sleeping ours in the room. I would add that this should not be a distraction, but it should be noted. Our room just happened to be in the tower just near the front entrance and on the 1st floor. This did cause some concern as it is true that the bay side of the resort shares a public road for a public park. The park opens at 7:00am and closes at 9:00pm, so there are parking spaces and access issues if you choose to park out in this area. My advice, you can find parking inside the resort area if you donâ€™t mind walking at times, and donâ€™t use the beach area on this public side of the resort. Three quarters of beach access is located on the resort property so you should just walk over to the north side where the boats and main beach access is. Gardeners always fired up their leaf blowers at 8am so if you plan to sleep in forget it. The hotel maids seemed to never come, this disappointed us and had to seek out hotel maids/cleaning staff 3 times in the 6 days we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Great place for the money on the bay.”
Reviews.Author: Kellyrobin
Reviews.Content: For the money, this was a really nice place to stay. The rooms were adequate, the people were VERY friendly. The beach was nice and the pool was very fun with live music and open until 11 p.m. Our room was only $131.00 a night with a view of the bay. With in walking distance to Mission Beach.

Reviews.Title: “don't believe the website!”
Reviews.Author: broncofan1
Reviews.Content: Whoever does the website deserves an award! They have taken an old 1970's resort and made it look superb! Well, I can tell you it is nothing like the website. The whole property is old, dated, worn out and cheesy. It starts in the lobby where the staff, although friendly, are incompetent and untrained. Something as simple as honoring an internet rate on the room was beyond them. Something about "their system". The rooms are worn out, dirty and unkempt. The whole place smells bad and the swimming pools looks like the one in "The Karate Kid". Please, do yourself a favor and run, do not walk, from anything to do with the Butthia resort.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise at the Bahia!”
Reviews.Author: jjlivings
Reviews.Content: I found the whole experience at the Bahia very pleasurable. The water sports available are super along with the other amenities. The pool and spa are wonderful and the free arcade games and fitness room a bonus. We stayed with a 10 year old and 2 older teenagers. Everyone was happy and loved "paradise"! The room was clean and very convenient. Free parking very accessible. Short walk to the beach. Our room was the ocean front suite, right on Mission Bay, which couldn't have better. Great place for kids, as well as adults. I would highly recommend staying at the Bahia!

Reviews.Title: “What a four star dump!”
Reviews.Author: Mommeeah
Reviews.Content: What a waste of money! Expect a long wait when checking in. The lobby is very small and crowded. We booked a bayview studio thinking since they have their own private beach it should be wonderful. Guess again! The east side of the property is public beach. There were lots of people and screaming children enjoying the public beach all day and night. Every night there were people making bonfires on the beach, getting wasted and cranking up their music. Even with the balcony doors shut you could still hear the thump of the base. One night from our 2nd floor balcony, we even got to watch a drunk man stumble to his car and hear him puke several times by his car (which was parked right in front of our room). Oh yeah another bonus...there is a street in front of the balconies which is also public parking...good luck finding a spot to park there! Seems all the cleaning ladies get prime pick of those spots. The room had an old TV, I guess flatscreens haven't made it to that part of the bay yet. The bathroom floor had dirty corners. We ate breakfast at their restaurant. We asked the hostess for a table for 4..she took us to a table with 3 chairs and never offered to get another chair. I had to search one out myself. On top of that we got terrible service there. Exercise room was full of wet children who must have become bored with overrunning the pool. Free arcade had 10 games but 2 were not working and you have to wait forever to get a turn to play because of all the young children will play the same game and never give some else a chance to play. For the money, I expected a lot more. Their website sure makes it out to be such a beautiful resort. Try crammed...noisy...and too expensive. This place should not be rated so high. Locals used to rave about it but I can't see why. The only good things I can say are that the sales woman in the gift shop is very friendly, it is wonderful that they have a couple of rescued seals they care for on their property, and the room was a decent size for a family of four.

Reviews.Title: “The Bahia is a wonderful Hotel Destination”
Reviews.Author: kurtmac
Reviews.Content: Jack at the front desk was a pleasure to work with. We had a horrible flight from Savannah GA. to San Diego on delta never again on delta. We arrived late and Jack stepped up, made us feel welcome and upgraded our room at no charge. He was very professional, looked you in the eye and was there to solve problems. We will continue to stay at the Bahia as long as we travel to the west coast. Everyone on the staff were very professional, nice and did their job to a very high standard. Thank you to the staff and management for making our stay great. H. Kurt McCorkle

Reviews.Title: “2 different quality rooms”
Reviews.Author: kdr4
Reviews.Content: Our first room was a dump...concrete block walls, overall grimy feeling. Our bath tub leaked, so they offered to move us to another room. We were moved into a small suite in the newer part of the hotel, and it was much, much nicer. I was very surprised at the discrepancy between the two rooms. The outside atmosphere of the hotel was nice...gazebos, pool, sea lion, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant location”
Reviews.Author: brooksy55
Reviews.Content: This was our 4th hotel on our holiday and by this time we had been used to 4* accommodation, so this was never really going to compare as it's a 3*, but it wasn't so terrible I wouldn't stay thee again. The first impressions are great - the location is excellent, but you definitely need a car to get around. The setting for this hotel is lovely but the actual accommodation is a little dated. The check in staff are lovely - especially Patrick who was v.helpful and gave us turn by turn directions to Seaworld and a list of places to eat. Our room was on the top floor and we were able to hear everything going on outside (there seemed to be some sort of party or wedding going on and it was full of teenagers whose main purpose was to et drunk!). The room was nice enough, with a lovely balcony you could sit out on. The bed was comfy and there was a fridge in the room too, which was great. The bathroom was ample and clean. The room just felt a bit dated. The pool at the hotel is lovely - itâ€™s heated and we used it both nights after being out all day. We also went on the Bahia Belle - this was a bit like a booze cruise (most of the teenagers seemed to be on this) but we went up to the top deck and it was lovely - good views across the bay and we even saw jelly fish in the water. We drove to downtown one evening but didn't stay long - the better place to go in the evening is to turn right out of the hotel and then right again and you come to a whole street full of bars, shops and eating places. TOP TIP - go to Tony Roma's - it was excellent food, service and value for money, and is just a short drive away. We went to Seaworld and the Zoo while we were here and if you've been to Florida you will find Seaworld in San Diego disappointing in comparison. Was a little disappointed by the Zoo also - the animals seemed cramped and it's quite hilly to walk round. We also went to see the USS Midway in the harbour, which my husband loved as you get to walk round the boat, sit in the planes and there's even a flight simulator. San Diego has a surfer/beach feel to it, and was very relaxing - itâ€™s definitely worth a visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Resort, Nicer Location”
Reviews.Author: Mardukas
Reviews.Content: Toward the end of last year I won a trip to San Diego, which included accommodations at a three star hotel. As it turned out, the Bahia was that hotel. After checking out their website and the reviews here on tripadvisor, I developed a pretty good impression of the resort. The pictures are appealing, the location seemed ideal, and the fact that the resort features tennis courts was a nice bonus. Seeing as how there would be five of us on the trip, we decided to book another room through orbitz. Be advised that if you print out directions to the resort from google or mapquest, or what have you, it may still be a bit tricky reaching your destination. The signage in San Diego (and California, in general) leaves much to be desired. Once we finally made it to the resort, we learned that only one of our two rooms was ready. Which wasn't a big deal, considering we arrived before check-in time and could just as easily unload the car into the one room for now. The room, we discovered, was the one provided via the contest, the one with the kitchenette. This was the room in which I stayed. You could tell that there had been some improvements made but, yes, it was still a bit dated. Nothing that would break my trip. But I'd say it definitely had its own charm. My only real complaint about the room would be the layout. The TV was off to the side of the beds, positioned more for viewing from the couch and table. Not what you're accustomed to in a typical hotel room. When we returned from Sea World (which was only a few minute drive) that night, we picked up the key to our bay view room. I had requested that our rooms be close to one another, and they seemed to do their best to accommodate that request. Being that they were different types of rooms, though, they were located in adjacent buildings. This is the room with the cinder block walls. I did not sleep in this room, but the members of our party who did did say that they could clearly hear their neighbor's conversations through the wall. I guess cinder block isn't a good insulator. It didn't seem to be much of an issue, though. And, on the plus side, the patio off of this room did provide a nice view of Sea World's fireworks across the bay. While we did check out the pool one night during out stay, the chilly weather precluded us from actually making use of it. We did, however, take advantage of the tennis courts.
