Surprisingly, the equipment provided was in pretty good shape, as was the court. It was nice to be able to play at night, under the lights. During our stay, we ate at both the bar and hotel restaurant. No complaints about the food on either occasion. There were a few things we did not have time to take advantage of, including the cruise across the bay and, as previously stated, the pool. Maybe next time. All in all, I thought the grounds were well maintained, the rooms clean (if a bit dated), and the amenities more than you can ask for. I would certainly consider staying here again for the resort itself, and for its location on the bay and near the attractions.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for”
Reviews.Author: hobo_ent
Reviews.Content: The Bahia is a nice moderately priced resort in a great location on Mission Bay. I stayed in one of the beach bungalows and found it adequate. The room was out dated and there were a few ants in residence. Balancing out these disappointing findings was the very nice Tangiers Bar (although no water view) and the free WiFi. The resort is not the height of luxury, but you know that going in. For travelers on a budget, you could do much worse.

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but only if staying in one of the nice rooms”
Reviews.Author: Fran79
Reviews.Content: The hotel has 2 types of standard rooms: the bungalow-style ones right at the beach and the ones in the two big main buildings. Both types cost the same. The location of the bungalows is really nice but mind the aged rooms! They're really old, I felt like in a cheap motel in there. The rooms in the two main buildings were refurbished recently and are very nice. We didn't get breakfast as it wasn't included in our room rate, even though the rooms are really quite pricey.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Retreat”
Reviews.Author: young_entrepreneur
Reviews.Content: My mother and I (28yrs old) took a trip together. We rented a car from Advantage for $40/for 4 days! (plus extra insurance and gas). It costed us $20 for cab fare from the Airport...so the car rental was well worth it! We drove down to the Outlet Malls close to the Border, we drove into Tijuana and into Rosarito, Mexico. We drove to La Mesa, Old Towne, Gaslamp Quarters (CA). I watched my 1st MLB Game San Diego Padres vs Los Angeles Dodgers! Whoop! Whoop! But back to the location of the Bahia Resort. We walked along the beach/boardwalk one afternoon. We didn't take advantage of the Resorts pools, beaches or restaurants. The accomodations were great! Kitchenette, full sized living room, free internet. There were fireworks visible from the 4th floor balcony. It was a nice place to come back to and rest our adventurous bodies.

Reviews.Title: “ATTN BUSINESS TRAVELERS: This Hotel will leave your attendees disappointed”
Reviews.Author: bigtimebiztravelr
Reviews.Content: Against a friend's advice, I booked 30+ rooms for 2 nights at the Bahia in February for one of our company's offsite meetings. For over 5 years I've booked hotels for our meetings throughout San Diego County and can honestly tell you that this was by far my worst experience. The rooms smelled like mildew (we had Standard and Studio rooms for our group; Suites were available for an additional $80 per room/night) and many of MY guests complained of ants and roaches in their rooms. I don't know if they've cleaned their guestrooms since the hotel was built in the 1950's...it did used to be a "motor lodge", i.e. campground. Many of their "value add's" don't pertain to group BUSINESS travel. I mean, really, for business travel who cares about no charge to use the pool and a free arcade. I should have taken my friend's advice and stayed at a namebrand hotel (the Hyatt is accross the street - a little more expensive, but at least you know what you're going to get). For the price per room/night you can get a much nicer hotel Downtown. A few suggestions: any of the Hilton's, Marriott's and Hyatt's in San Diego; if you must have the beach, pick the Hyatt, the Catamaran (same family owns this hotel that owns the Bahia so be careful), the Hyatt, or Paradise Point. You can get the same rate pretty much anywhere in San Diego if you book far enough (6 months-1 year in advance). I would NOT recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great value for the money!”
Reviews.Author: preames
Reviews.Content: I booked a bayfront suite for a three day stay for my three young grandchildren and myself. I was pleased to see that I was immediately upgraded to a marina suite on the ground floor. Check- in was pleasant (1 hour early), room was immaculate, and service was great. Birds visited us each morning and made a mess on our patio. Groundskeepers who were all in force cleaning the sand and grass and came immediately to wipe clean our patio. They were very friendly and accommodating. The pool was wonderful and the kids really enjoyed seeing the two seals. Our room was obviously renovated with two flat-screen TVs and very nice furnishings. We chose to bring our own food so cannot comment on the restaurants. We had wanted to have the breakfast buffet, but workers were painting and working on ladders at that time so we chose to opt out. We had a wonderful time and felt we received a great value for our money!

Reviews.Title: “Clean rooms, nice view, expensive food!”
Reviews.Author: sernja2007
Reviews.Content: We were in Building 4, a high rise with view of the Bay. Rooms were clean, airy, with tiny patio (table & chair ouside) . Room service was prompt and rooms cleaned up and restocked. Hotel has an OK pool (heated) and little bit of work out equipment. Too cool out & windy for me to lay out on the beach this time of year. You also have use of the sister facility across the bay, don't be afraid to ask at the desk. They will shuttle you across to use the spa and better workout room. Bus service on the corner takes you about anywhere in San Deigo for $2.00. Taxi cost me $25.00 from the zoo back to the Bahia (it was getting dark and I was afraid to wait around for the bus). The shuttle picks up tourists in the morning and transports to the museum area & goes back in the late afternoon.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel, great service & phenomenal value”
Reviews.Author: HawaiianDon
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel on a last minute's notice for a $99 on Hotels.com./ Internet price. What I got for my money was astounding! 1.Located on the waters of Mission Bay and walking distance from the ocean. 2.Walking distance from dining, a roller coaster and shopping. 3.Driving time to classy La Jolla and downtown San Diego is15min or less. 4.Really big rooms with kitchenette. 5. Wowing views. 6.Super friendly staff with smiles at every turn. 7. Superb phone manners. 8.I called on maintenance and they were there in three minutes!!! 9.Elegantly decorated rooms 10. This is the best value I can remember in 35 years of adult world-wide travel! *From now on I will be a regular customer at this hotel, whenever I visit my family in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible room service!!!!”
Reviews.Author: littlepinkbug
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my husband and two kids over the long weekend. For the price that you are paying a night you really expect a beautiful resort which it is not. Our room was a good size for the four of us and we had a nice view of the mission bay. However the hotel seemed kind of run down from the outside and you dont get the resort feeling. The worst part of the entire hotel was the room service. The food was from the actual restuarant of the hotel and it was the worse room service I have ever eaten- pancakes seemed old, the bread seemd like it have been taken out of the freezer and reheated so they were hard as a rock, the "seasonal fresh fruit" were frozen, the springs rolls were mushy and soft. For the amount of money you are paying for room service you expect somewhat decent food. The hotel was ok to stay at but the food was horrible!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Steer clear of the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: CalgaryMomof2
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Bahia Resort on our recent trip to San Diego. The pictures boasted a beautiful beach, lovely pool, newly renovated suites and a trip out on the Bahia Belle sternwheeler. The beach is beautiful (not for swimming though!), the pool is lovely (be sure to bring the towels back or they will charge you $10 for each one!) but the suites have certainly not been renovated anytime recently and the Bahia Belle hasn't moved in awhile. The resort wasn't very busy but yet they put all the young families beside the rooms with the young partiers. When there wasn't a party above us and the heavy sliding doors being slammed repeatedly, the old fridge kept us awake. Certainly not a part of the "new" renovation. Then there was the on-site restaurant. They crammed us all into the corner. Not very cozy when my little kids are shoved up against a couple trying to have a romantic dinner and we were the only folks in the place! The pool itself was beautiful and very clean. The hot tub was huge! But only after our new clothes and swimsuits were ruined, did we discover that the carpet surrounding the pool had been bleached. Nobody seemed to know that this had been done! After a couple of calls and visits to the front desk, the manager reimbursed us for what we could produce receipts for. He certainly wasn't going above and beyond for a customer in the off season. I would definitely not choose the Bahia while in San Diego. There are plenty of other beach-side resorts that will deliver what they promise.

Reviews.Title: “don't be fooled”
Reviews.Author: meaganmarie5
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a bay front room with two double beds. Our room was on the first floor and had a patio door out to the bay. I was really disappointed in our room. It looked SO much better online. The walls were cinder block and the floor was cement with carpet over it. The bathrooms were old but at least they were clean. We got the bed and breakfast package so we went to the restaurant in the morning for our free meal. Defiantly the best part! The room was very pretty and the food was great, I couldnâ€™t believe it was the same hotel. I had the impression the hotel was on the beach, the OCEAN beach. Not so, we were facing a stinky bay, there was no way I would go in there. We took the booze cruise that night; it was pretty bad, although the band was good. Iâ€™m not sure it they have redone the hotel since we have been there but I would seriously think about what you see on their website and what you actually get.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: F_McSwindle
Reviews.Content: Fantastic Hotel - would recommend to anyone staying in the St Diego area

Reviews.Title: “Excellant visit if you get remodeled room”
Reviews.Author: hotelmanOklahoma
Reviews.Content: Stayed over Christmas from December 23 to 27. Had a bay view studio. If you request and get a remodeled room- It is a great value and location. Living in Oklahoma, my kids loved the balcony and view of the bay. Other rooms we saw were not in the best shape. The staff was glad to help. Only had one luggage cart though and that was a problem. Getting to take a trip like this every 4 to 5 years puts a lot of pressure on hotel pick and this will not disappoint. Great location and within 10 minutes driving distance to all malls, beaches and SeaWorld.

Reviews.Title: “Typical mid-level beach hotel on Mission Bay”
Reviews.Author: 5intheOC
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia for 3 days of relaxation after the holidays. I booked a larger "suite" for our family of 5. I was not a "suite-quality" room, but it was a larger room than typical, with two double beds and one pull-out couch (very uncomfortable mattress). Plenty of room for the kids to flop down on the floor, eat pizza and play the in-room video games. The room was clean, but older, even though the web site says they have been remodeled. We had a kitchenette but did not use it, as it looked like it needed to be sanitized. The bathroom is very, very small with older fixtures --- definitely no remodel there. The balcony was good-sized and overlooked the bay. We checked-in easily and the desk help was helpful. We asked for and got extra towels immediately. There were still room-service trays in the hallway at 2 p.m. when we got to our room. We were pleasantly surprised when we visited the pool area though. Large, well-maintained pool with gym and free arcade - the kids (15, 10, 3) enjoyed it thoroughly. We were able to get Sea World tickets in the gift-shop, but they did not honor the AAA discount. You have to do that at the park. The surrounding area is old-school tourist beach, which we loved. Plenty of places to get coffee, a decent meal, stroll the beach, shop, etc. Gets nicer as you head North, toward La Jolla. Typical, older beach hotel in San Diego. OK, but we will not go back, mainly because the bathroom is too small for a family of 5 and there are better options in that price range.

Reviews.Title: “Great location...pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Julie1Springfield
Reviews.Content: We traveled to San Diego w/ our 10 month old twins...and decided on a stay at the Bahia based on their website. The rooms are in need of some updates but our room w/kitchenette was very spacious and comfortable. Our twins had plenty of room to crawl around. The staff is very helpful...gave us a sheet including directions to several attractions also gives out complementary swim diapers (great idea). Hotel is in walking distance of Mission Beach....and plenty of eating choices. Overall we thought it was a great family friendly hotel (many thanks to the cleaning lady who washed all our bottles and sippy cups everyday)

Reviews.Title: “Being upgraded”
Reviews.Author: OregonWheels
Reviews.Content: The Bahia was in the middle of being upgraded but was very comfortable. We had a very nice room, however it was NOT the room we booked. We reserved a wheelchair accessible oom, but because someone later booked a wedding at the Bahia, they moved our room and gave it to the family of the wedding party. Not having wheelchair access was a huge issue for us! They eventually upgraded our room to a ery nice, but once again it was not accessible. We made do, but a relaxing vacation was interrupted by lack of access. As for the pool..it is amazing! One of the best we have been in. It was always clean, perfect temps, and in spite of the number of people, it was never over crowded. The hotel has a shortage of parking, which can be a problem as well. However, the location is beautiful! It is right on the Bay with a wonderful Bahia Belle boat. The pond with the seals is fun for the kids as ell, not to mention the sandy beches.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: disappointed5
Reviews.Content: We are a party of six that have just come back from the Bahia Resort. The trip was booked for three special occasions- 2 birthdays and an anniversary as part of a trip going on to Las vegas( which was excellent in comparison). On arrival from the UK we were all tired but unfortunately were never to catch up on our sleep due to the parties held on the 5th floor of our complex 5 nights out of 7. In fairness we were warned each time by telephone message but by complaining would they have cancelled the function? I dont think so! Had we been told of the regular functions held here we would never of booked. A minority of the staff were friendly but generally we found the rest unfriendly and patronising especially when we complained about the laundry going during the night and a few problems with our room- our patio door not locking! The rooms were very dated and I agree with the other comments that they are in serious need of updating. The service overall was not too bad our room was always cleaned to a high standard and the few meals we did have were ok although the staff attitude in the bar was very frosty. We stayed at the Bahia for 7 nights but midway through the week we were counting down to leaving and did contemplate leaving early. One other comment our room looked out onto the side road that runs down to a public car park and we were concerned at the safety aspect due to several suspicious looking characters hanging around outside our apartment. Our opinion DONT BOOK THIS HOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “loved the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: rob_hanson1979
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia Resort hotel for 2 nights in December, while visiting San Diego. When we checked in, we were given a studio suite with a kitchen. The room was wonderful. It was large, we had a sitting area, a full kitchen(but no microwave), and a full bathroom. The room was clean and well maintained. The beds were quite comfortable and the balcony was very large. The front staff was very kind and friendly, as well as being attentive. They also know a lot about the area, and gave us some wonderful tips about travelling to Tijuana. There are some bungalow rooms in the resort which are much older and not renovated. While we didn't see any, we were told that they are a bit run down. You may wish to pay extra to get a renovated room, as ours was wonderful. There is a rescue seal who lives at the resort. Seaworld comes twice a day to feed and take care of the seal, Gracie, who is partially blind. Children will love watching Gracie swim and play. The resort looks like it would be a lot of fun in the summer, with lots of activities going on. We ate breakfast one morning at the Bahia Cafe, and the food was good. The rates were average, and the service was very attentive. They offer a full menu plus a breakfast buffet if you'd prefer. There isn't really anything within walking distance to the hotel, except for a Jack In The Box. You will really need a car unless you want to taxi a lot. Within a 10 minute drive, you could get to lots of fast food, some gas stations, convenience stores, and a few bars. Seaworld is also only 5-10 minutes away. To get into downtown San Diego, Balboa Park, and the San Diego Zoo, you are looking at a 15-25 minute drive, depending on traffic. The Mexican border is about 30 minutes away. The resort is great for families with children. Please consider it, but pay for the upgrade to renovated rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Suite ok, otherwise BEWARE”
Reviews.Author: frequent-flyer21
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel as my wife was attending a conference there (seems conferences are their lifeblood). We 'upgraded' to a 'Bay Front King'. Big mistake. These rooms are nothing more than chalets - see some of the candid photos - and they are straight out of the 60's. The room was small, dingy, no easy chair, wash-basin so cramped you couldn't put anything round it (shaver etc) and the bathroom was horrible; the door was half off its hinges (admittedly fixed quite quickly following a call to maintenance). The room was really nothing better than a motel 6, probably worse, and I was disgusted given we'd paid $180 a night. About to pack my bags and leave early, I complained to the front desk, and - to be fair - they admitted their room upgrades were way over due (!!) so I insisted on getting a better room - even a suite. They then upgraded us to a bayfront suite (2nd floor in a modern building to the west of the reception area). Well, it was night and day!! The suite was really excellent, modern, flat-screen Tv's, large sofas, adequate kitchen, fantastic view of the bay, no complaints. Not sure if I'd pay their normal rates for the suite - they told me it was normally $300 - but as a free upgrade it was great. This hotel sorely needs a major face-lift. It is owned by a guy who has 2 other properties - one a very prestigious one at Torrey Pines - and the Bahia is definitely way down his priority list by the looks of things. But if you do stay there, be sure to insist on a new room/suite, and not the motel 6 rooms!!!! BEWARE

Reviews.Title: “Don't go there.”
Reviews.Author: Jacqueline004
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a stay at this hotel. We were there to attend my husband's sisters wedding and were stuck there for a week. The rooms are old, dark and musty although the view onto the bay was nice. The restaurant is diabolical - we were unable to eat there after the first day and unfortunately there does not appear to be anywhere decent to go within walking distance. Really really hated the place and the staff attitude and would not recommend a stay there. When my husband tried to complain to the General Manager he was met with defiance and rudeness. We were even, at one point, told by a staff member to go back to where we came from. Don't worry we won't be back to Bahia or the USA in general again if I can help it! Jacqueline - Hong Kong

Reviews.Title: “Time for a renovation”
Reviews.Author: Shullamite
Reviews.Content: I booked my reservation through Expedia and requested a King bed. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were told that none were available, just 2 full /twin beds. People make reservations for a reason. There must be a communication problem with these things or someone is playing dumb. Full size beds are more like singles for hotels and such. We could not sleep comfortably so my husband slept on the other bed. What was more disappointing was the 'resort' itself. At first we thought we had left the property because the next thing we saw were what appeared to look like an old run-down apartment complex. Straight ahead we spotted the building we were looking for and soon realized that this 'apartment complex' were Bahia's standard rooms nestled between the front building and the building at the end. I didn't want to stay here anymore because I knew that the rooms were not going to be any better. And I was right. It smelled old. The carpet was old. The bathroom smelled bad so I left the bathroom fan on most of the time with the door closed. I couldn't take it so I called the front desk to have someone sanitize the bathroom and give it a good clean. Someone finally came late in the evening and he poured something down the drains to kill the odor and 'cleaned' the bathroom. It helped because now all you could smell are all the chemicals. But now I can really differentiate the bathroom smell and the old carpet. The carpet, especially outside the bathroom area, smelled nasty. The bathroom door sticks like it was too big for the opening, so every time someone would open it, it would wake the other person up. The newer furniture do not compensate for the old smelly room. 50 years old I was told. By the way, I reserved a room with a garden view. What a joke! All there was were a few tall palms and the lawn. Not a single flower. Our view was a vending machine and a ice machine. (What the heck is an ice machine doing in the lawn area?) Putting in a new faucet or sink is not going to make a difference. It's just old and in need of a renovation. I am perplexed by those who rated this place a 4 or 5. Don't let the pictures fool you. I'm glad it was only for 1 night. By the way, we finally got our garden view as we were leaving the resort. You'll find it in the very front where the office is.

Reviews.Title: “Very Enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: JJ_McClure
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit worried about this hotel after reading some of the previous reviews on here, but I was generally very pleased with our stay. The room was excellent (we upgraded to a suite), the pool area with gym and games room was nice and well maintained, the bar was good and so was the resteraunt. Staff were always friendly and helpful. The only let downs were taking two days to return some laundry and the Bahia Bell boat trip that was billed as a romantic evening cruise but was actually just full of drunked college students.

Reviews.Title: “A Great week”
Reviews.Author: ATRAVELINGFOOL
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at allot of resorts over the years and this one did not disappoint. The grounds are well kept and the location is central to everything in San Diego. The rooms are comfortable as ours was recently updated; it looks as though they are still in the process of updateding the rest of the resort rooms at this point. The pool and hot tub were clean and appropriately heated. One nice touch is they have a video game room and none of the games cost any money. The workout room is adequate and clean though we chose to run on the boardwalk; after all we were there to enjoy the beach and sun. The only drawback to this resort that we could see was the parking situation. I think the resort needs to work on this.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Away from the Bahia - Bugs/Cockroach”
Reviews.Author: CASunshine57
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bahia for three nights, and it was a horrible experience. The one bedroom room looked tired and something from the 1970s. I was told by staff that it has not been renovated since that time frame. I was on a conference and thus, for convenience stayed at this hotel. The blow dryer did not work, the drain in the tub did not drain, and I found out this is a common prob. in the other rooms. My colleague had a cockroach fall out of her tub faucet and started to run around on the floor. The air conditioning unit was so loud that I shut it off and left my balcony door cracked open for air - there are no screens on the doors so be careful with kids. Also, the balcony fence has openings too big so a young child can fall through. STAY AWAY FROM THE HOTEL. Staff are nice, but too pricey for cockroaches and no drainage.

Reviews.Title: “They have a seal!”
Reviews.Author: leggers
Reviews.Content: We love this hotel! It's right on the water, great views of the harbor. The staff was incredibly helpful in finding us the best possible room, and even helped us plan a trip to Baja. We took advantage of the many amenities - playing tennis, soaking in hte hot tub, swimming in the 80 degree pool, and even saying hello to their friendly seal Gracie, who lives on the property. In fact, we liked it so much we stayed an extra day, and would return here in a heartbeat next time we make it to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing”
Reviews.Author: Vacationers2007
Reviews.Content: Our family found the Bahia to be everything we needed for a one week trip in San Diego. We especially applaud the wonderful and friendly service from the many service people who work at the Bahia such as the groundskeepers, waiters, waitresses, and the housekeeping people!!! Each one, in their own job description capacity, made our stay even more enjoyable. It's location was perfect for visiting local attractions. Be sure and rent a car though, as the motel offers no courtesy vans to the local attractions or to downtown San Diego; however, we saw that different cab companys were available (we were told it was $18 one way to use a cab and that can get expensive if you have a lot of places to visit). The Bahia Resort is quite a huge complex with different types of rooms. If a person reads the word "resort" and expects an updated, granite counter tops, luxurious spa-like resort, they will be disappointed. The Bahia is an older motel, with cinder block walls in the two rooms we stayed that were both located on one of two bay sides (outside the doorwalls in our rooms was a public road with public access to that side of the bay's beach but we never heard any road or other noise - on the opposite side of the Bahia complex are rooms that exit directly onto the beach with no public access road to cross). Our two bayside rooms were clean. The bathroom had an older style, one basin sink and just outside the bathroom was an older style refrigerator. The second room we rented had a new refrigerator. The Bahia has a convenient on-site restaurant and separate bar that we thought had very good food and wasn't overpriced. In addition, finding close-by restaurant alternatives was a bit difficult (parking at such off-site restuarants can be challenging because finding parking space in that area is at a premium), so, the on-site restuarant availability was convenient and had better tasting food than a couple of more local, off-site restuarants that we tried. Going to downtown San Diego or into Old Town, provided exceptional restuarant options!!! Mmmm! Those restaurants were amazingly good!!! The Bahia is also the only motel we have ever stayed at where the video arcade room is completely free! There are not a lot of arcade games and the arcade games are bit more geared for the youth but, in our many years of traveling, we have never seen arcade games offered for free before! The grounds of the Bahia are relaxing and well kept, thanks to the attentive service people. The pool area and exercise room are clean and attended to also. The Bahia is an excellent choice for those travelers and vacationers who enjoy staying somewhere unique and relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute there!”
Reviews.Author: JulieBWatfordUK
Reviews.Content: Mixed reviews but we loved it! Trees, tropical gardens, rescued seal, big pool, room was large and had fridge, beach outside. The pool area especially was a great place for kids and adults after a hot day's sightseeing. From the moment we arrived we felt relaxed. Room very comfortable. Bathroom needed updating would my only negative comment. We ate at the restaurant which was good value. Go to the rib night on a Staurday, all you can eat!! Go to 'Nick's at the Beach' down in Mission Bay itself for lunch and Sunday brunch. Find a supermarket and buy bread etc for budget meals. We saw lots of people walking to local take -aways in the evening. 5 minutes from Seaworld, you could walk if it wasn't too hot! Take a trip to the Zoo, and the USS Midway is realy interesting, and a good place to park in the city-you can have up to 10 hours. We went over to the Coronado Hotel (where 'Some Like it Hot' was filmed, which was disappointing, dirty beach, and coffee in paper cups!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent resort service!”
Reviews.Author: Travelngrl44
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I attented a wedding at this resort and stayed for 2 nights. First of all, our room was in the far 4 story building and was beautiful and very clean! Some of our friends were in the bungalow beach rooms, which were nice, but not nearly as nice as our room. We saw the "bridal suite" which had beach access right off their room, but I still think our standard room was much nicer. The building we were in must be new or recently renovated. Second, the service at this hotel was some of the best I have seen. Every nook and cranny of this hotel is being cleaned at any moment. The front desk staff was very helpful and prompt. The wait staff in the restaurant and bar were right on the ball. The wedding we attended was on the smaller of the two boats at this hotel and I must say, it made for a very nice wedding. I would recommend this hotel in a minute. The location was great too! Five minute walk to Mission Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Amazing Amazing”
Reviews.Author: crazie31
Reviews.Content: This was an amazing hotel, staff were brilliant especially Ben the concierge. Having read other reviews, Im not quit sure they stayed in the same hotel

Reviews.Title: “motel mold”
Reviews.Author: kimmerArizona
Reviews.Content: This hotel looked beautiful on their web site, the pictures of the rooms were very updated and very nice looking. Our room looked like it was decorated in 1970, there was permanent mold stains on the bathroom floor and on the shower walls, the top of the refrigerator was even peeling off, it was disgusting. We were shocked since we paid $637.00 for three days, we had very high expectations and were extremely disappointed. All the front desk could say was sorry and they would check into it.

Reviews.Title: “Staying There Again!”
Reviews.Author: LexiMax
Reviews.Content: This place was great! The location was great, the grounds were super and the amenities were fine. Safe deposit box? Did you bring the Hope Diamond! This a a great property. My family (wife and 8 year and 3 year) travel all the time and we are going back this October!

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Family Holiday”
Reviews.Author: FunkyG
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 7 nights in Aug 2007 with my wife and boys (11 & 15). The hotel was a 5 minute walk from Mission Beach, a 5 minute drive from Seaworld, and a 15 minute drive from San Diego Zoo. The room was not luxurious, but it was well serviced, with comfy beds and plenty of towels etc. The location is ideal for a family holiday.

Reviews.Title: “We'd go back”
Reviews.Author: vacations007
Reviews.Content: This hotel has both good and not not so good points. This is more a family resort than a luxury resort. We were given the Bay View Suite room 184. It was very outdated, cinderblock walls and uncomfortable beds. Also it'son the public side of the penisula and tents and campers were parked between us and the water. We asked to be moved and Lauren the front desk supervisor was so accomodating. He moved us to room 110, on the opposite side across from the pool. It was perfect for us, bright, clean , roomy enough for a cot and a nice view. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The pool, jacuzzi, and free arcade were very nice. The kids liked Gracie the sea lion. I like the location. 20 minutes would get you pretty much where ever you wanted. Short walk to Mission Beach and Belmont Park ( I'd recommend Canes Rest). Our teens loved Old Town, Sea World, Zoo, beaches, shopping and kayaking in La Jolla. Overall I would say to give this place a chance but when making reservations specify updated room on the lobby side. The staff does seem very eager to make your stay pleasant and we had a great time.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort, terrible rooms!”
Reviews.Author: Enilec
Reviews.Content: My husband found this hotel after a recommendation from a friend who was kayaking in the surroundings but never stayed there. We booked it the day before we arrived so there were very few rooms left and for 5 nights, none of the ocean view were available. My first impression of the front desk was bad (old furniture and carpet, you expect more for a "Deluxe" resort", especially after staying in Delta Chelsea in Toronto and one of the renovated rooms in Excalibur in Las Vegas. The room was bad too: musty smell, terrible bathroom, with floor tiles that were so old that the glaze was gone, rusty bathroom door frame and rotten door. We were given a room facing the tennis court, which was quite roomy, but there are nicer views from the ocean view rooms and the rooms with view on the little courtyard. For $158 a night, plus taxes, I was expecting much better. The staff was just OK, not terribly friendly. Our cleaner kept forgeting putting new toilletrie items, so we ran out of shampoo on a number of times. But the location is great, the pool large with a little kiddie section (2'), a very deep section, and over all a perfect temperature, my kids (5.5 & 3.5) did two Mad Science camps for $3 each for about 45 min, which they loved, the beach was fine, just enough sand and water to keep the little ones happy, we did the Luau party at the Catamaran resort (their sister resort), and for $35 per adult and $15 for my 5 year old (the younger did not pay), we had a nice trip on a sternwheeler to the other resort, a decent polynesian buffet and a great show with warriors and dancers. We also enjoyed the movie at the pool (Narnya, not the latest movie but it was still fun) with free sodas and popcorn (pop corn was out of a bag though and a bit stale, but it was free). Plus the location is great for sea World and downtown San Diego, but you need a car. So overall I rated 3 because the rooms are so old and musty, which I think is unacceptable for a such a resort. Our $70 Comfort Inn in Anaheim was more luxiourious! But the resort is great, and if you travel with kids and want to alternate a day of parks and a day of resting, the resort has plenty to offer. My kids never got enough of the pool and beach, where you can also rent pedal boat and kayaks. We also tried the Bahia Cafe for breakfast and dinner and it was OK. You may want to try the Catamaran resort, which according to some guests we met at the Polynesian party, is much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “Well worth a visit”
Reviews.Author: TheWalkersWirral
Reviews.Content: I often read the reviews on this website before travelling anywhere.My family and I have just visited the resort for 6 nights on our travels around California.I sometimes wonder what people look for in accommodation and am amazed at some of the moans and groans referred to.This resort, although not 5 star by any means , is an excellent base to explore San Diego.The staff were all very welcoming and helpful.We used the concierge several times for directions etc and they were only too glad to help.The grounds of the resort are very well looked after and are neat and tidy.The room we stayed in was on the ground floor and had a view over the bay.The bar staff in the Tangiers bar were great and very welcoming.The swimming pool area was excellent and in the Summer puts a film on at night so the children can swim and watch a film.My children thought this was brilliant and was something they had never experienced before. The resort is right by Seaworld and you can see the nightly fireworks without even going there.If you do visit take a trip up to La Jolla it is about 10 minutes by car and is absolutley beautiful by day and by night.I do agree , however, that the food at the resort is not that good but there are lots of places to eat nearby.I recommend Canes right on the beach by the roller coaster.

Reviews.Title: “Big Disappointment”
Reviews.Author: Siriunson
Reviews.Content: We travelled as a family with 2 adults and 2 kids, staying in a 'Delux' suite. I thought Trading Standards prevent misleading terms like this!!! The separate room for the adults had two very small beds - not big enough to share, and the pull-out bed for the kids was barely adequate; certainly not enough support for an adult to sleep on. The walls looked like a padded cell - really ugly breeze blocks painted off white. There was a microwave and a fridge - no real cooking facilities. Also, no safety deposit box in the room which was a huge bind. The only safety deposit was accessed through the front desk and it was large enough for paperwork/passports only, no video camera space etc. Cashing travellers cheques was restricted to $100 per day and even this was only possible if other guests hadn't used the service... A couple of the desk staff and concierge had a problem attitude and although not discourteous, were neither helpful or approachable. Would not stay here again or recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Misled”
Reviews.Author: jack032265
Reviews.Content: The Bahia was a huge disappointment. The room was made of cinderblocks and looked like a low grade motel. We thought we had a room with a kitchen but in fact the only amenity was a refrigerator. The beds were tiny twin beds jammed in a bedroom. I slept on the pull out couch, actually I slept on the crusty mattress that was placed on the floor because the springs in the pull out were so poor. It was extremely depressing. The pool was crowded but fine. A positive note was that there was a gameroomat which kids could play video games for free. The onsite restaurant was horrible in quality and service. A total joke. Save your money and skip the Bahia.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Last Resort”
Reviews.Author: whaddyawantfromme
Reviews.Content: This place is right for you if you like the ambiance of cinder block walls, 1970s decor, mismatched furniture, screens falling out of the windows and that run down, broken in and dirty look. We were quite surprised when we showed up to find that this place is WAY overpriced and regret wasting 2 nights of a planned 4 night stay. Their website is totally misleading, the beach and water are disgusting with brown foam. The bedrooms offer NO privacy whatsoever and none of us slept well at all. We ended up cutting our loses and moving to the St. Regis (70 miles north), which for 30% more, provided an unparalled experience. I don't know how the Bahia attracts repeat business. Do yourself a favor and consider this the Bahia LAST resort.

Reviews.Title: “loved the bahia”
Reviews.Author: traveljunkie123456
Reviews.Content: This hotel/resort was amazing. With a junior olympic size pool my daugher (a competetive swimmer) got to swim laps each morning. Suprisingly my rebelious teenager had a great time and she actually was proud to admit it. The beach was amazing i liked the fact that it was private. I have high standards when it comes to being active and the bahia stood up to them, there was never a dull moment. The seal was pretty cool and it was rescued to that was an added bonus. The rooms were the perfect size for my family of four. With a balcony on the oceanfront for only $300 a night...ppheeww what a deal. The tennis courts were amazing, my family took private lessons together for an hour and by the time it was up we were playing a competetive game. The garden is also amazing i could sit in there and read all day long. Many of the attractoins of san diego were very close by which pleased me. i recomend this hotel to anyone interesting in going to san diego. I know i will go again

Reviews.Title: “HUGE disappointment!!!!”
Reviews.Author: mtmjcm
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia while on a family vacation. I booked a Bay View Suite several months in advance. What a disappointment. One of the reasons for booking this location was that it was on the bay and offered rooms with bay views, as in the name of the room. What they fail to mention is that you have to look through two rows of parked cars and then the bay is beyond that. They need to call it a Parking Lot View suite with maybe a small glimpse of the bay. (When looking at the aerial view of the grounds, notice Gleason road. No cars in the picture. They must have photoshopped them out or closed the road down in order to take the picture.) We called to complain and were told that they would see what they could do. They said that some of their rooms were like this. I asked to have one of the ones not like this. They were nice enough to "upgrade" us to the Bay View Deluxe suite. The only thing better was that the trees outside of our "Bay View" room blocked some of the parked cars that blocked the view of the bay. We decided to stay in this room but we still made it known that we were not happy. Again they said they would see what they would do but we did not hear back and we decided to just deal with it and enjoy our vacation. The view was not the only problem. The room was very dated. The furniture was very old and uncomfortable and the room was sort of musty; nothing cheery about it. The bathroom was tiny. No place to set any of your toiletries on the pedistal sink. We had one bedroom with a queen bed. The sofa in the living area folded out to a bed which is where our kids slept. The better thing about the first room was that there were two queen beds in a separate room from the living area. We wanted a place with a kitchenette....fridge, microwave, etc. so that we could do breakfasts in the room. The kitchen was fine but nothing special. In our upgraded room we did also have a stove but it looked like it was from the 50's or 60's....sort of like the rest of the decor. The hotel itself was fine. The staff was very friendly. We did have dinner at the Bahia Cafe several nights after being too tired to go out after Sea World, the Zoo, etc. It had a good selection for kids (we have 3 year old twins) and they did fine with the meals. They were very friendly to my kids and always gave colors and coloring books. We also ate breakfast in the cafe 2 mornings. The buffet was good and reasonable and it was free for kids 3 and under. The pool was nice. We swam one afternoon after having gone to the beach. They did have a bar and served some foods but they were not there all the time. We asked about it and were told they only served food on the weekends however we swam on Thursday and they were serving food and drinks that day. On Friday we went to Legoland and were planning to come back and swim and just get a quick dinner at the pool but we got back a little late and thought it would be too cold to swim. And, when we got back, they did not have the pool bar/grill open (on Friday night). Glad we didn't set our sights on that too high. We did not swim on the private beach at Bahia. We drove down the street to the beach. That was more fun for the kids with the waves crashing, etc. The beach at Bahia had a slide, swings which my kids enjoyed. We also rode the Bahia Belle (boat) the first night we were there. My kids enjoyed that and it was a nice ride and something easy to do. The seal pond was neat to see but there was only one seal in it. I thought there would have been more but it was for rescued seals which was very nice to learn about. This was another thing my kids enjoyed. Our vacation started us off in bad moods with the disappointment in the hotel but we got over it and had a good time. Some of the other reviews I have read said something about being in recently refurbished rooms. Had we had one of these, maybe things would have been better. I definitely would not recommend this place to anyone and would be a little embarrassed to do so. One nice "surprise" when we checked out was that they did knock off $100/night on our rate. That made things a little better. We thought it would have been nice for them to let us know about that at the beginning of our week. It would have put us in a better mood about the place for what we were spending.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant and relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: kandi_land
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel for a business trip for 5 days. My room was clean, very pleasant, with a kitchen with stove, refrigerator, sink, and dishes. There was also a large balcony in my thrid-floor room, with a couple of lounge chairs on it. The staff were wonderful. Because I was there on business, I ate several meals there, and the food was delicious. I do think the restaurant was overpriced, but the atmosphere was pleasant, particularly in the outdoor portion. There is a beach alongside the hotel, and I took the opportunity to walk along it a couple of times. There were plenty of lounge chairs for relaxing on the beach, and some very nice views. I loved the hot tub and pool area. They are in the same area, so it is easy to go back and forth between the two (particularly nice on a chilly night). The hot tub is large and there is only one hot tub, so if you don't want to share with one or two dozen other people, it's not for you. This was a very pleasant, better-than-average, relaxing hotel. I would seriously consider staying here again if I ever choose to visit San Diego for a family trip.

Reviews.Title: “simple, but excellent”
Reviews.Author: BrokenDays
Reviews.Content: I booked the night for a getaway for me and my girlfriend, and i have to say, it was a pleasant stay. The Bahis is an older resort (around 30 years old i believe), and it looks it, but thats part of the charm. The property is well maintained, and very clean. We stayed in the Bay View Suite, and it had plenty of room for 2 people. A nice little living room, a mini kitchen with a stove/oven, a refrigerator, and a microwave. They even had pots, pans, casserole bowls, etc. Not that we cooked, but for anyone staying a week or so, this is a nice touch. Another notable thing about the room, is that the TV's had a decent selection of movies and On Demand TV to watch, and it even had Internet, and Nintendo64 on the tv itself. Now, on to the property itself. As i said, its an older property, but this adds tot he charm. Although we didnt use the pool, we checked it out, and it was nice. Theres also a gazebo they use for weddings i believe, with a really cool looking rainforest type setting around it. Great place to relax. Also, as seen in the photos, the resort is surrounded by a beach on their own private little penninsula. The beach itself is a nice setting, but there ARE better beaches in San Diego. I dont think they have a lifeguard on duty there, at least not while we were there. But if the weather permits, its also a nice place to just relax. We also decided to go the the Bahia Cafe located on-property, and while a little pricey, the food was excellent, and the service was fast and friendly. After eating, and after checking out, we walked by the seal exhibit, and even though other reviews say they have 2 seals, there is currently only on there. It seems that they use this enclosure as a means to rescue seals, and eventually release them back into the ocean, which i thought to be very cool. So, i would definitly recommend the Bahia to anyone reading this. And take all the negative reviews u read with a grain of salt, everyone has a bad day, guests AND staff included.

Reviews.Title: “Not good at all!”
Reviews.Author: littletimearizona
Reviews.Content: My family and I reserved a two night stay with the Bahia. Mostly because my husband and I stayed at the sister hotel The Catamarn for our honeymoon and loved our stay back in 89. We arrived there only to be put in a smoking room right in front of there drive way. I complained due to not wanting a smoking room. They actually most gracefully put us in a room way to the back of the property. This room smelled like nothing you have ever smelled before. We only opened the door and did not dare enter. So, again I went to the front desk, they appologized and place us back in the main tower on the fifth floor. We were very happy until the second night they informed us there would be an anniversary part right above our heads. Obviously we did not sleep well that night and had to leave on our long trip exhausted and miserable from our stay at The Bahia. Signed, Unhappy customer.

Reviews.Title: “Don't make the same mistake I made”
Reviews.Author: Happy_Harold
Reviews.Content: It was late when we arrived in San Diego, and had not planned anything. Priceline did not let me book something for the same night, so I went looking on some local SD websites and found this hotel. Then read the reviews here on TA and decided to give it a go. $99 a night. I really don't understand how this place can get such good reviews ? It was by far the worst stay I have ever had in the US. The room was moist and smelly. But as it was late and the better half was very tired , I did not attempt to change room and by then I already knew it was one night only. Also the room ( appartment) was located next to the service area and it was going to be noisy early in the morning. I did not really mind it as it meant I woke up early and could leave early, before catching a cold, sleeping in moist bed linen. At check out I mentioned the fact that the room was extremely damp; the lady, obviously used to this complaint, gave me " I am sorry about that" and it was clear nobody was going to do anything about it. Thankfully they did have free wifi so I managed to get online and book a room in a nice 4*property downtown through Priceline for the same price.

Reviews.Title: “A nice getaway”
Reviews.Author: Trippy_Tripper
Reviews.Content: I booked this "Resort Hotel" based on several things, the two primary features being near beach (for surfing) and having a spa, both of which are discussed on the resort's home website. The idea was that I could leave the beach anytime to go change clothes or get more drinks from the room, or do my own thing while my boyfriend continued surfing. We called the front desk to confirm these features before booking and the staff said the surf beach was right across the street and that yes, all massage services were available at the spa. Calling back a month later to book a massage, having reserved the room, I was informed that there is no spa unless I want to go to their "sister hotel" a mile or more away. And it turned out that the ocean beach is actually down the street and around the corner...walkable, but we're glad we had rented a car because it would be an uncomfortable walk with wetsuits, etc. However, the hotel is directly on the water of the bay, with boats parked right there and a beach to sit on and relax. Very picturesque and serene. The hotel came off to me as somewhat of a business person's/family hotel...the one large hot tub is shared with other hotel guests. You must enjoy looking at other people's children, as there are a lot of them, or at least there were when we were there. We were in a room in the main building across the drive from the front desk...the decor/general feeling I thought was a bit on the cheesy, dated side but it is what made it unique, also. It could also be thought of as 'exotic', with kind of a wood/olive green/rainforest type motif or feel. It was all clean and the housekeeper did a great job. The hotel staff is fairly professional. The environment in general makes for a nice getaway, and cool things to do are walkable--the ocean beach, shopping, restaurants. But I would suggest having a car or utilizing the city bus system which is what we did once we had walked our way into "town" and needed to get back to the hotel. Sea World is just a convenient few minutes away by car--or, as I overheard another guest saying, a $5 taxi ride each way. Which is the same as the $10 parking fee. Definitely worth it no matter what you do. Be sure and check out Gracie and Natasha, the resident seals kept at The Bahia!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: MarkKv
Reviews.Content: The Bahia Resort Hotel was great! I booked it directly on their site, which allowed me to take advantage of creating a customized package including 10% discount for the room and tickets to Legoland. We booked Bay View Studio, which has a large room and a kitchenette. I'd come back when we againg go to San Diego! Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: gottagoCa
Reviews.Content: My husband & I had a quick 2 night getaway here & had a most relaxing time. I requested a refurbished room & room 631 was tastefully done with coordinating fabrics on the duvet, throw pillows, carpet, drapes, & sofa. Especially nice was the down alternative comforter & pillows! The view of the bay was nice but as said in previous reviews the traffic during the day was busy. Lots of air traffic too - having the San Diego International airport in the middle of the city is convenient but noisy. Helicoptor tours buzz the bay & beach several times a day. We didn't really use the kitchen since we were only there for 3 days but the fridge was nice to keep water bottles handy. The grounds were nicely manicured & well kept. The restaurant & lounge were nice as well. It was fun watching the little kids splash & play at the shallow end of the pool leaving the deep end for adults to swim. The hotel requires kids under 5 to wear a swim diaper available for free at the adjoining fitness center so kids in the huge hot tub were actually okay too. We rented a convertible & loved cruising the Mission & Pacific beach areas & La Jolla with the top down! Belmont Park & the boardwalk along the beach are just a couple blocks away. It's great for people watching & soaking up the sun & beach scene. All you Nor Cal people who love Santa Cruz will appreciate the same kind of vibe here - just a larger area with more people (my heart still belongs to Santa Cruz). Many beach shops & interesting restaurants along the boardwalk. Joe's Crabshack was great for dinner - loud in a fun, energetic way & a lot of totaly random things on the wall to look at. We had dinner at Croce's in the Gaslamp district - nice area but the beach & boardwalk area is more our speed. I used this site to research many of the hotels on the boardwalk but decided on the Bahia because I wanted a nicer hotel where we could relax rather than a hole in the wall with a view. The hotels on beach in our budget range were just that - a building on the boardwalk. The nicer hotels were just too expensive. The Bahia ia a resort where you can relax & enjoy the place where you are staying while being close to the fun & action.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel for families”
Reviews.Author: CRDND
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed at the Bahia April 4-9th. We had read many reviews and were a little leary about the property. I would recommend this property to anyone with kids. When we arrived at the Bahia we thought the grounds were beautiful. The front desk people were very helpful. The room was not ready yet, becuase it was only 12pm, as our flight arrived early in the day. They gave us a pool key and a place to change into our suits and told us to enjoy the pool until the room was ready. The pool, whirlpool and workout areas were nice. Nothing special, but very nice to have. Our son enjoyed the pool & we never had any problems finding a place to sit in the sun. The person that we spoke with while making reservations was very helpful also! I think he actually upgraded our room, because we had requested the lowest price room, which is a garden view (basically two beds and a bathroom) - we were upgraded to a newer Garden View Studio with a kitchenette and living room! It was nice to have our own fridge and stock up on some food/drinks for the week. This room should have cost us about $200 more for the week that we were there! Our room was great. It was facing the front desk area, on the third floor - room 642. It was high enough that we could see the bay & it overlooked the Harbor Seals! We would sit on our deck and watch them swim. This was a treat for our 6 year old son. The room was very clean and did not smell at all. Housekeeping did an excellent job keeping our rooms clean & towels well stocked! The only complaint that we did have was that the patio doors are single pane glass, so they did not keep out the sound very good. We never had any problem sleeping though, as we were pretty much on central time zone & went to bed early & up early every day. The breakfast buffet at the hotel was good. We didn't think it was that expensive, considering the menu items were limited & about the same price as the buffet. We ate the buffet almost every morning. We had the Easter Brunch on Sunday & this was excellent. Alot of food & very well done! The egg hunt for the kids was great, as well as the ride on the boat to the Catamaran (sister hotel). We had dinner only one night at the hotel & their evening menu was also very good. Be aware that this is a family hotel so there will be alot of kids in the dining area. I liked the location of the hotel because it is so close to alot of areas. We did not rent a car because my husband did not feel comfortable driving in San Diego. We didn't have any trouble finding taxis and it was probably less expensive for us to take taxis than renting a car for the week. We taxied to Sea World - $6 each way.... the Zoo - approx. $20 each way....Pacific Beach area (Mission Blvd/Grand Ave/Pacific Beach Drive) was about $5 each way. We found ourselves going to this area alot in the evening as there were many great restaurants on or by the beach! We never felt restricted by not having a car. We found a little market near Pacific Beach to buy our groceries too. This is definitely a great hotel for families. We are not too picky, but do like to have a nice hotel room. Our family loved this hotel. I would recommend this hotel to anyone. It is also a great place if you have teenagers, as it is only two blocks to Belmont Park! I noticed alot of teenagers in groups heading over there in the evenings. I felt that this was a very safe area of town for our family too. If you have any questions regarding the Bahi & would like an honest opion - please email me at crdlahaise@yahoo.com.

Reviews.Title: “Not all that bad...”
Reviews.Author: aeroscout
Reviews.Content: I just recently spent two weeks at the Bahia for business. I was leery due to some of the comments I read here. Overall, I thought it was a good value and wasn't unsatisfied. I was in the 300 section. My patio opened right up to the bay side beach and the front door was close to the sidewalk that leads to the "boardwalk" and beach. Yes, the rooms are somewhat dated and worn, but mine was kept very clean. The staff was very attentive, accommodating, and friendly during my stay. The resort is close to the airport, convenient to bus stops, Seaworld, and the beach. There are a few good places to eat within walking distance; I especially liked the taco shop on the nearby corner and the pizza place (Big Papas) just a couple of doors down. I know that some of my coworkers weren't happy with their original rooms but the staff moved them to better ones. It also appeared that they were in the process of doing some renovating; I know that they were replacing carpet and furnishings in the section I was in. Overall, I would not have any problem with staying here again or recommending this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: sandals743
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful quiet stay at the Bahia. The food was excellent and housekeeping did a wonderful job keeping our room clean. We would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Sea World”
Reviews.Author: Karen Wilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed a couple of nights here in early November and malnly because Seaworld is 5 minutes away on the bus. the hotel is ok but a bit too family friendly for us, for that read lots of noisy kids and parents round the pool that made using the pool rather unpleasant, and we couldn't get near the hot tub as there seemed to be a private party going on despite the rules about no alcohol in the pool area. Be advised also, that if you are staying in rooms 215 through to 236, the rooms smell very damp and musty and the light fitting in the bathroom to 236 was dangerous. We complained and were moved into the main block and a huge room straight away. The restaurant food is fine and breakfast is very good, but the hotel is only a short walk away from the beach and the sea and some very good and reasonable restaurants ( Luigis for good pizza). Overall an ok hotel for a couple of nights but no more.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Brooke2100
Reviews.Content: The Bahia is a decent hotel in a good location. If you are looking for a very nice hotel with lots of amenities, this is not the hotel for you. If you are looking for something comfortable close to the beach and Sea World, this is the place to stay. The hotel is older and there were definately some signs of age like the air conditioner not working super well and just general wear and tear. We stayed in the smallest room they offer and it was comfortable and had plenty of room. There is a seal pool at the hotel that contains two rescued seals that cannot be released back into the wild and they were very fun to watch each morning. The hotel is situated right on Mission Bay and it is an extremely short walk to the water. The water in the bay is colder but also calmer. We preferred to walk the four short blocks down the street to the boardwalk at Mission Beach to play in the Pacific Ocean. There is good food to be had on the boardwalk and for those with kids there is an whole area of a rollercoaster, kids rides and an arcade mixed in with shops and restaraunts. Sea World is only 2 miles away and that ends up being a $7 taxi ride each way. For those people more interested in the activities in the area this is the place for you. If you are looking for a vacation where you stay at the hotel all day this place would bore you.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: ElayneL
Reviews.Content: Had a lovely time at the Bahia resort. Food is lovely, salads amazing. Our room/apartment lead to the private beach and was also right by the lovely pool. The rooms are a perfect size, really clean and well equipt. The place really is a lovely retreat for a few days. It is a drive from the city centre but a 2 min.walk from Mission Beach. Really enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Resort Hotel-Will not be a return customer”
Reviews.Author: clundgren
Reviews.Content: Two friends and I made the unfortunate decision to stay at the Bahia during our participation in the Susan G. Komen 3-Day Breast Cancer Walk in San Diego, Nov. 10-12. Our room, Bldg 6, floor 3 was two floor beneath the Ballroom which unbeknownst to us, caters to extremely loud bands during the weekend. Saturday night, the front desk began giving us the run-around stating "we were the only complaint received" and "security was on their way up to take care of the problem" when in actuality there was nothing they could do about the sound drumming through our floor. Once we finally got a call back from the Manager (after 3 attempts), she stated that this was an ongoing issue during the weekends and that she had received an inordinate amount of complaints that evening. They did offer to move us to another room at 10:15 pm which was out of the question because we had to begin our walk at 6:00 am! Also, housekeeping did not arrive at our room until Saturday at 4:00 pm at which time we had already cleaned up as much as we could and asked only for clean towels. So if you're seeking a relaxing, quiet, beach or bay stay...Steer clear of the Bahia. And yes, as stated in past reviews, it is an older hotel that needs quite a bit of upkeep which is desperately needed!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: kasmar
Reviews.Content: Great place! Do not believe the bad reviews unless you're expecting to stay in a 4-5 star hotel. It is an older hotel, but where can you get a big room with a comfortable king size bed, large balcony facing the bay with reclining chairs for $99/nite?!! And the location was awesome. Within 10 minutes we were anywhere we wanted to be. The people at the front desk were very nice and when I asked if I could upgrade the girl told me it would be no problem and gave us a free upgrade. Told us if we didn't like the room to come back and she would help us find another room. Bahia was very clean and we did notice, as some of the other reviews wrote, that the room was a little musty when we first walked in. We simply opened the balcony doors and the front door for about 5 minutes and the smell was gone. Nothing like California fresh air! The only thing I can deduct from the bad reviews is that they are trying to keep this a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Really good place”
Reviews.Author: Susie_24
Reviews.Content: Honestly, forget anyone who says this place is bad. Really big room, very nicely decorated, huge big bed, really comfy, bathroom was lovely, great view over the sea, lovely staff, great housekeeping, great breakfast buffet,lovely grounds, and just all round really nice. Well impressed!

Reviews.Title: “A little disappointed”
Reviews.Author: HI_50
Reviews.Content: The hotel was OK, however, the website failed to mention that the rooms were rather old. The location is awesome and if you are OK with an older facility, I think you'll like it. Being accustomed to 4- and 5- star resorts, this was a little disappointing. The pictures on the website make it look very new, unfortunately, not the case. The rate was great and the staff were very friendly and helpful. Despite, we can't say that we'll stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia - Stayed There Many Times - Be Careful Though !!!”
Reviews.Author: IslandMB
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at the Bahia many times and have enjoyed it a great deal, but mainly because I have learned from my experiences. Below are some hints on what to expect and some advice in booking a room. Good Stuff: ************ **The location is the Bahia's greatest attribute, and that is why they can charge what they do. You are very close to Mission Beach and the Pacific. You are still only 10-15 minutes from downtown. **The rooms are ok if you get the right type of room. The best are the studios in the '400' building which are good size and have a kitchen. If you can afford the extra cost to view the bay, this is a plus. Try not to stay on the first floor. **The breakfast buffet is good value. **The pool is beautiful, but if it is crowded ... get there early. See my comment on the obnoxious music below though. **There are 2 tennis courts (with lighting) and the tennis pro is great. **The front desk staff are generally helpful and efficient. **Room service has good food and service. **Enjoy San Diego - it is one of the very best in the USA with so much to do and with a great climate ! **The Bahia Belle is a Steam Wheeler ship that is quite fun to take at night and to dance to the music and have a drink while cruising between Bahia and Catamaran hotels. **The grounds are well maintained. Bad Stuff - Warning ! *********************** **As mentioned in other reviews - most certainly avoid the rooms in the building across from the Lobby !!! In particular on weekends, there is loud music at night from the parties held on the top floor. This has been a problem for many years, that the hotel has not addressed. On some of my early trips here, this kept me up many nights. I do not stay in these rooms any more. **The plumbing and rooms are old and in great need of updating. A high percent of the rooms do have a moldy smell. Also, the A/C and heating can be quite loud at times. **Do not believe the sales pitch (pictures) on the Bahia web site. This is a sales job that makes the hotel appear to be a 4-5 star hotel. It is only a 3 star hotel due to the conditions of its rooms, at best. **For some reason, the hotel continues with music at the pool that really takes away from a quiet experience and a chance to relax. This has been routinely mentioned in other reviews, and it is true. I have sat in a lounge chair many times wishing the music would just go away !!! **Be careful in booking your room rates, as they very often go up on the weekends significantly. The hotel could be so much more, if the owners would invest further in some improvements. The location is great and I continue to stay there happily if I get the right deal and room. Otherwise ... go somewhere else !!! Good luck

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Resort Hotel - Give it a big miss”
Reviews.Author: JMTBS
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed at the Bahia Resort Hotel for 5 days. Our room smelt of damp and also it needed redecorating. This is a overated hotel. I would go back to San Diego but would give this hotel a big miss.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend this hotel”
Reviews.Author: TraceyS
Reviews.Content: Myself and my husband stayed here in August. I fully expected this hotel to be very expensive as it looked beautiful and in fact, we pulled up outside it because we wanted directions to the Best Western!!!! When i walked in i immediately wanted to stay there, it was lovely. It didnt cost too much either, considering you have your own private beach and all the amentities . Room was spotless, I have to admit though , there was a slight musty spell but left the window open and it soon went. Room was spotless, restsaurant had georgous food, and the small beach was georgous, we hired a boat and went for a spin around the bay. I would definately recommend this hotel to anyone, it was lovely, one of the nicest places i stayed in!!!

Reviews.Title: “In need of major renovation”
Reviews.Author: eatdessertfirst
Reviews.Content: Our four night stay at the Bahia was disappointing. The resort is old and rundown - cracks in the moldings, torn furniture, stains on the towels and linens - I could go on and on. Although we stayed over a holiday weekend, $400/night is absolutely ridiculous for this so-called resort and could have stayed at the Ritz Carlton for about the same price.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: Batman2772
Reviews.Content: Before my partner and I visisted the bahia, i was really worried after reading many of the bad reports on this website. It turns out I was worrying over nothing. We stayed at the bahia for 11 nights in August 2006 and found the hotel, location and the service excellent. The hotel grounds are immaculate with a gorgeous seal pool at the front. The ground staff we constantly keeping the grounds neat and tidy. The check in was easy with friendly staff and we recieved 4 complementry tickets for the lovely harbour cruise. When we got to our room I was very surprised. They was no smell WHATSOEVER. The bathroom was very clean - mainly white tiled with a powerful shower. The only problem was that the shower was positioned very low, and being 5ft 10 that turned out to be a bit of a nightmare when i tryed to wash my hair every morning. The room, to my surprise also had a small kitchen in the corner which we loved. It meant we didn't have to eat out every lunch and dinner time. There was a big fridge/freezer so we bought drinks and snacks in bulk and kept them for the duration of our stay. The room also had a table and chairs and a comfy settee so it was sorf of self catering (much cheeper). We found it really good when we were just lying round the beach and we just had to nip back to the room for food. The only problem I really had about the room was that we were on the ground floor and facing the car park. Being on the ground meant that we didn't really have a private space outside as anyone could walk on/off it. A balcony would have been nice but we were out and about the majority of the time so it wasn't really that much of an issue. Also by being on the ground floor we had to constantly leave our curtains closed so no-one could see in. They was no nets/blinds so anyone passing would be able to see your posessions. There are parking spaces right around the hotel and we always found it easy to get a space near to our room. At night they lock the back gates at the hotel so its totally private which was re-assuring as our room was near to this area. No-one could walk through that wasn't meant to. The private beach was lovely. We bathed on this a few times and really loved it. Its such a beautiful setting and very clean. It was never very busy either. I think the most people i ever saw on there was about 10. The sun loungers weren't the cleanest so you would need your towels to cover them. Overall I would definately recommend this hotel and would definately stay here again (but maybe ask for a room with a balcony and a bit of a view). The decor was slightly oldfashioned and the carpets were a tad shabby but if you can look past this, this is an excellent hotel in a beautiful location.

Reviews.Title: “Looks Like a Well Kept City Housing Project”
Reviews.Author: pradancer
Reviews.Content: When we pulled up, my nine year old asked "is this an apartment building?" I believe, many years ago, perhaps this was a nice place. But now it is old, filthy, run down. The place also attracts "creepy" people, so PLEASE don't let your teens girls walk around alone. I wondered why no familes were at the beach on such a beautiful warm day, perhaps because it was a Monday, or perhaps, this is a not a place where you want to expose your children too. The cost is cheap, so therefore attracts a lower class of people.The sliding glass doors where filthy with fingerprints and you could see babies in diapers running in and out of the doors. The staff does a good job in cleaning, but the place is just run down. Please don't be fooled by the beautiful pictures, the place really looks like an apartment. Landscaping? if it exist, I did not notice it. The price was good, but I see why. I checked out immediately and checked into the Hyatt.

Reviews.Title: “Great Time”
Reviews.Author: shadhara95
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay with our family 2 adults, 4 children we had a wonderful time. I expected the place to be dated as I stayed here with my family in '74. We really enjoyed the size of our suite, the pool, grounds, sitting on the bay beach.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia - A great experience!”
Reviews.Author: ManishaV
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia for 3 nights in April 2004. We had a great time! * The hotel is beautifully decorated with a tropical touch. Our room had a patio and led out into a beautiful lush garden. * The private marina was great and we could rent bicycles, canoes, and various other equipment (like jet skis & paddle boats I think). * It is conveniently located pretty close to the beach and sea-world. * The hotel has really pretty walking trails. It is really cool to be able to walk around the lush green, tropical property. Very enjoyable stay - would definitely come back again!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Location and a Great Deal!! Can't wait to go back”
Reviews.Author: TravelinGrl
Reviews.Content: I just stayed at the Bahia Resort Hotel, and let me tell you I had the time of my life! I live to travel, and I am constantly visiting new hotels. I have stayed in San Diego several times, but it seems like the only area I am ever able to get a reasonable rate in is Mission Valley... which is not a desirable area to stay (no beach, and not at all what you think of when visiting San Diego). So when I took a little time to research rates for my recent weekend trip, I was pleasantly surprised to find that I could stay at the beach without paying a fortune!! I was able to enjoy my entire weekend without having to drive anywhere. There is a lot of great restaurants within walking distance, and we LOVED Cafe Bahia... so delicious. The hotels Mediterranean theme is absolutely charming, and the rooms were clean and had everything we needed. And the staff was so nice!! Smiles all around. I can't wait to tell all my friends about this great hotel... and I will definitely return!!!

Reviews.Title: “Don't be fooled by their web site-the Bahia is "Bahad"”
Reviews.Author: whirltravlor
Reviews.Content: If you like the "little" extras, say, like, a screen for your patio door, a working bathroom vent fan, no mold on your shower curtain, or a refrigerator door that closes properly, then you will want to pass by this so called "resort". I had known that my chances were iffy staying at the Bahia as the reviews are mixed, but I thought I would check it out myself as I am usually not as negatively opinionated as others. This is the 1st time I have left a review of any hotel I have stayed at, let alone wrote the very day arriving home. Let me tell you of my stay. My girlfriend and I had booked this room for her elderly mom and my teenage son. We requested a room that was wheelchair accessible. We called several times to confirm, each time getting a different story as to whether we would be able to get a wheelchair to our room or not. Upon entering bay view suite #196, the room smelled musty. The carpet is worn and looks dirty. The loveseat & sofa has torn upholstery. The sofabed is miserably uncomfortable with a very thin mattress. It was so old & worn that you could feel the bar poking you in the back. We actually rigged it by placing the sofa & loveseat cushions under the mattress so we could sleep on it. I open the patio door at night to let in some fresh air-no screen and ended up letting in bugs. That 1st night we want to order roomservice from the Bahia Cafe but the menu is missing from our hotel book. Call the desk around 8:00 pm and ask for a menu to be brought. Was told by employee it would be brought right over, it wasn't ,so we walked to the desk, got it ourselves, walked back to the room for everyone to see what they wanted & ordered only soup & 2 burgers around 8:45. We were told it would take 35-40 minutes. It arrived in 50 minutes and the food was terrible. But, hey, we had a great day at Sea World and spending some time together, so I'm overlooking those "little" things.
