I noticed that the ugly instituational looking brick walls do come in handy as it appears very quiet-can't hear the neighbors above or to the sides. Sleeping was difficult on the makeshift cushions on the sofabed and also the sheet that they use for the mattress doesn't fit so it kept coming off the mattress the entire night and bunching up. Not fun. Next day notice the mold on the shower cutain, the bathroom vent fan doesn't work, and when making the sofa bed notice some black flecks around the mattress. Things that make you go "hhhmmmm".... We spend the day at Balboa Park-have a great time, eat dinner in Old Town-wonderful Italian place. Back at the room we order room service again, thinking that the chocolate weekender & german chocolate cake sounded good. Didn't think it would take an hour to get dessert though, and again, the food is not very good. Tonight I don't get fresh air & let in the bugs, because even though the air conditioner is loud it's not as loud as the swarm of what appears to be underage drinkers & party goers that starts approximately 100 feet outside our ground level room at the PUBLIC beach around 9:30 pm. Unfortunately those previously mentioned soundproof brick walls don't come into play as this party is right behind our room. Called security directly about this around 10:30ish, was told that since it is a public beach, even though they are playing very loud music and disturbing resort patrons, they really can't do anything about it. When told I paid alot of money for this room, security then told me he "could go out there and ask for them to turn down the music" but that's all. That's pretty much all I wanted. Around 11:15 my girlfriend calls the front desk and complains again. Front desk says they will call the police. A police cruiser drives by on the public beach street behind my room . The underage drinkers scatter, but the car the loud music is coming from stays along with a few other cars . Minutes after the cruiser leaves, the party & loud thumping start again. It's around midnight I call the police myself. However, I can't find the number as the list of important phone numbers are missing from the resort book. I use my cell phone and get the non emergency SD police phone #. Then, attempt to use the hotel phone, following the directions. The hotel phone doesn't allow me to call the police directly-it states that number is "unavailable" from that phone. I have to use my cell phone to call the SD PD directly. KUDOS to the PD. The dispatcher was very helpful & also the officer who re-responded. And not a minute too soon...4 large ticked off men from the room next door were approaching the party-goers just as 3 police cruisers were literally chasing the crowd off. Hope this long review gave you a feel for this resort, specifically room #196. One more thing, upon checkout-the guy beside me was an "unscheduled" check out. He was there on business and wasn't happy that the advertised wireless internet wasn't.

Reviews.Title: “We had a ball...very nice!”
Reviews.Author: jacie1120
Reviews.Content: I don't understand the complaints from people; the hotel was great. We stayed at the Bahia Hotel from July 21-23, 2006. My husband and three kids stayed in the two story building and our room was facing the bay..beautiful view! The patio was very large, and had two reclining beach chairs. We had a perfect view of the fireworks from Sea World. I was intimidated after reading the horror stories, but we were armed with room deodorizer for the "must/mold" smell (which there wasn't any) and we took our own bedding for the "short sheets" (again, non-existent). My only complaint was that upon entering our room, there was a dresser immediately to the left and it felt a bit cramped going in and out of the bathroom.The pool area was great, although crowded. There was a band of sorts playing caribbean music poolside and drinks could be ordered at the pool along with food such as nachos and hamburgers. Everything could be charged to the room which was great because I didn't have to worry about bringing (and losing) money. It felt very much like resort - large palms and banana plants, and free bay tours that took us to a luau at an adjoining hotel. The location was awesome. Blemont Park reminded me of Santa Cruz/Santa Monica on the Pier. Food, Mission Beach, Belmont Park, boat rentals, shopping - all within walking distance. My kids enjoyed the hotel and surrounding entertainment more than Sea World. I'll definitely be back!!

Reviews.Title: “can't wait to return to the bahia...”
Reviews.Author: sandyfoot
Reviews.Content: wonderful stay! we were amazed how relaxed we were after only one night at the bahia. the staff was super friendly and brought our delicious room service to us on the beach in front of our room. seriously- the food was amazing- shocking for room service. the breakfast was divine. we are going back next month! the rooms weren't posh but who cares? the location is wonderful and the free bay cruise was fun. we went for a romantic getaway and next time we'll bring the kids- a perfect beach for them.

Reviews.Title: “Dont go”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia Beach "Resort" at the end of our honeymoon in May 2006. It was to say the least very poor. It was like a run down motel in that the rooms were tiny and not very private. Immediately outside our patio was a promenade that practically anyone could walk down and look into our room. It was really creepy. We were assigned one half of an adjoining room and unfortunately a noisy family were in the room adjoining us. They were up at 6.30 and made noise the whole morning. This was terrible. Our nights sleep was totally ruined. The staff were helpful but an area map would have helped. But overall it was one of the worst places we have ever stayed in. Dont be fooled by the brochure, stay away.

Reviews.Title: “I will never stay here again! very disappointed!!”
Reviews.Author: sweetpeachz
Reviews.Content: Hmmm where shall i start? The first thing that really disappointed me was when we (my family) first arrived at the Bahia Hotel. We went to check in and our reservations were changed without us knowing about it. So we ended staying in a room that was very run down, the beds were very uncomfortable, the sofa was very old and the plumbing was very bad in the kitchen and bathroom. Second thing that disappointed me was the maid service. It took 2 or 3 pnone calls for them to bring towels to our room and when the maids came to "clean" our rooms (if thats what you call it) it never looked liked they cleaned the room at all, the bathroom was still dirty, carpet still had sand on it. It seemed the only thing they did was change the towels and make the beds.The third thing that I couldn't believe happened was when all my beach towels got stolen from my patio. I think with all the homeless people and party animals around the Bahia they should have some kind of security patrolling the area around the Bahia more often especially at night! I will definitely be staying somewhere else the next time I visit San Diego!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great View and location but.......”
Reviews.Author: Carollovestravel
Reviews.Content: On entering the area of the hotel, my breath was taken away with the beautiful location of this hotel on Mission Bay, the grounds are kept beautifully, the pool area looked very clean, the beach is wonderful. On checking in we were given two rooms which were like small bungalows (even though I had requested upper floors) and yes all the reviewers are right, both rooms had a terrible smell, the furniture is very well worn, but the bed was very large and comfortable. I felt unsafe being on the ground floor with the large patio doors, the windows had no net curtain or blinds only heavy curtains so during the day with the curtains open you and all your possessions were on full view unless you closed the curtains, I found the rooms to be very unwelcoming, the bathroom had a bath and toilet and in an ante room (or corridor from bathroom to bedroom) you had a washbasin, a very strange set up to me. I agree with some of the other reviews that it would be a good idea for the hotel to spend a bit more money on the rooms and perhaps a little less on the grounds. Regarding noise - there were a couple of weddings on while we were staying but we were not affected by the noise at all. Enjoyed the trip around the bay on the paddle steamer, which took us to the other end of the bay had a lovely meal at The World Famous Restaurant, lots of atmosphere.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Resort!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a great time at the Bahia. The room was pretty basic, but there was no musty smell like previos reveiwers stated. It was clean and comfortable. The resort is beautiful and the staff are awesome. Great location, great food at the restaurants! Great pool and beach!

Reviews.Title: “hated the bahia”
Reviews.Author: cruiseqn
Reviews.Content: I checked online for a hotel near Seaworld. The pictures of the rooms looked great on their website until we got to our room. It was more like an old motel. The room was musty. The air conditioner did't work, the wallpaper in the bathroom was coming off, cracked tile, paint peeling off the doors. We needed to give the baby a bath but there was no plug for the tub drain. There was also no tissue and for the 4 of us we had one coffee mug and one glass. Needless to say this hotel was overpriced and very uncomfortable. We couldn't wait to check out in the morning. Since we did book at the last minute I think we got one of the worst rooms (234). On the property was one larger hotel and several smaller two story units, which is where we stayed.

Reviews.Title: “Walk to the beach to party, have nice peace to rest”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I have read the reviews of the Bahia, and let me tell you, like any other hotel, if you want to have a luxurious hotel, you may want to stay at the Loews Coronado, but if you plan on going out, exploring the city, and come back to the room to sleep, then Bahia is for you. Also, each area is different. Some rooms have a bay overlook, others of the garden or the pool, depending on where you stay. The staff was very friendly, the room was clean, of course I have been to better looking rooms, but our room was spacious and clean. We also had a fridge and a microwave. Plus if you have a laptop, you don't have to pay for high speed connection. Parking is free, which is RARE in San Diego, plus, we were only a block away from Mission beach, 15 minutes from La Jolla, 15 minutes from Downtown and only 15 minutes from Coronado. San Diego is really easy to get around, and with Mission beach just up the street, you can party, party up the beach, and then come back to the room with a nice peaceful rest. Also, the pool is heated and the jacuzzi is huge. The only bad thing about our room was that the room never really got that cool. But the tempertures we dealt with, it wasn't bad. Also, locals have weddings and graduations there, so that should tell you the place is not bad. Also, the hotel offers a cruise around the bay for free for residents, so take advantage. Last but not least, the hotel is on a bay, so you can cook out, lay out and chill insted of going to the beach. The Bahia Hotel was a great place for vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia Resort from April 30-May 6 and had a wonderful time. The employees were very friendly, helpful, and the grounds were beautiful. We were a bit concerned with some of the bad reviews, but decided to give it a chance and we are so glad we did. I would totally recommend this hotel for anyone with children (we have a five year old) because of the location, and the harbor seal pool. We walked on the beach every night and the pool and hot tub were spectacular. We also were close enough to walk across the street to the ocean. The room we stayed in had a kitchen and beautiful windows/sliding glass door overlooking the bay. We were totally satisfied staying there and would recommend it. Yes, the decor in the building we stayed in was dated, but the room itself was spacious and very nice. We look forward to staying there on our next visit to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “A musty place”
Reviews.Author: Busyperson_11
Reviews.Content: Very old hotel that is in desperate need of renovations. While the room appeared clean, the bathroom had dark stains on the floor and the room had a damp musty smell. The hotel provided two glasses in the room and I caught the maid cleaning them with dishwashing liquid and her hands. The door to the room and the window in the bathroom had large gaps, which allowed bugs(spiders) in the room and noise of passing cars and slamming doors. The only positive is the Hotel is in a good location to the local attractions.

Reviews.Title: “Great base for exploring”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Bahia Resort from the 28th April to the 1st May 2006. We booked a driving tour starting in San Francisco and driving through California ending in San Diego, staying in hotels from 3 to 5*. We were really worried because of all the bad reviews on this site about the Bahia Resort and braced ourselves when we arrived. However we were pleasantly surprised, the room was overlooking the harbour, such a lovely view. The room was huge with a seperate bedroom, very large lounge area and a reasonable sized kitchen with an oven, 4 hob rings, kettle and large sized fridge with a small freezer section in it. The rooms are very old in style and would not win any awards for modern accommodation but it was clean and the maid did a great job. She even did some of our washing up unexpectedly!! The pool was great, warm and clean with plenty of sun loungers for those who wanted them. We used this hotel as a base to explore the area and go into San Diego and it did the job perectly. I can't see how people could have given this such a bad review, generally when we go to a hotel we hardly spend any time in the room anyway! I didn't go all the way from London to San DIego to sit in a hotel room! We didn't eat at the hotel - we don't often eat at hotels as you get far more choice by just venturing out a bit. Go to La Jolla or the Gaslamp Quarter in San Diego to eat as there are lots of places to eat and drink. All in all I would urge anyone going to stay at the Bahia resort not to be worried unless you are expecting 5* accomodation. Its pleasant, clean and in a nice location by the bay. I would recommend it and stay there again

Reviews.Title: “What's with the rotten reviews?”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I am suprised at the negative reviews. My family make a yearly trip to Seaworld and we have stayed at the Bahia for 3 years. One year we went to the Marriott in La Jolla. Now, we found our room at the Bahia WAAY better than the Marriott! The rooms are always clean, the staff is nice and we love the beach out back. This place has lots of wonderful memories for us. It will be our yearly ritual. So what if it's not the Taj Mahal? No hotel I think is going to be 100 percent perfect. If you want the Taj Mahal...good luck!

Reviews.Title: “old and smelly”
Reviews.Author: plainjohn
Reviews.Content: great location but the rooms have to be retro late 60s- 70s. I had a inside room with no view. Room smelled of mildew. Fridge, no microwave. Weather was great, mid 70s and sun. Next time, I'll stay at the Omni.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: After reading the mixed reviews on this website, we were pleasantly surprised and pleased by our stay at the Bahia. Our family of four (children ages 3 and 6) spent five nights there during the busy spring break season at the end of March. We stayed in one of the much maligned (by other reviewers) ground floor â€œmotelâ€� style rooms that open out to the beach on Mission Bay. It was pleasant and comfortable, but not fancy. We didnâ€™t find anything wrong with the room or the beds. The weather could have been warmer, but as it turns out, that is not controlled by the Bahia. SERVICE: Overall, the service in all aspects of this hotel, including the restaurant, was excellent â€“ more professional and friendly than Iâ€™ve experienced at the major chain hotels. The only drawbacks to this hotel stem from the fact that it was probably designed and built 40-50 years ago. OUR ROOM: We could watch our kids play on the beach from our room. After the kids went to bed, we enjoyed drinks while taking in the view of the bay from our back porch. Our room was old, but recently redecorated and equipped with a small fridge and microwaive. We did not notice any bad smell. The rooms are several yards from a natural, salt water bay. I suspect reviewers who complained about a smell were overly sensitive to the smell of the ocean during hot weather. We rented kayaks right outside our door and paddled around the placid Mission Bay. Sailboats and other small craft are also available for rent AMENITIES: The grounds of the hotel are beautifully landscaped, including a pool with two rescued harbor seals, which intrigued our children. The swimming pool is also terrific for families â€“ an bar for grownups, occasional live music, and a large 2-foot deep wading area the little ones. It has a large hot tub, small exercise room, and small video game room. While we were there, the management kindly made all video games free in honor of spring break! RESTAURANT: The cafÃ©-style restaurant had decent food, relatively reasonable prices, and good service. The outdoor seating is especially pleasant, but the weather didnâ€™t cooperate for us. We ended up starting our days with the breakfast buffet, which was a better alternative to driving to an IHOP or Dennyâ€™s and probably just a few dollars more. The coffee was certainly better at the Bahia cafe. LOCATION: The hotel is conveniently located to most tourist activities at the southern end of Mission Beach, although somewhat isolated from other hotels and shopping. Itâ€™s a short walk to ocean beaches, the paved ocean walk, and the Belmont Park amusement park. Itâ€™s a long walk or a short drive to Seaworld and the eclectic Pacific Beach neighborhood. Try picking up snacks, wine or liquor at Trader Joeâ€™s on Garnet Ave in Pacific Beach. If you want to dispense with the rental car, a city bus across the street runs every 15 minutes to the Old Town transit center. From there, you can peruse the shops and restaurants of Old Town, or take the San Diego Trolley (lightrail) to Tijuana, Mexico. The zoo is also a short drive or bus hop. CONCLUSION: This hotel is quite nice but not a fancy hotel, mostly owing to its age and design. Donâ€™t go here looking for luxury on your honeymoon. But it was comfortable, well-maintained, and ideal for families.

Reviews.Title: “A mixed bag”
Reviews.Author: Delkerans
Reviews.Content: My husband & 4 year old son just returned a week ago. Overall, The Bahia is average. It is somewhat dated and is in need of a "face lift". The website makes it look a lot nicer than it actually is. The grounds are lovely. The location is great. The swimming pool was large and indeed heated and a favorite hang out for my son. The "gym" was adequate for quick cardio workouts and I liked that it was near the pool. Our 2cnd floor family suite was OK. A great size with a balcony with a view, however, the room was a little musty smelling and the rug was damp when we arrived. We were happy to be on the second floor, however we were above some kind of function room, so at 6:30 AM we were awakened by the "set-up" crew and the sound of doors slamming. We were able to move to another suite after a few nights and they did discount our room. This 2cnd floor unit was located at the far end of the property (more private, less activity) but was also just average. The room was smaller and the sleep sofa was broken, so we couldn't use it. We dined in the restaurant for dinner on our first night and I would recommend you go elsewhere. The service was mediocre, our meals took a very long time to come out and it was the most expensive meal for our 7 day stay in San Diego. The manager asked how our meal was and when we responded, he just kind of smiled. The smaller Tangier restaurant was fine for a quick bite. Bottom line..hmmm..I wouldn't go back, but it wasn't dreadful.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place Overall”
Reviews.Author: jm89074
Reviews.Content: Wow! Alot of mixed reviews about this place. My girlfriend and I have been there twice, In october '03 and april '05. We really like it alot. Pricey? Not compared to other places in San Diego that are right on the water. We have stayed in the garden view rooms both times, the first time a downstairs room, the second time an upper. One bad thing I will agree with based on our first stay (but not the 2nd time around) is the musty smell of the room, but we didn't think it was overpowering or that big of a deal. The staff have always been nice and helpful to us. The rooms and furniture are outdated, yes, but again if you want something more lavish and right on the beach in San Diego, you'd likely pay more. But our rooms have alwasy been neat and clean, so it's a good value overall. We don't care to spend much time in our room anyway. Kitchenettes help alot with being able to keep $$$ down so you don't have to eat all of your meals out. The grounds are beautiful as are the hot tub/pool area. Decent fitness center and arcade. Nice private beach with water sport rentals, free evening cruise for hotel guests, restaurant looks good (although we always go out or eat in our room, so can't vouch for the food.) Mission beach is a great place and close to alot of other great areas with alot to do and alot of good restaurants such as La Jolla, Pacific Beach, and Ocean Beach. Check out these nearby restaurants: Thee Bungalow in Point Loma and Chateau Orleans in Pacific Beach.

Reviews.Title: “The Worst”
Reviews.Author: charlieup
Reviews.Content: The smallest room I ever stayed in at any Hotel room anywhere, very bad beds, very small bathroom, no place to put your toiletries, bad a/c, comp. boat trip on the boat that never showed up. An old resort no modern anything. Worst week we ever spent on a vacation.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia is better than Hawaii or Las Vegas”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the "400" building and had the best time in any hotel we've ever stayed in. Pool and private beach was just the best. Secluded harbor view is beautiful and relaxing. We paid close to $200 per night, but it was well worth it. Our room had everything we needed and it was very clean although a bit dusty. Room service was prompt and food was delivered hot. Bahia restaurant is top notch and the breakfast buffet is excellent. The Chef cares about his buffet line and it's something Las Vegas should learn from. We walked everyday and even rode the rollercoaster at Belmont park. Ocean nearby, fresh air, nice view and plenty of restaurants and giftshops. It's as good as Hawaii without flying. We will be back again soon!

Reviews.Title: “The Bahia is just ok”
Reviews.Author: darbyfortcalhounnebr
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia on 2-13-06 to 2-17-06.It was just ok, the room we had was 136 on the private beach side, I was not that impressed.The room smelled old the fan in the batroom made alot of noise the sliding glass door was hard to shut. we told them a couple times but it was never fixed.The rooms need to be updated big time.The pool and the hot tub are nice.The Bahia would not be my first choice.I would stay some where else.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing better in San Diego....”
Reviews.Author: sparklefeb
Reviews.Content: Generally, when you plan a trip away it is to get away from the hassles of everyday life...The Bahia is the place to go! There is no better place to stay in San Diego than at the Bahia Resort....A few years ago my boyfriend planned a surprise trip to San Diego and stumbled upon Bahia...Our room was so perfect, that on the sand outside our room, he proposed. We just spent another weekend there again. The rooms are spotless, the views are beautiful, the beds are comfortable and everyone that works there puts your needs first. A high school dance was being held this past weekend and my husband was a bit concerned that there would be a lot of noise and disruption....There was nothing for him to worry about though, we had a wonderful romantic weekend without any problems.

Reviews.Title: “Stay Elsewhere”
Reviews.Author: slaurenkennedy
Reviews.Content: The Good - the grounds are kept up beautifully, the pool and jacuzzi are wonderful, and the seals (there are two on the premises, just as you enter the site) are adorable. The hotel is centrally located with a lovely view of the bay, depending upon where your room is. The Bad - The workout room is paltry, and isn't what they depict on their website. House keeping is slow to respond. The staff is young, and while seemingly pleasant, are somewhat typical when it comes to service from teenagers. Shady price dealings as well. The Ugly- The Bahia is a complex made up of various types of rooms. We looked at them all and came up with only one that was acceptable. Yes, believe all the reviewers, most of the rooms DO SMELL. The ground floor "suites" are akin to staying in a basement - cinder block walls, musty smell and outrageously hideous and abused furniture included. This theme is repeated throughout the complex, though getting slightly less offensive as the room style changes. If they spent an eighth of the money and time they do on the grounds tending to the rooms, the Bahia would benefit greatly. Conclusion- Our room was in the tower directly across from the lobby. We stayed here for the week. No smell. Updated decor. Typical "hotel" style. Good view. It is located under the ballroom however and we did experience very loud noise one evening when a private party was underway (we were not notified) and drums from the band shook our room for hours. Apparently the Bahia is known for frequent weddings and conferences. That being said, we wouldn't stay here again. And we certainly wouldn't recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great view and awesome location - crappy beds”
Reviews.Author: jnau
Reviews.Content: I also had read the reviews on here and decided to give it a try. The view is spectacular and we were impressed when we first found this little "jewel." The heated pool and hot tub are awesome. It wasn't until we first went to bed that we realized how horrible the beds were. First of all, they didn't have a fitted mattress sheet on the bottom and less than an hour into our sleep the sheet was entirely off the mattress. The second night I noticed there were a total of three sheets on our bed, four on the other bed my daughter was in, so I asked not to have room service and rigged two sheets on each bed sideways and they finally stayed on. However, the beds are very small and not at all comfortable, and the pillows are way too big - gave everyone a sore neck. The hideaway was awful, but my three year old was light enough that he didn't feel the springs poking into his back like I did when I tested it. So it's a give and take on this place - chances are you won't get a good night's sleep, but it has a killer view and nice pool area, plus it is just a few blocks from the boardwalk, which is a very fun place to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Room with Private Beach - how divine”
Reviews.Author: ZoeHenderson
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I arrived in San Diego on 6th Dec 05 from LA and after reading a review in one of our travel books about the Bahia we thought we'd try and find it and check it out. Well we found it with no problems and on arriving found it to be very appealing (even at 6.30pm when dark). I went to the front desk and enquired about rooms, they guy on the desk was really helpful, telling us they had a garden room he could do for $159 a night; he then said he had a deluxe garden suite and he'd give us the same rate. We snapped up the room and said we'd like to stay for 2 nights. On entering the room, i will admit there was a rather old smell to it but it was a great room, massive, fantastic living area, 2 tv's and the best part - a private beach. The bathroom does not have a bath, a large shower which fits 2! So be warned if you like baths. The bed in this room was so comfortable, the maid service great and they certainly respect your privacy. We liked it so much we stayed an extra night before making our way to Las Vegas. It was our first visit to San Diego and we'd definitely come back. Recommendations would be La Jolla to walk the beach and stop in Del Mar - a really quaint town about 30 mins drive from Mission Beach SD, try the Rendevous chinese restaurant - fab food.

Reviews.Title: “Do Not Stay At The Bahia Resort !”
Reviews.Author: DM123
Reviews.Content: I wish I had read the comments on this site before staying at the Bahia Resort as I've found myself agreeing with all of the negative comments made. We had prepaid through a travel agency to stay at the Bahia resort for 4 nights but we left after the first night. The entire hotel does not look to have changed since the 1970's and is in need of major refurbishment. The rooms are terrible. We were initially put in one of the "garden view" rooms looking out onto Gleason Road public car park. The room was very basic, dark dirty, and the smell of damp was overpowering. For some strange reason there is no light switch by the door so you have to feel your way over to the bed to switch on the light. We asked to get moved and were moved into a room in the tower. This room was only slightly better in that it did not smell as bad. The Bahia is very isolated, you are close to Seaworld, a japanese restaurant, and a run down amusement park. The shops and restaurants on Mission Beach Blvd are 2 miles away. When we asked Front Desk to recommend a restaurent they directed us to Mission Center Shopping Mall which was a 15 min drive away. Our tour brochure described the Bahia as being on a private peninsula. This is not the case, the better of the two beaches is a public beach and there is a large car park down one side of the peninsula serving this beach. The Bahia has a private beach of dulld dirty sand with a large step half down it. The waterfront is not very attractive and there is a large jetty in front of the beach with boats berthed. Front Desk Service assured us that we would be able to get milk for our infant whenever we needed it. When I went down to Front Desk 10 mins before the restaurant opened for breakfast I was told that as the restaurant was closed I would have to drive to Walgreens to get milk. After it was pointed out that deliveries were going into the kitchen and that I could not see how there would not be anyone in the kitchen preparing for opening the assistant agreed to go and see if there was anyone in the kitchen. Sure enough and came back with milk. Surely it doesnt take a chef to open a fridge and pour milk... Our tour operator listed the Bahia as a 3+ Star hotel. At most the Bahia is a 2 star MOTEL.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't believe the location”
Reviews.Author: epicauthor
Reviews.Content: We arrived at the Bahia hotel with much trepidation after reading the reviews posted here. Upon enterance we were wondering what all those people were talking about! The grounds upon arrival are absolutely beautiful. We pulled into the lobby area and were astounded how polite the front desk staff are. They must really train those Front desk agents in service. The nice manager who checked us in gave us a really nice upgrade....to a suite on the private guest beach! The bellman who walked us to our room gave us much information about the property. We decided to have dinner in the cafe and then partake on the boat ride. The food was abolutely wonderful, possibly the best of our entire trip! The boat ride is a wonderful addition and we enjoyed the music greatly! We found the rooms to be clean, neat, and well stocked with every amenity you might want. My wife is a tea drinker and they even had Lipton tea for her to drink with the coffee maker. That is a wonderful idea and I wish more hotels would provide that service. Give the man with that idea a raise! Overall, I would say stay at the Bahia hotel for an experience unmatched in quality and service!

Reviews.Title: “An old resort that has aged a bit, but affordable place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Decent hotel, that appears to be resort from decades past (perhaps the 70s), and hasn't had much updating. It does have a nice location on Mission Bay and is offset from the hustle and bustle of the area, so it was a quite stay. We had a separate cabin style room - received a complimentary updgrade - which was a nice change of pace from standard hotels, and we didn't have to listen to our neighbors. So, if you can afford it, these are nice accomodations. Aside from that, nothing special. The beds are a bit hard, and the sheets scratchy (why can't hotels pay more attention to the bed and sheets?).

Reviews.Title: “Worst accommodation of our trip”
Reviews.Author: Vreen
Reviews.Content: We travelled through California for nearly four weeks in September and stayed in 10 different hotels. THIS WAS BY FAR THE WORST... AND ALSO THE MOST EXPENSIVE. We booked in for one night with the idea of extending for another three but after checking in to the room almost did not stay that night. The accommodation must have been built for the least possible cost and had no money spent on it since. Rooms are dark, dingy, poorly built and badly finished. Some poetic licence has taken place calling this site a 'resort'. It has nothing going for it - it is isolated - there are much better beaches in other areas of San Diego and certainly better and more reasonably priced accommodation. I would not go back to this place.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a great place to stay. It felt like our own private island. You can not beat the location and it is nice to find a resort that has such a professional and friendly staff. We will be back again and again. FYI we found the best prices on the hotels own web site and when we arrived they gave us a free upgrade. It was great.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Bahia for a family resort”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of six ( four boys under 12)retruned from five days at the Bahia. As usual it was wonderful. If you are looking for a classic California all inclusive resort for children, this one is hard to beat. If you are looking for an executive level hotel, you would be better off at the Four Seasons in La Jolla. Tips for families: Ask for the Bay side (private beach) suites as they have large kitchens. The play ground is on the beach for the kids. Yes, the Stern paddle River boat is a little corny, but the kids love cruising on it to watch the fireowrks at Sea world at night. Don't miss the Belmont Park roller coaster. and Mission Beach, two blocks away. Bring your boogie boards, fins and surfing attire as Mission is a classic Southern Calif . surf beach. Tip for travlers to San Diego: A smile, a few "thank you's" in spanish and a couple bucks goes a long way with the room cleaning staff. I got checked in fast, towels, the exact room I wanted and great service every time.

Reviews.Title: “Good location, but old, smelly rooms”
Reviews.Author: billerb
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights, mid-week, and was a bit disappointed. I had read mostly positive reviews on Expedia. It wasn't until after I had booked my trip, but before I departed, did I notice the 'less than stellar' reviews here. My experience was similar to many others posted here. The view was OK. Out our window was the marina - so basically a bunch of boats. It's obviously in the bay, so you are not directly on the ocean. There is a nice beach you can walk to on the other side of the hotel that is decent and clean. It's only about a foot deep for as far as I could see, and no waves, which made it nice for our two-year-old. The pool is decent and the jacuzzi looked nice (although we didn't use it). Although we booked a King bed/Suite, we were given a Queen. We could have had a King, but would have had to downgrade to a studio-style room. The room was spacious and clean, but didn't appear to have been updated for a good 20+ years. I don't know if was the ocean air entering the fabric of the decor, or the lack of proper cleaning, but the room did have a musty/moldy smell that was bothersome, and affected my wife, who has allergies. Our experience with the staff was average. I do notice a bit of a trend in unfavorable staff reviews. We did have two expereiences that are in line with the others here: 1) the maid came the first day around 8AM; a bit early I thought. We had to ask her to come back. 2) Our third and last day, the maid came before check-out time. She cleaned most of the room. We used the room significantly before checkout. Also, we had brought an old pillow we use for travel (quite nasty, I must admit) that the maid must have tucked under the sheets with the other hotel's pillows. Because we didn't see it when we collected our things, we left it. I feel sorry for the people that unmade their bed to find that stinky thing. I would assume that would generate another complaint to the front desk. Seems there is much room for improvement in the area of housekeeping. We paid $139/nt for our rooms, Tues-Wed nights. This was the beginning of September, and I would think slow season, as most schools had just started back up. It was overall a pleasant stay, if not a little overpriced. However, I'm not sure I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “sadly lacking”
Reviews.Author: hrhs
Reviews.Content: Stayed for a week - very noisy at weekends - the bedroom windows don't close properly - and they are right by the pathway very rude staff - especially at breakfast - mission beach reminded us a blackpool or ibiza on a really bad day - a lot of down and outs and lager louts not an ideal place for small children, very distinct lack of eateries nearby - although the fish and chips were great across the road. would not stay here again - there are some much nicer options around the rating of this should be a 3* maximum motel (no where near a resort)

Reviews.Title: “Not to put a dampener on your holiday, but...”
Reviews.Author: BenWestSussex
Reviews.Content: If the Bahia had a school report, it would have "Must Try Harder" stamped all over it. On the surface, it's certainly a pleasant 3-star hotel, but the flaws detract significantly from the overall impression the hotel gives. On the positive side, the room we had was certainly spacious; we were upgraded to a bay-view suite with well-equipped kitchenette and separate bedroom. The staff are generally helpful, and the hotel features a prolific use of live music; in its bar, in the restaurant... even by the pool. Food in the restaurant is very good, although there are very few other places to go within near walking distance for a good meal, with the exception of the excellent Mizu Japanese restaurant. Unfortunately, as mentioned in other reviews, the hotel is in need of updating. Our room smelt damp; age-old stains on the carpet revealed the source. The white bedsheets and towels were the equivalent of a Guest Book, with suntan/make-up/whatever stains dotted about them giving an indication of former residents. And how's this for a horror story: we went out for the day, and returned only to find our door wide open. The maids had failed to close it after they had cleaned our room. Thankfully nothing was stolen. In a separate incident, we were sat in our room one evening watching TV, when a family of four entered, laden with cases. They had been given a key to OUR room in error. Brilliant. Overall the hotel is okay. Potentially it could be so much better. It just needs a bit of attention. While in San Diego, I would recommend visiting the Old Town (direct bus leaves opposite the hotel) and Sea World (if you don't mind rubbing shoulders with a million other tourists). Avoid Mission Beach unless you like the idea of mixing with extras from "Beverley Hills 90210". Fashion Valley is very good for shopping, and while you're there have a meal at The Cheesecake Factory.

Reviews.Title: “OK.. but needs updating”
Reviews.Author: M0MMY
Reviews.Content: I understand why the mixed reviews here.. we had a garden view room but was upgraded to a bay front suite.. VERY HAPPY for that.. or I would have been writing one of those bad reviews.. our unit did need some upgrades ( the whole place needs it) but the location made ALL the difference in the world. Being an owner of 3 units at the Maui Eldorado resort the comparison gave me a good feeling about our staff and property. When i checked in I was not given any details of the resort had to figure it out on my own.. the maids did a wonderful job working with what they had (the run down unit).. over all its all about location location location.. if I were to stay there again I would make sure I got a unit with the bay view (on the side that does not have the pubic beach on it)..

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Great Location.”
Reviews.Author: wyomingwapiti
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews I was skeptical about the Bahia, but went for it anyhow. And I dont regret it. My family and I were there for 6 nights in August 2005. The rates seemed high to me (about $180/night), but when you compare it to other resorts in the San Diego area they are right in line. And considering the prime location for Mission Beach and Sea World you cant go wrong. We dont vacation very often so I wanted this to be a good one. Upon checking in we were upgraded to a room with a kitchen, which I would highly recommend. I was able to go to a nearby grocery store about 3 miles away (Von's) and buy some groceries and snack foods to save money. The full size refrigerator was a nice touch. Our 2nd story hotel room was at the far end of the resort and featured a balcony. Room was very clean and spacious. Maid service was awesome. She did a great job which we appeciated. The pool and spa was very nice also. They had live music there on some days. There is also a poolside bar (although we smuggled in our own drinks for far cheaper). I really liked the location of this hotel. It was within walking distance of Mission Beach and some pretty good restaurants if you dont want to drive. Roberto's Taco Shop offered some pretty good eats as did Fat Boyz Pizza. We drove down the Mission Blvd about 4 miles near Pacific Blvd? where there were alot of other restaurant choices. My 8 year old daughter loved the seals. This was a highlight for her. We didnt eat at the Bahia resort. I would have but it seemed a bit pricey for my budget. Their food sure looked and smelled delicious though! We did the Bahia boat cruise one night to view the fireworks. We really enjoyed this also. Very relaxing. I liked this resort. I think alot of the people that rate this resort poorly get bad rooms (which may be the case).

Reviews.Title: “what a dump!”
Reviews.Author: bklynguy
Reviews.Content: hotel should be embarrassed. Rooms are in desparate need of upgrading and the rates they charge are grossly overpriced. Never again. Save your money - for less money, you can stay at a Hilton!

Reviews.Title: “must depend on your room type”
Reviews.Author: E&JJJ
Reviews.Content: stayed here for 3 nights, rather worried having read previous reviews, and having seen the rear view of some of the beach chalets...BUT we were given 2 fabulous studio rooms in the 4 storey block right at the end of the resort. The rooms were large with kitchenettes and verandas overlooking (ours) the panoramic bay, and our children's overlooked the grounds where they could watch the fireworks at Sea World and the bright lights of the boats and fairground. It may well depend on which room you get as to whether you will like this place or not. The chalets seemed to have no privacy, the occupants would have to draw their curtains and deny themselves the fabulous views and we did see beach parties, noisy and raucous with groups of teenagers on the Gleeson road side. Altogether, if we could be assured the same types of rooms again, we would return here.

Reviews.Title: “This so called "resort" was so horrible we checked out 5 mins after checking in”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I booked this trip after seeing their amazing website..."step into paradise" (???!!) After a much anticipated 2 month wait, the day finally arrived when we were to check into this so called "paradise". When we pulled in, the hotel and grounds were so run down and old, I tried my hardest to not immediately suggest we leave. We went ahead and struggled to find a parking spot, there was no bellman, than walked into a tiny, dirty lobby that makes the Super 8 look like its 4 stars. ..I am not kidding. I mean not to be a snob, but when you think resort, don't you think relaxation, beautiful grounds and friendly service? The staff were not friendly, they checked us in for the ridiculous price of of almost $300 a night. My boyfriend and I decided to at least see what the rooms were like and to give it a shot. After all, there were several families running around with smiles on their faces, we figured they can't be happy if they were being ripped off. Unfortunately these smiling people must be like the ones who wrote good reviews here, they think if they're paying good money, they must be getting a good deal. (Not so!!) So after being informed to "try and find a parking spot outside our bungalow and if they're all taken, oh well" we pulled in to a spot nearby and again tried to remain hopeful. As soon as we walked up to the door, there was a tray full of half eaten food and bugs. Nice entrance. Than, we walked in and the only way to describe it is a nuclear halocaust meets Golden Girls. It was so dark and dirty and pathetic, we immediately walked out and asked to check out. I felt so bad for my boyfriend who works 70+ hours a week, we just needed a little getaway, and we got this dump after being fooled by their website. Luckily we re-grouped and went to Disneyland!

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We had a good time at this hotel. We had a few worries having read some of the other reviews, but once we got there we found that the place was indeed very nice and well kept. Yeah, some of it is a little older, but for the most part the grounds / rooms were nice. We stayed in one of the condos / suites. The kitchen was pretty basic but had a spacious refrigerator. The kitchen water was horrible to drink, however - just had a funky taste to it. Also, the fold out beds from the couch were uncomfortable. Eventually people were sleeping on the couches rather than using the foldouts. However, we really enjoyed the pool / jacuzzi. Plus, the hotel is located about 5 minutes (walking) from the beach / shopping / restaurants, so we certainly couldn't complain about the location. The rooms were nice and we didn't have any problems with noise. Overall, I'd stay here again... the location is fantastic and overall we had a good time.

Reviews.Title: “Better than I expected, glad I didn't listen to reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just came back from 10 wonderful days at the Bahia Hotel. This is a great family hotel/resort. The staff was friendly all the time and answered all of our questions, and boy did we have a lot of them. It was our first time in San Diego and we rented a car and needed a lot of directions. The room was cleaned every day at the exact same time. I found this rare when you stay in hotels. Our maid was very friendly and gave us whatever we wanted. The beach at the hotel is okay, but the view wonderful. The pool was great, I liked the fact that you can't get into the pool area unless you have a room key. My children are 13 and 11 and really loved this hotel. The restaurant is good food most of the time. I would highly recommend this hotel for its location. We walked to the beach and boardwalk everyday. Beautiful sunsets. You are very close to Sea World. If you want a clean room, easy access and friendly service this is the family resort for you. The people who didn't like this hotel are ridiculous and should stay downtown San Diego. You don't have to pay to park your car, which at some hotels is a lot of money. THis is a relaxed atmosphere. Great time, would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Resort - good family place”
Reviews.Author: l36t
Reviews.Content: My family of four stayed at the Bahia in August 05. If you are looking for large, romantic, private, plush rooms with a lot of extra's - don't come here. There are several room options, some better than others, as the resort has obviously expanded over time. The rooms facing the west are the best choice. We had a courtside room near the shuffleboard courts that was fine for our family. Nothing fancy and it was old, but well maintained - a small fridge allowed us to keep treats and drinks cold for the beach. This resort is great for families. You can walk to Mission Beach (about a 8 minute walk to the sand). While it is crowded with tourists, you can walk down the way to get away from the big crowds pretty easily. There is a cool wave machine at an open air bar/restuarant called the WaveHouse at Mission Beach which is neat to watch. The drinks there are horrible though - don't waste your money. The pool at the Bahia is great - it is large with a 10 feet deep section, as well as a roped off shallow area for kids. There is a large hot tub too. There are science "camps" you can sign the kids up for at the pool. There is a small bar there during the day and musicians all over the place playing fun music. There is a small "seal" pool you can walk around and view two rescued seals (kids love that). The majority of the grounds are beautiful - especially a walking path that has a very tropical feel to it. Food at the restaurant was reasonable and good. One note: many jelly fish were present at Mission Beach - saw several kids get stung. May just be the time of year, but the lifeguards have vinegar they can spray on the sting to help with the pain. Saw several people try to wash off the area in the showers and it appeared that tap water made it hurt worse.

Reviews.Title: “Not What I Expected”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia at the recommendation of a travel agent who had visited there quite a few years ago. We reserved a Bay View Suite and were very disappointed with the "view" as it was beyond the shrubs and roadway and cars/motor homes behind the unit we stayed in. I expected to be able to step out onto a patio, have a small grass area, then some sand, then some water from the way the room was presented to us. The patio itself was dirty, piled with debris and the lounge chairs were extremely dirty. Never even sat out there. The room itself and furnishings were on the shabby side and the bathroom definitely left something to be desired. We had to call for more towels each day as they never left enough for our family of four. On the positive side, the grounds were very well maintained and the food was very reasonable and tasty. Bottom line, it definitely was not worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Only for the Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Just stayed here with three kids July 19, 20 & 21 , 2005. Expect a bunch of 1950's two-story, painted concrete block MOTELS (inside and out) around a long driveway and you've got it right. Cars park in front of the first floor rooms On either level, the people in the rooms adjacent to yours, walk right past your windows- a couple of which are the old, glass, jalousie windows which could be disassembled from the exterior (leaving only a screen). This made me wonder if theft was a problem, but I never asked. Definitely try for the west facing rooms. They front their little private beach (which is useless- too steep for little kids and too boring for adults) but quiet and scenic. The east facing rooms front on a public drive cars would be driving past your door. The grounds were decent. Pool was small but good. The walk to Mission Beach and the amusement park is, by far, the best amenity. We did the free evening paddle boat cruise - our kids ( 6, 8 and 10) enjoyed it. Last thing, take the 20 minute drive north to La Hoya Shores beach Best rolling waves for boogie boarding or body surfing and they finish with long flat water for little kids. Fantastic !!

Reviews.Title: “Shabby Accomodations”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from an extended 4th of July weekend at the Bahia "Resort". The accomodations were very shabby and outdated (no fan in bathroom, maid service was not very thorough and a kitchenette with no microwave). I had to call the front desk on Saturday night at 3:30 in order to have our neighbors above us, keep it down. They were shouting from the balcony to their friends downstairs all night! Parking was atrocious being so close to the beach. If I had to give compliments it would be that the pool was heated, we were close to Sea World and walking distance to Belmont and there was hot water coming from the shower. This hotel is not very kid-friendly. I used their Live help line to find out about any kid friendly amenities and the operator could not list any besides kids meals. Believe me there is a reason why there is limited pictures of the resort on the web page, it is really nothing to look at. Not worth the $. Also, please let the seals go, it is very upsetting that they are cooped up that way.

Reviews.Title: “won't stay here again”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: While parked to unload our suitcases, our car was hit by some local who was driving through the parking lot to apparently "visit" a guest. He seemed drunk and his girlfriend called me all sorts of bad names. Our rental car was damaged and the resort officer who took the report seemed to be sympathetic with the locals. Sorry Bahia, but you can't just hit a parked car! I don't care if local or not! We had to change the rental car, give another report, before we could begin our vacation. Then they keep these sad little seals in a mini pool - not fun to watch as there is more attractive wild life all around San Diego. Let the poor seals go! The kids felt so sorry for them! Will not stay here again - staff is short and too busy all the time and with the public just speeding through the parking lot, it will be more relaxing to find a better hotel - there are plenty to chose from. Oh, and check out very early, there is a huge line if you check out by 11.

Reviews.Title: “2 star hotel in 4 star setting”
Reviews.Author: jenga4eva
Reviews.Content: We found Bahia to be mostly a pleasant place to stay. It's best to think of Bahia as a 2 star hotel with 4 star grounds and a 4 star location -- if you want truly upscale digs, this is not the place for you. On the other hand, if you plan to spend most of your time out and about, the Bahia offers a wonderful setting for enjoying SD. The gardens, swimming pool, and private beach were all lovely touches. We were upgraded to the 'Bay View Deluxe Suite' and found it very roomy (perfect for us since one of us had to spend a lot of time hanging out at the room while the other was at work). The kitchenette was reasonably spacious and well appointed. The furnishings of the room were a bit outdated and dingy; likewise, the bathroom floor laminate was in need of replacing. All in all, a nice place to stay, but deserving the "resort" label only for its location and beautiful landscaping. Skip the hotel bar - uninspired happy hour offerings made us wish we had. The restaurant was good for reasonably priced and tasty breakfasts.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Casey C
Reviews.Content: We stayed Sunday until Friday at the Bahia and had a great time! The hotel is very nice and the pool and hot tub are great. We had a room 2nd floor balcony room overlooking the bay, and my only complaint is that we had to share our balcony with another room. We didn't know the people and it was a little odd to have the curtains open during the day. I wish they would have told us this before we checked it. We didn't spend much time in the room so it didn't matter that much to us. It's easy to get around San Diego from the Bahia. The bus is across the street and it connects to the trolly to take u downtown. The hotel is very nice and the beach is about a 5 minute walk. I would stay there again, we had a great time! If you have any questions, feel free to contact me. I came from across the country and I know how hard it is to make travel plans to a location you don't know!:)

Reviews.Title: “Very Pleasant”
Reviews.Author: jrhey54vegas
Reviews.Content: I stayed Wed until Saturday before Memorial Day and it was a very pleasant place - low key and sort of a retro look. Location is wonderful. I had a wonderful 2nd floor balcony room overlooking the bay. Yes, Gleason Rd was there too, but didn't notice any overwhelming noise. The gardens and other foliage were beautiful. Restaurant and gift shop prices were reasonable - breakfast buffet for $8.95 included fruit, eggs, sausage, coffee and juice. Bahia Belle cruise was fun - though bring a jacket if you go on top! The only caution - rooms are a little dated (but it adds to the atmosphere) and you could get a room with very little privacy and/or a dark view. I saw some of those. Like most places - you need to know what's important to you and decide if the place has it. I wanted a pleasant place near the bay and found it. If you're looking for hot night life or elegance, go elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We were so scared to stay here after reading other reviews that we almost changed our hotel! I'm so glad we didn't switch to a different place!! My husband, my 3 year old daughter and I stayed at the Bahia for 7 nights. We upgraded to a studio room that has a kitchenette for only $25 more per night. We checked in a were given a room in the dreaded "tower", and what made me more nervous was that it was on the 4th floor, directly under their main convention/party room. These were things that I read horrible reviews on the net about, and I thought my worst fears were about to come true. On our way over to the "tower" we noticed the beautiful grounds and pool. The landscaping was so well done, we felt like we were entering an oasis. The whole resort is enclosed by gates and the walls of the hotel. The gates are closed and locked at night, so the only way to enter is by going directly by the lobby. We got up to our room and opened the door, expecting to see mold covered walls and expecting to be knocked over by the smell of mildew, but thankfully nothing like that was to be seen. Our room was very clean, no funky smell, larger than I expected and had a beautiful view of the bay. The king sized bed was firm yet comfortable--no lumps or bows. The kitchen was even fully stocked with dishes, pots, and pans--even a tea kettle! The tower at Sea World was directly across the bay from us, we could see it lit up every night. One night we even got to enjoy fireworks as we sat on the balcony. The room had all the standard amenities-cable TV with HBO and a couple other premium free movie channels, balcony, etc... The bathroom was very clean too, I saw no mildew--and I looked!! The showerhead didn't seem to be too low like others have said. The maid service was excellent, they even washed our dirty dishes every day! My daughter had stuffed some little plastic lizards and other toys in the bed without us knowing and the maids piled them on the table in a nice little pile for her. The heated pool was gorgeous with painted murals and a 32 person hot tub!!! Very family friendly. The garden at the Bahia was beautiful too, definately worth taking a few minutes to stroll through. And don't miss the sea lions next to the restaurant. Pacific beach was within walking distance, with a couple small playgrounds on it. There is a street with a public parking lot between our building and the bay, but it is closed and locked down at night so that no one can enter after 10:00 pm., cutting down on noise. We actually parked there most of the time. Only a couple complaints: *There was a party in the convention room above us on Saturday night (which happened to be the day we chose to rest). The music was very loud with bass thumping, but the front desk did call to warn us that there was going to be an event and to call if there were any problems. It was all over by midnight. *We had booked the hotel and airfare through Travelocity and prepaid the trip. When we checked out, I asked if there was an incidental charge on the room for a phone call we had made (they do charge $0.75 per local call). She said no, there was just the charge for the room and taxes. She showed me the breakdown for 5 nights and that $450 was due. I told here we had prepaid everything throught Travelocity. She punched some buttons on the computer and said "Oh, okay, you're good to go." So, probaby just a small mistake on their part, but it makes me wonder if my card would have been charged if I hadn't took the time to officially check out. So, overall the Bahia made our San Diego trip great! It wouldn't have been the same in a small, generic hotel room on the strip. I'll definately stay there next time I'm in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Poor hotel, poor customer service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Room smelled very strong of mold and mildew! Sheets too short for the bed. We had a king sized bed and the motel (it is not a resort) did not have fitted sheets. Complained to the management about a "convention" that was outside of our room. Participants of the convention felt free to leave, coats, cameras, and video cameras on our lounge chairs. Loud DJ, blowing whistles. Management told us that they would send security- never did. Asked management for directions to a winery, was told that they would call us with directions- never did. Room faced the bay, but never got any sunshine- probably why it smelled so bad. Not worth the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “You can do better...especially for this price!”
Reviews.Author: westernwilson
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on the recommendation of a friend, and were really disappointed. In stark contrast to a very slick and inviting website, the Bahia is an ugly, old motor court, unconvincingly spruced up and run on the cheap. Although the wind-sheltered pool and the Latino service staff were delightful, the accommodations were strictly motel and very pricey at that. We stayed in their top of the line Mission Bay Suite, ghastly, and horribly cramped for our family of 5 (double beds only were available). We would have been far, far better off to get two adjoining rooms, if for nothing else than two bathrooms. Our single kept plugging, sigh. And the use of ill fitting mattress covers and too-small flat sheets meant the bed unmade itself as soon as you got into it. We fought sliding sheets all night. If you do decide that the Bahia's pool and 3 block proximity to Mission Beach are for you, DO NOT STAY in the east side of the hotel, on which all the rooms in the low blocks and half the tower rooms face Gleason Road, a public road frequented by local park goers which is also used by the Bahia as a service road for all suppliers. A steady stream of traffic roared by our shabby patio all day (a nightmare if you have small kids), and motor homes parked illegally there all night (shame on the municipality AND the Bahia for not insisting on enforced parking regs there). For less noise stay on the side facing Santa Barbara Cove, and request distance from the tower rooms at the end. The hotel beaches are NOT good for swimming. Because the Bahia is a motor court style hotel, and because all the low rise units have their bedrooms facing the motor court, and all the beds are positioned under the windows, we found the noise began early (with the 5 am squeaky wheeled newspaper cart, sigh) and often ended late with Spring Break partyers returning loudly to their rooms. The fact that the cheap unit doors cannot be shut quietly meant door slamming 24 hours a day. In our opinion, this is not a hotel for you if you have toddlers. Rooms are either on a busy road, a beach (not suitable for swimming, BTW) or have small, climbable wrought iron balconies...all present significant safety hazards for small children.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad”
Reviews.Author: au175
Reviews.Content: I stayed her last year and the pics on the website seemed very impressive. However the rooms are a little dated even though they are very big. We had an upgrade to a Suite which had a kitchen, sitting area and big sliding door windows overlooking the private beach area. Hotel is walking distance of Mission beach and a few good eateries. Hotel has a small pool with a nice jacuzzi and a small gym. Also they have 3 tennis courts which dont ususally get used during the day. Overall the stay was satisfactory but if I went to SD again I would look to stay elsewhere as it was a little pricey for what it is.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Bahia”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My friends and I went to San Diego for Spring Break, and I had spent hours searching for a good hotel near the beach. We had booked the Bahia before I read all the reviews. Most of them were poor, and I was hesitant to stay there. Well it was a great place, so close to Mission and Pacific Beach and the boardwalk (maybe like a 5 minute walk!) The hotel was beautiful and clean, AND we got upgraded to the Governors Suite for NO extra cost! That was the best part- our room was excellent, great view, kept clean all week. There were no smells or bug problems at all, but then again we had the suite and I am not sure about the other rooms... I just wanted to clarify that the Bahia is not misleading in its pictures, it is a beautiful place. Just make sure to book a room in the part closest to the Lobby, it has 5 floors, other than the other rooms that are all on ground-level, farther from the lobby. If you stay in this building, your stay should be great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort”
Reviews.Author: LVSaint
Reviews.Content: Been here twice. First time we stayed in a Garden View Room overlooking Mission Bay. This is one of the cheapest rooms if not the cheapest. It was small and a bit damp and fairly dated but not unpleasant. The plus was that the patio door opens to nice walkway with palms and view across the perimeter road out to Mission Bay. The second stay was a much nicer. Booked 2 nights in a Bay Front room overlooking Santa Barbara Cove and marina. Slightly bigger, airier room with sliding door to patio, lawn and beach - very pleasant view and surroundings. Great for kids since there is a playground on the beach near these rooms. I managed to get a free upgrade for the second night to a Bay Front Deluxe room a few rooms down. Lovely room with seperate lounge and kitchen opening out to patio and beach. Very relaxing and nice to have that much more space. All in all - nice location and grounds, good for families, basic rooms not exactly luxurious.

Reviews.Title: “Bahia Hotel- Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: kelly898
Reviews.Content: We stayed a the Bahia for Valentines Day weekend. We got a studio room which was very clean and roomy. I loved the big porch and window. We had a nice view. The staff was very helpful and courteous. Loved being so close to the beach and the bahia belle is a great way to get to the pacific beach nightlife for free! It was a great trip!

Reviews.Title: “nice winter vacation hotel”
Reviews.Author: KathleenLisson
Reviews.Content: I stayed with a female friend during the first week of December, 2004. We were upgraded to a bayview room, with kitchen. This hotel is VERY convenient to the beach, she took the three block walk to the ocean every morning while I slept in. There is a laundry facility on the 3rd floor of our building, treadmills, huge jacuzzi and heated pool. Next door is a sushi place with half off sushi till 6:30 pm - nearby walking distance is Carl's Jr., cheap mexican place and minimart. Short drive to more restaurants on Sports Arena blvd. Relaxing way to take advantage of the warm SD weather in the winter.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place to stay”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I stayed during Spring Break in 2003 on the ground floor of one of the smaller buildings and it was beautiful! The sliding glass door covered the entire wall and gave us a view of the lagoon, hearing the water was very soothing. The room was clean and the staff was curteous. the room was spacious and we didnt feel crowded at all. We are planning another trip there this spring break

Reviews.Title: “Don't get the top floor...”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: If you get a room at the hotel tower, change or refuse it immediately for above you is a conference hall they rent out for weddings/conventions. Three nights of sleep were a write off because of the noise that came through the floor during different events. The next problem is the next morning at 5am they decided to clean up and hence there were tables and chairs banging everywhere... Management did nothing after we complained at morning..

Reviews.Title: “Don't waste your money”
Reviews.Author: TraceBonaise
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed over the 4th of July in 2004. I am still having nightmares. The place was dirty, loud and disgusting. Cars could be heard all night in and out of the parking lot. I could hear people next door partying until all hours. The beach was dirty and yes, there is a huge drop off from the sand to the water. I couldn't believe what I was paying for what we got. I will say the restaurant food was good. However, that is the only kind word I can give. We ended up leaving early.

Reviews.Title: “don't do it”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: This was the last stop on my summer holiday this year and I was very nervous after reading the reviews here. It was worse than I could ever have thought possible. The staff at check in were incredibly rude and totally unhelpful. To my horror we were staying in the last tower right at the back looking out on to the public car park. I was less than impressed with the security aspect of it, the doors to the tower are permently open! The room was pitch black when I opened the door so I found my way to the curtains and for a second was pleased with the veiw until the stench hit me. It was an overpowering smell of damp. I thought maybe it just needed to be aired so I didn't complain. We had arrived late after a long drive so we just had a quick look around before we went to the " restuarant" for dinner. The queue of people getting in to cabs should have been a warning to us. There were including us 10 people in the room and we were told that if we wanted to sit outside we would have to wait as there was a rush on!!!! So we said inside was fine, with a huge sigh the hostess pointed at a table. The service was some of the worst I have ever had. The menu was interesting to say the least, I chose the angel hair pasta because it was the least vile thing there. If you like your pasta in huge clumps with mouldy cheese added to it before it gets to you, then this is the place for you. The waitress came back for our bill which came to 40 odd dollars saw the hundred dollar note and had the cheek to ask if we wanted change!!! The walk back to our hell hole was when I really started to hate the place, there are no lights unless the people in the little houses leave their lights on so you have to walk on an uneven tarmac road in the pitch black. The smell got worse in our room with the result that we had to keep spraying perfume to mask it. We didn't bother complaining after having witnessed the check in staff and those in the cafe, we just stayed out as much as possible. I would never stay in that dump again as long a I live for any amount of money. The whole place needs to be knocked down and rebuilt. It is filthy, old, dingy and disgusting. If you don't mind having to wear shoes all the time and using bottled water to clean your teeth and rusting taps and mouldy walls and celings don't bother you then this is the place for you.

Reviews.Title: “Great View”
Reviews.Author: Robochop
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Bahia for 15 nights from 13th August 2004. We had a bay view studio on the second floor. The room was large & clean - no smells and our maid service was good. The view from the balcony was beautiful, and the fireworks each night an added bonus. We did not notice any noise from the cars in the street below although on our first night only we heard a few doors slam. The hotel is definiteley much busier at the weekends. We had room service a couple of times and the food was good. The sealion, although not very active was nice to watch, and my son was allowed to feed her once. Her pool was always clean. The staff were pleasant to deal with, and the consierge extremely knowledgeable It is ideally located to many attractions - Seawold just 5 minutes away, 30 mins drive to the Zoo and an hour or so from the Wild Animal Park. Mission beach is a short walk. The pool was lovely and not busy at all during the week and close to our room. On the down side, it is true about the shower heads - they are too low, although I managed perfectly well washing my hair and am 5'8" tall. A six footer with lots of hair may struggle. The bathroom itself, although spotlessly clean, was in need of a makeover. The fan did not work and my husband had to tighten the screws on the bath tap each night to enable us to adjust the temperature. We found the beds uncomfortable. Despite these small nuisances we had a fantastic holiday and would certainly visit San Diego again.

Reviews.Title: “Stay here only for Location, but pay a lot for it!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Like the other reviewers, I was apprehensive in staying at this hotel. And after staying in this hotel, it's not what you call a hotel worthy of the amount you pay for the kind of room you get, but maybe worthy of paying for LOCATION. We stayed in the Cabrillo Suites next to the public parking lot, and every single night we got the chance to see the fireworks from Seaworld. And on most nights we also got the chance to listen to the noise from the parking lot from a sundry of people playing music to driving up and down the parking lot lane with their suped up engines. As for inside the room, the carpets were really dirty! The bathroom also needed a good scrubbing and the tiles in the bathtub were broken with mold growing in the cracks. The bed in our room was a king sized bed with a huge sump in the middle where two people would fall naturally into it. No smell except for lingering cigarette smoke in our room. The sliding glass door latch was broken so it was mandatory to use the bolt on the floor to keep the door close as we were on the ground floor level. If you have little kids, forget about them taking a bath, there's no way to stop up the drain. Housekeeping is spotty, sometimes you get clean glasses, sometimes your garbage sits for an extra day, and sometimes the kitchen is cleaned. This is not a place we'll be staying again in the future. We'll go stay at a Courtyard by Marriott or a Residence Inn.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely Hotel - Great Pool”
Reviews.Author: Amandamanx
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bahia Christmas 2003 with my family. We were delighted with our room, great views and spacious. The room was very clean and had a good supply of toileteries etc. The rooms were cleaned every day and to a very high standard - even on Christmas Day! The Christmas Buffet was fit for a king and the steam cruise around the bay after lunch is not to be missed! We were delighted also with the resident sealion. Children were very well catered for in the restaurants. Only down side was possibly the area, there is not much else to do - and you have to drive to get everywhere, not much in walking distance. Would certainly stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place for Watersports”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I had a great time at this hotel. At first I was concerned by some of the comments I read about the condition of the hotel but I found that they were untrue. True, I spent most of my time out-of-doors at the beach and on the water. They have a very well-equipped watersports department & fitness center. I also found the restaurant food to be very tasteful. Give this hotel a try if you want to have fun an the beach.

Reviews.Title: “it was lovely”
Reviews.Author: GLMDesigns
Reviews.Content: I don't understand these negative reviews of the Bahia - I was very apprehensive after these reviews, but I really liked the Californian, laid-back feel to the hotel, very resorty. The room was fine, we had a suite, very roomy, and nice compared to staying in just a standard room. Location is excellent, staff was great, what is everyone complaining about? You know it's not a luxuryhotel going in, it is what it is. Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: “mixed”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Mixed felling about the Bahia. The room was large(studio suite bayside). The kitchen was ok. Stove/oven half normal size, no microwave, full size fridge. The closet really did smell awful. The whole room is outdated. The bay is a great place for early risers to collect seashells. The so called private beach is only 1/4 of the resort. The rest is public beach. That is where our room was. I was shocked by how many R.V.'s were parked and camping tents and all an the bahia parking lot. They even blocked the view for some of the guests. You do have the ocean 2-3 blocks away. and the Bahia Belle boat was fun. Not worth the cost not even close. You are paying for location. We were able to see the seaworld fireworks everynight from our suite. Stay there for great location. Don't have ANY expectations of a nice hotel. It just needs a lot of work. NOT worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, but needs major renovation!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Bahia many years ago as a child... This summer we took our two kids for a few days. The kids loved it - great pool, playground on the beach, lots of boats and birds to look at, etc. Easy walk to Belmont amusement park. Cafe and room service were fine. Good drinks poolside. The hotel operates a New Orleans-style paddle boat from the Bahia to their other property on the other side of the Bay, which is free to guests. We all enjoyed that. Hubby and I were majorly disappointed with our suite. It was in need of a major renovation - bathroom was "icky", permanent wet spot on the carpet from a toilet leak, smelled of mildew throughout, no screen on patio door so I couldn't keep it open at night (hello - heard of West Nile virus?), furnishings and beds needed to be replaced, poor lighting, overall dorm room decor. I would not go back unless they do the renovations. Perhaps the Tower rooms are more up to date but the suites are showing their age.

Reviews.Title: “Room location is important”
Reviews.Author: hillmel
Reviews.Content: Took grandkids in june 2004. Selected Bahia because of location. The couch in living room was ugly and looked dirty-two of the blankets had holes in them-both one bedroom suites were clean-aircondioning system did not really keep bedroom cool.BUT you can not beat the location including short walk to ocean and amusement park. One of the kids got sick and housekeeping came right away to help with mess. I now see why so many of the reviews speak to room location on the property-we were in top floor -rooms 191 and 193 which is on the Mission Bay side and view is boring and acess to beach inconvient. BUT rooms on the Santa Barbara Cove side, called private beach, have tons of ambiance-walk right out of room to grass and clean beach and interesting view. I suggest you get a copy of the hotel map before making reservations so you can get a feel of how room location will effect your stay.

Reviews.Title: “Makes Motel 6 Look Good at twice the price”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The waterfront suites (suite should not be taken literally) are 1 bedroom 1 bath units. The weekday rate during summertime is $400 per night plus. This puts the room cost up with some of the best hotels in the world. While the location is very nice, and the grounds are decent, the room (suite, ha) is a grade below a typical motel 6. This is not a criticism of Motel 6, it is a criticism of the ridiculous rate for the room, and service you receive in return. The rooms are dark, the carpet is the quality of indoor outdoor carpet, the bed is your typical cheap hard bed, the sheets are course and they do not even bother with a fitted sheet on the bottom. The bathroom is not connected to the bedroom directly so you cannot access it without going into the main area. . The room is dated but fairly clean. A two night stay, after the roll away cost ($20 per night) and tax, was roughly $1000 dollars. While that would be fine for a top quality resort, it was far from appropriate for this place The last room I stayed in that compared to this one had shag carpet, a vibrating bed, and ran $29.00 a night. Actually it was probably a bit nicer than the Bahia. Boy do I feel stupid :) Room service is very slow and the coffee on our visit was cold. Not a big deal but worth the mention. Overall the location is great, but do not expect a suite that reflects the price in any way. If you can get a beachfront suite for $99 a night then it would be okay (only due to the location). At four times that amount is outright theft. Hope that helps someone. Bren

Reviews.Title: “just okay”
Reviews.Author: lcoopwood
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a conference in May 2004, just average, the rooms are outdated and feel like a dormitory. The walls are made of cinderblocks. Definitely not a top of the line hotel, but average. The restaurant is fine, nothing spectacular. Nothing special about this hotel.
